We offer scholarships to families that can´t afford our tuition fees. They represent 15% of all the families.

story:
(Espanol al final de la pagina)

My name is Herceny Del Cid, I was born in El Rodeo, Guatemala. In 1990 I was very fortunate to be able to move to Los Angeles, California and receive an education. However, I never forgot my little village that I knew as a young girl. With the help and guidance of my amazing father Lino, my wonderful mother Marina and my brother Kevin, I began a private charity to give back to my childhood community and give the children in my village and surrounding villages, in Santa Rosa Guatemala an opportunity for an education. The proceeds go directly into the hands of the children in the form of school supplies, soccer equipment and food. Most of the children in these villages cannot afford to buy school supplies and without them they cannot go to school.  

Prior to starting the charity I spent my free time going back to El Rodeo volunteering my time, teaching English to the children at various schools. In 2006 my father organized several charitable "pot lucks" to raise money in hopes to build a soccer field in my village. With the help of all the generous donations from our Los Angeles community, we successfully bought a plot of land and built the soccer field! It is called "Estadio Los Angeles" in honor of the generous donation made by the Los Angeles people.

My father Lino, who inspired me to start this charity in 2011 sadly died of stomach cancer in July of 2013. A battle NOT lost but merely ended. I dedicate this charity to him and would like to continue giving back to my Guatemalan community in his honor, and inspire others to do the same.

The charity work can only continue with the support from people like you. Your kind donations will give the children of Guatemala an opportunity for an education and with that education they can help and inspire their community to thrive and prosper. Just a little goes a long way! With your gift, you will help to fulfill these children's hopes and dreams for a better future.

Mi nombre es Herceny Del Cid, nací en El Rodeo, Guatemala. En 1990 yo fui muy afortunado de venir a Los Ángeles, California, y recibir una educación. Nunca me e olvidado de mi pequeño pueblo que yo conoci cuando era niña. Con la ayuda y la orientación de mi padre Lino, mi maravillosa madre Marina y mi hermano Kevin, comencé una caridad privada para devolver a mi comunidad y dar a los niños de mi pueblo y de pueblos de los alrededores, en Santa Rosa Guatemala una oportunidad para una educación. Los ingresos hechos aqui van directamente a las manos de los niños en forma de útiles escolares, equipo de fútbol y comida. La mayoría de los niños en estos pueblos no pueden permitirse el lujo de comprar los útiles escolares y sin ellos no pueden ir a la escuela.

Antes de iniciar la caridad pasava tiempo ensenado ingles en la escuela del Rodeo. En 2006 mi padre organizó varias quermes con otros familaires de caridad para recaudar dinero con la esperanza de construir un campo de fútbol en mi pueblo. Con la ayuda de todas las generosas donaciones de nuestra comunidad de Los Ángeles, compramos con éxito un terreno y construyeron el campo de fútbol! Se llama "Estadio de Los Ángeles", en honor a la generosa donación realizada por la gente de Los Ángeles.

Mi padre Lino, quien me inspiró a comenzar esta caridad en 2011, lamentablemente murió de cáncer de estómago en julio de 2013.  Dedico esta caridad a él y me gustaría seguir dando  a mi comunidad guatemalteca en su honor, e inspirar a otros a hacer lo mismo.

El trabajo de caridad sólo puede continuar con el apoyo de personas como usted. Sus amables donaciones darán a los niños de Guatemala una oportunidad para una educación y con la educación que pueden ayudar e inspirar a su comunidad a crecer y prosperar.  Con su regalo, usted ayudará a cumplir con las esperanzas y los sueños de estos niños para un futuro mejor. Gracias.

story:
I’m a former actor turned SCUBA diver based in New York City.  I took this past year to quit acting and pursue a career in diving.   This spring there is an opportunity to really accelerate my journey and fulfill the prerequisites needed to be a dive professional as I've been accepted to a divemaster internship!  

 With your help, In March 2016, I will be traveling to Hoi An, Vietnam .  It will be a difficult four-month training period that will prepare me for the real world of professional SCUBA diving.  With this certification, I will be qualified to safely lead divers into the water.  My mission will be to change lives and alter perspectives on our Oceans .  As a divemaster, I can help to tackle environmental issues concerning our oceans through awareness, and by facilitating a divers direct, intimate relationship to the underwater world.  The closer I can bring people to the ocean, the less they are going to want to harm it.

The particular dive operation that I have chosen in Vietnam, Cham Island Divers has been involved in many conservation projects concerning the Cham Island region's ecological health and I would be a tremendous asset to that continued effort.  Also, the Cham Islands are a UNESCO World Heritage Site!

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cu_Lao_Cham_Marine_Park

Why have I chosen to take this training outside of NYC where I am currently living? Simply put, it is tons cheaper and will take a third of the time as well as putting me in a place where I can make some real change as these island have only recently been protected.  Heres more on the conservation of the Cham islands:

http://www.iucn.org/about/work/programmes/gpap_home/?19020/Vietnams-beauty-bids-to-thwart-the-beast

To fund this mission I need your help!  Through hard work and this campaign,  my goal is to raise $5,200 by FEB. 1st 2016.

Here’s the breakdown of how I will use the funds that you donate:

$400- Registration and book fees. 

$800- Round trip airfare and baggage fees/transfers to Hoi An.

$800/month (X4 months) - Rent/living expenses.  I need to be able to sustain myself for 4 months.  2 for the training + 2 more to work off my fees with the dive shop.  

$300- Additional equipment and exposure protection. (Surface marker, flashlight, rash-guards and dive- skins.)

$500- Emergency funds.  


I'm determined to complete this program whether or not I reach the goal set forth in this campaign.  I believe in my mission to incite environmental change in the underwater world!! 

If you can't donate, that's no problem!  All I ask is that you share this around and help me get the word out to anyone who would be willing to help.

Thank you all so very much for any support you can offer!  

All the best,

-Kyle Smith

 With your help, In March 2016, I will be traveling to Hoi An, Vietnam .  It will be a difficult four-month training period that will prepare me for the real world of professional SCUBA diving.  With this certification, I will be qualified to safely lead divers into the water.  My mission will be to change lives and alter perspectives on our Oceans .  As a divemaster, I can help to tackle
environmental issues concerning our oceans through awareness, and by facilitating a divers direct, intimate relationship to the underwater world.  The closer I can bring people to the ocean, the less they are going to want to harm it.
The particular dive operation that I have chosen in Vietnam, Cham Island Divers has been involved in many conservation projects concerning the Cham Island region's ecological health and I would be a tremendous asset to that continued effort.  Also, the Cham Islands are a UNESCO World Heritage Site!
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cu_Lao_Cham_Marine_Park
Why have I chosen to take this training outside of NYC where I am currently living? Simply put, it is tons cheaper and will take a third of the time as well as putting me in a place where I can make some real change as these island have only recently been protected.  Heres more on the conservation of the Cham islands:
http://www.iucn.org/about/work/programmes/gpap_home/?19020/Vietnams-beauty-bids-to-thwart-the-beast
To fund this mission I need your help!  Through hard work and this campaign,  my goal is to raise $5,200 by FEB. 1st 2016.
Here’s the breakdown of how I will use the funds that you donate:
$400- Registration and book fees. 
$800- Round trip airfare and baggage fees/transfers to Hoi An.
$800/month (X4 months) - Rent/living expenses.  I need to be able to sustain myself for 4 months.  2 for the training + 2 more to work off my fees with the dive shop.  
$300- Additional equipment and exposure protection. (Surface marker, flashlight, rash-guards and dive- skins.)
$500- Emergency funds.  

I'm determined to complete this program whether or not I reach the goal set forth in this campaign.  I believe in my mission to incite environmental change in the underwater world!! 
If you can't donate, that's no problem!  All I ask is that you share this around and help me get the word out to anyone who would be willing to help.
Thank you all so very much for any support you can offer!  
All the best,
-Kyle Smith

story:
Who we are

Positive Impact for Young People CIC was established in 2017 to tackle social exclusion by supporting vulnerable young people aged 11-19 who are disengaged from Education, Employment or Training from Nuneaton, North Warwickshire and surrounding areas.  Positive Impact for Young People CIC use a strength-based approach to develop young people’s skills, increase resilience and re-engage young people into Education, Employment or Training.    

The Bakery

We're extremely excited to announce our brand-new project, The Bakery, a social enterprise that will invest in supporting young people to develop transferable skills and learn the art of baking in a real working environment.

The Bakery is exactly what it says on the tin, serving real, honest and fresh artisan breads, cakes and pastries to the general public and trades. The Bakery project will sustain and support the growth of the organisation, ensuring we work and support more and more young people who need us.

But this is where we need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

We have our premises, our managing director is a trained bakery chef, and has a degree in Youth Work, we even have the young people who need this support. What we require now is to fill our bakery with the equipment we need!

  • We need to raise £10,000 to create the exciting bakery and cafe space we want these young people to feel proud to work in, and for our customers to love to spend time in
     
  • We're offering you the chance to be one of our early investors, by donating your money in return for lifetime membership of our investors club at bronze, silver, gold or platinum level - giving you exclusive discounts at The Bakery
     
  • We've even got some great branded items to give away to our investors
     
  • Whatever we're able to raise through this campaign will all go to supporting vulnerable young people aged 11-19 who are disengaged from Education, Employment or Training from Nuneaton, North Warwickshire and surrounding areas

The Impact

The Bakery will make a huge difference to the lives of local vulnerable young people, allowing them to develop their confidence, knowledge, self-esteem, communication skills and teamwork.

There is no other provision of this type within the local area.

We will focus on young people’s ability to engage in an workplace environment to gain important life skills which will promote sustainability, increase confidence, build teamwork through peer to peer engagement and improve physical and mental well-being, supporting them to reach their full potential.

Risks & Challenges

We're in this for the long-run, but as well as our setup costs, there are ongoing costs for the premises, energy, staffing etc - we're really confident we'll easily be able to cover these costs in the long term - our current plan actually shows us able to reinvest some of our surplus into other local projects for young people.

There's always a risk with starting a new venture like this - but we think it's a risk worth taking to support these vulnerable individuals, allowing them to fulfil their potential.

Other Ways You Can Help

Although financial support would be amazing... if you're not able to help us in that way, there's still so much you can do:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about us - the more the merrier
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share online with your friends
  • We'd also love to hear from you if you'd like to volunteer your time to help us get set up

But, however you can help us... Thank you, from all of us at Positive Impact for Young People

story:
Welcome:

Every child has a right to education, every child has a right to conducive learning environment, but not all children get these rights, Imagine some don't even have a chance to go to good schools leave alone their rights! its unfortunate, its against their wish, circumstances has made them in it, some call it fate! Now imagine if we  stand in the gap and change the lives of these children? what kid of joy we can bring in their lives in their education by each contributing few bucks for their cause? We Empower Child Foundation team , has started this project with our slogan: " standing in the gap and transforming lives.." Our aim is to empower the needy children with school supplies, feeding and clothing in their education for a better future. you are highly welcome to take part in this  initiative.

Who are we?

                                                                                                

Empower Child Foundation  is a group of five members who are dedicated in the transformation of  needy children lives in school,we are in kenya and our current location of operation is in Nairobi remote areas(slums) you can visit our website: www.empowerchildfoundation.org , or our facebook page: www.facebook.com/empowerchildfoundation for more information.

What We  need:


  Our core mission here is to raise funds for this project to enable us to buy learning material donations which we deliver directly to the needy children in various schools here in Kenya.In this campaign, we are targeting to reach 400 kids in five different schools. Our budget for our July donations event  is $3,000 which will be utilized as follows;

  School supplies (writing books,text books, pens, pencils etc) ----$1000

  School uniforms for the children (shirts, shorts,dresses,shoes,socks) ---$500

  Food (feeding program while in school)-----------------------------------$500

  Solar learning lamps initiative----------------------------------------------$500

  Sports equipment -----------------------------------------------------------$300

  Event running expenses------------------------------------------------------$200

                                                                                              Totals ----------  $3,000

Help us reach our goal by  donating via  PayPal check out.

The Impact:



Imangine, transforming the life of a  child who has been raised in slums/ghetto or poverty stricken family who had no hope,future who could have ended up into either being a gangster, prostitute,a begger or any other unworthy living into being a doctor, a pilot, a banker,a mananger or any productive living! Is that not worthy leaving a legacy to them? Our projects are live transforming, changing lives and helping many children    raise above their challenges in school, we have seen a great impact in these children we are helping and their future is promising according to the current performance in their studies. We encourage you to donate and be the start of change in their lives.

Other Ways You Can Help:

You can help us make this campaign known to your friends hence help reach many, we will highly appreciate and God shall bless you.

                                         Thanks in advance,

                                               peter maithya- ECF founder.

story:
What is Lemonade Day?

America was built on the back of small business. Entrepreneurs take risks believing they can realize their dream if they work hard, take responsibility and act as good stewards of their resources. Today’s youth share that optimism, but lack the life skills, mentorship and real-world experience necessary to be successful.

Lemonade Day is a nationwide event that teaches kids the skills they need to be successful in life. Kids learn to set goals, develop a business plan, establish a budget, seek investors, provide customer service, save for the future, and give back to the community. Lemonade Day is the perfect opportunity for a community to show kids they care and train the next generation of entrepreneurs through a free, fun, engaging, and empowering activity.

Lemonade Day is a FREE, step by step program that walks youth from a dream to a business plan, while teaching them the principles required to start and run their own company...a lemonade stand. Inspiring kids to work hard and make a profit, Lemonade Day also teaches them to spend some, save some, and share some by giving back to their community.


Who's in charge?

My name is Chip Conrad. I am a serial entrepreneur from here in the Pacific Northwest. From an early age I knew I wanted to start and run my own business. Since that time I have started 4 businesses of my own and been involved in many other start-ups. Last year I started the Center for Entrepreneurial Education and Development (CEED) and shortly after we adopted the Lemonade Day program, a nationally franchised program that teaches middle schoolers how to start and run their first business...a lemonade stand.

How does it work?

In early March we launch the program by opening up online registration. Simultaneously marketing through TV, radio, print and social media will start to direct audiences to our registration page. Participants sign up and receive and email guiding them to the nearest pick-up locations where they get a backpack full of materials and helpful inserts from our sponsors. From there the mentor and youth participant start their journey towards entrepreneurship by taking part in several of the community events we have planned for them along the way. Then, on May 3rd, they open their lemonade stand putting to use the principles they've learned throughout the experience.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to hit our goal in order for us to pay to execute the program. This covers the required educational materials for the participants and operational expenses in each of our three cities.

Your donation has a massive impact at any level. When you decide to donate $25, you have changed one kids life forever. And when you decide to donate by signing on as a sponsor, the advertising benefits and community engagement are outstanding.

Lemonade Day is an annual program so the extra funds we receive will roll over to next year when we hope to launch to more states here in the west.

How will the funds be used?

The Impact

In Salem last year over 1,000 kids started their first business. In a 4 hour period they sold $30,000 worth of lemonade. What would you have done with the Lemonade Day program if it had been an option when you were in middle school? What would you have done with 14 basic principles teaching you how to start a business? What affect would it have on your career now?
At CEED, we move fast and break things. We took a risk by bringing the first Lemonade Day to the west coast and we broke records. We are now taking more risk than we ever have by expanding so quickly. We have added to that risk by pre-purchasing the licenses and materials to run this program because we feel our community deserves this and we are the organization to bring it to our youth. 

We have formed partnerships with amazing organizations like Oregon Entrepreneurs Network, Technology Association of Oregon, Portland Incubator Experiment, the Chamber of Commerce and Google for Entrepreneurs that give us that reach into all three cities. These organizations bring credibility and know-how to help us execute on the highest level.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help with funds, you are not out of options. Sign up here to join our street team and receive emails with updates and ways you can help spread the word of Lemonade Day in your city.
- Share our campaign and organization with friends, colleagues, and family.
- Like us on Facebook
- Follow us on Twitter @itslemonadeday
- Follow us on Instagram @itslemonadeday

story:
Breve reseña / Campaign Briefing

¡Hola! Mi nombre es Jorge Arturo Fernández. Los que me conocen sabrán que desde hace unos años dedico buena parte de mi vida a generar formas de apoyo amoroso a personas que lo requieren, los que no sepan quién soy, tienen mi palabra de que así es ;). En esta ocasión enfrento junto con un grupo de líderes y emprendedores mexicanos un reto increíble:

Elegimos apoyar a la Asociación 'Escuela Hogar del Perpetuo Socorro Toluca I.A.P', localizada en Blvd. Isidro Fabela norte #937, col. Los Ángeles, CP 50020, Toluca, Edo. de México, México. Esta organización alberga una escuela en la que amorosamente se provee de educación a niñas de familias de escasos recursos y educacón más techo, alimentación y cuidados amrosos a niñas huérfanas. Como podrán imaginar ¡las necesidades que se enfrentan a diario son inmensas!

Tenemos 20 días para generar todo el apoyo posible y asegurar la continuidad de este proyecto ¡Necesitamos tantos corazones compasivos como podamos encontrar! 

Hi! My name is Jorge Fernandez. Those of you who know me will know about my dedication to loving support for humans in need during the past few years. If we happen not to have the pleasure of acquaintance, please take my word on this ;). Recently, an amazing challenge has come upon a group of mexican entrepeneurs and leaders and I:

We made a voluntary commitment of aid towards a local NGO called 'Escuela Hogar del Perpetuo Socorro Toluca I.A.P', (adress: Blvd. Isidro Fabela norte #937, col. Los Ángeles, CP 50020, Toluca, Edo. de México, México). The NGO fosters a home-school that provides both education for girls of underprivileged families and education plus shelter, food and compassionate caring for a group of orphan girls. You can figure out the immense needs they face every day!


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes / What we need and what you get

La meta que tenemos es recaudar $850,000 MXP -o más- para el apoyo integral a la asociación y atender una gran lista de necesidades, entre las que se incluyen:

  1. Becas educativas para las niñas (costo mensual de $500 MXP)
  2. Herrería.
  3. Arreglo del domo de la capilla.
  4. Equipo de jardinería: motosierra.
  5. Adquisición de extintores-
  6. Señalamientos de evacuación y siniestro.
  7. Iluminación de áreas comunes.
  8. Gastos de personal de transporte y cocina.
  9. Laminas de polietileno para cambiar el techo de la lavandería
  10. Pintura para las instalaciones, 
  11. Sellador
  12. Despensas
  13. Artículos de limpieza. 
  14. Papelería
  15. Medicamentos para las niñas
  16. Tenis 
  17. Valoración optométrica y anteojos para las niñas
  18. Juguetes
Estaremos infinitamente agradecidos por cualquier apoyo que decidas brindar. Habrá también formas especiales de reconocimiento según el monto que aportes:
  • ¡Por cada $500MXP, la amorosa y generosa producción de la obra de teatro AMORatados ha aceptado regalarte un boleto para asistir a una de sus funciones! 
  • Si donas $2000MXP, recibirás un agradecimiento personalizado por parte de nuestro grupo y las niñas de la escuela Hogar.
  • Si tu donativo es  de $6000 ¡Eeres nuestro super héroe! Esto es suficiente para apadrinar la educación de una niña por un año. Te llevaremos un día a visitar la asociación para conocer a las hermosas niñas cuya vida aestás apoyando a transformar.
Our goal is to raise at the very least 65, 300USD to support the NGO in a more integral way to fulfill the large list of needs they have provided us, which includes:

  1. Scholarships for the girls living in the house (monthly cost of 38USD)
  2. Ironwork for entrance gate and windows.
  3. Chapel's dome restoration.
  4. Gardening Equipment: chainsaw.
  5. Fire extinguishers.
  6. Emergency route and disaster prevention signs.
  7. Illumination for common areas.
  8. Transportation and kitchen personnel expenditures.
  9. Laundry room fixing.
  10. Wall paint for the buildings, 
  11. Paint sealer.
  12. Basic foods baskets.
  13. Cleaning and sanitizing items. 
  14. Stationery
  15. Medicine for the girls.
  16. Running shoes and footwear.
  17. Eye examination and lenses manufacturing for the girls
  18. Toys
We will be forever grateful for all your donations. Special forms of recognition will be given depending on the amount you chose to give.
  • 38USD ¡We thank you from the bottom of our heart! You will receive an e-mail letter from our team and the girls.
  • 150USD ¡WE LOVE YOU! A personalized thank you from the team and the girls will be awarded.
  • 450USD ¡YOU SUPER HERO! A personal skype call will be scheduled with you from the association so that you know the girls and the team.


El impacto / Impact

  • En México no contamos con redes de apoyo suficientes para proveer a niñas en estas situaciones de vulnerabilidad las herrameintas para  futuro pleno. A través de la Escuela Hogar del Perpetuo Socorro, estas oportunidades son provistas en un modo amoroso y compasivo. Sólo a través de tu generosidad es que la asociación y sus proyectos podrán mantenerse a lo largo del tiempo.
  • De 2010 a la fecha he participado en diversos proyectos de voluntariado en India y México. Además, desde 2011 soy fundador de una ONG que se dedica al apoyo integral a familias en situación de pobreza en India, teniendo éxito en mantener nuestro programa de becas para los hijos de dos familias durante tres años. Puedes contar con mi palabra y experiencia para saber que tu colaboración está siendo dirigida a una organización seria y que vale la pena apoyar.
  • Hoy más que nunca, nuestro país requiere de todo el amor y solidaridad que los seres humanos podamos darle, tu ayuda es un enorme grano de arena para contribuir a generar un México más amoroso.

  • Mexico's government and social programs are not enough to support girls in these vulnerability situations to achieve a prosperous future. the NGO we are choosing to support delivers such care and provides the girls with tools for a better life. It is only through your love and generous contribution that they will be able to stand the test of time and mantain their projects.
  • Since 2010 I've participated in several volunteer programs both in India and Mexico. Also, back in 2011 I founded an NGO in India that aims for the integral support of families living in poverty, for the past three year we've successfully managed to keep a scholarship program for the children of two Indian families. You can count on my word and experience to know that your support is being directed to a real, worthy project.
  • Now, more than ever, Mexico needs all the love and solidarity that humen beings can give. Your help is a huge support to help create a more loving society.

    Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar / Other ways you can help

    Entendemos que la contribución monetaria no es la única forma de apoyo. Si por ahora no es una posibilidad, ayudanos esparciendo esta campaña entre tus conocidos y con las herramientas que aquí se presentan para pasar la voz ¡El tiempo corre! 

    Si no es ahora ¿cuándo? Si no eres tú ¿quién?

    We recongize money is not always possible as means to contribute. If it is not a possibility for you at the moment, here are other ways you can help:

    • Spread the word! among your acquaintances and loved ones. Some help might come up!
    • Use the site's tools for promotion
    Time is running!
    If it ain't now... When? If it ain't you... Who will?

Los que me conocen sabrán que desde hace unos años dedico buena parte de mi vida a generar formas de apoyo amoroso a personas que lo requieren, los que no sepan quién soy, tienen mi palabra de que así es ;). En esta ocasión enfrento junto con un grupo de líderes y emprendedores mexicanos un reto increíble:
Elegimos apoyar a la Asociación 'Escuela Hogar del Perpetuo Socorro Toluca I.A.P', localizada en Blvd. Isidro Fabela norte #937, col. Los Ángeles, CP 50020, Toluca, Edo. de México, México. Esta organización alberga una escuela en la que amorosamente se provee de educación a niñas de familias de escasos recursos y educacón más techo, alimentación y cuidados amrosos a niñas huérfanas. Como podrán imaginar ¡las necesidades que se enfrentan a diario son inmensas!
Tenemos 20 días para generar todo el apoyo posible y asegurar la continuidad de este proyecto ¡Necesitamos tantos corazones compasivos como podamos encontrar! 
Hi! My name is Jorge Fernandez. Those of you who know me will know about my dedication to loving support for humans in need during the past few years. If we happen not to have the pleasure of acquaintance, please take my word on this ;). Recently, an amazing challenge has come upon a group of mexican entrepeneurs and leaders and I:
We made a voluntary commitment of aid towards a local NGO called 'Escuela Hogar del Perpetuo Socorro Toluca I.A.P', (adress: Blvd. Isidro Fabela norte #937, col. Los Ángeles, CP 50020, Toluca, Edo. de México, México). The NGO fosters a home-school that provides both education for girls of underprivileged families and education plus shelter, food and compassionate caring for a group of orphan girls. You can figure out the immense needs they face every day!
   Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes / What we need and what you get La meta que tenemos es recaudar $850,000 MXP -o más- para el apoyo integral a la asociación y atender una gran lista de necesidades, entre las que se incluyen:



Becas educativas para las niñas (costo mensual de $500 MXP)


Herrería.


Arreglo del domo de la capilla.


Equipo de jardinería: motosierra.


Adquisición de extintores-


Señalamientos de evacuación y siniestro.


Iluminación de áreas comunes.


Gastos de personal de transporte y cocina.


Laminas de polietileno para cambiar el techo de la lavandería


Pintura para las instalaciones, 


Sellador


Despensas


Artículos de limpieza. 


Papelería


Medicamentos para las niñas


Tenis 


Valoración optométrica y anteojos para las niñas


Juguetes


Estaremos infinitamente agradecidos por cualquier apoyo que decidas brindar. Habrá también formas especiales de reconocimiento según el monto que aportes:


¡Por cada $500MXP, la amorosa y generosa producción de la obra de teatro AMORatados ha aceptado regalarte un boleto para asistir a una de sus funciones! 
Si donas $2000MXP, recibirás un agradecimiento personalizado por parte de nuestro grupo y las niñas de la escuela Hogar.
Si tu donativo es  de $6000 ¡Eeres nuestro super héroe! Esto es suficiente para apadrinar la educación de una niña por un año. Te llevaremos un día a visitar la asociación para conocer a las hermosas niñas cuya vida aestás apoyando a transformar.

Our goal is to raise at the very least 65, 300USD to support the NGO in a more integral way to fulfill the large list of needs they have provided us, which includes:




Scholarships for the girls living in the house (monthly cost of 38USD)
Ironwork for entrance gate and windows.
Chapel's dome restoration.
Gardening Equipment: chainsaw.
Fire extinguishers.
Emergency route and disaster prevention signs.
Illumination for common areas.
Transportation and kitchen personnel expenditures.
Laundry room fixing.
Wall paint for the buildings, 
Paint sealer.
Basic foods baskets.
Cleaning and sanitizing items. 

Stationery

Medicine for the girls.
Running shoes and footwear.
Eye examination and lenses manufacturing for the girls
Toys

We will be forever grateful for all your donations. Special forms of recognition will be given depending on the amount you chose to give.

38USD ¡We thank you from the bottom of our heart! You will receive an e-mail letter from our team and the girls.
150USD ¡WE LOVE YOU! A personalized thank you from the team and the girls will be awarded.
450USD ¡YOU SUPER HERO! A personal skype call will be scheduled with you from the association so that you know the girls and the team.




  El impacto / Impact


En México no contamos con redes de apoyo suficientes para proveer a niñas en estas situaciones de vulnerabilidad las herrameintas para  futuro pleno. A través de la Escuela Hogar del Perpetuo Socorro, estas oportunidades son provistas en un modo amoroso y compasivo. Sólo a través de tu generosidad es que la asociación y sus proyectos podrán mantenerse a lo largo del tiempo.
De 2010 a la fecha he participado en diversos proyectos de voluntariado en India y México. Además, desde 2011 soy fundador de una ONG que se dedica al apoyo integral a familias en situación de pobreza en India, teniendo éxito en mantener nuestro programa de becas para los hijos de dos familias durante tres años. Puedes contar con mi palabra y experiencia para saber que tu colaboración está siendo dirigida a una organización seria y que vale la pena apoyar.
Hoy más que nunca, nuestro país requiere de todo el amor y solidaridad que los seres humanos podamos darle, tu ayuda es un enorme grano de arena para contribuir a generar un México más amoroso.




Mexico's government and social programs are not enough to support girls in these vulnerability situations to achieve a prosperous future. the NGO we are choosing to support delivers such care and provides the girls with tools for a better life. It is only through your love and generous contribution that they will be able to stand the test of time and mantain their projects.
Since 2010 I've participated in several volunteer programs both in India and Mexico. Also, back in 2011 I founded an NGO in India that aims for the integral support of families living in poverty, for the past three year we've successfully managed to keep a scholarship program for the children of two Indian families. You can count on my word and experience to know that your support is being directed to a real, worthy project.
Now, more than ever, Mexico needs all the love and solidarity that humen beings can give. Your help is a huge support to help create a more loving society.


  Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar / Other ways you can help Entendemos que la contribución monetaria no es la única forma de apoyo. Si por ahora no es una posibilidad, ayudanos esparciendo esta campaña entre tus conocidos y con las herramientas que aquí se presentan para pasar la voz ¡El tiempo corre! 
Si no es ahora ¿cuándo? Si no eres tú ¿quién?
We recongize money is not always possible as means to contribute. If it is not a possibility for you at the moment, here are other ways you can help:


Spread the word! among your acquaintances and loved ones. Some help might come up!
Use the site's tools for promotion

Time is running!
If it ain't now... When? If it ain't you... Who will?

story:
I will be joining The Global Medical Foundation April 2-18. 

We have 30 doctors, nurses and volunteers that will be visiting orphanages helping children that have lost limbs. 

They will be fitted with prosthetics and learn how to use their new arms/ hands. 

I will be doing trauma therapy through an interpreter, helping them with the tragic circumstances that happened when they lost their limbs. Many have lost family members at the same time. Some lost their hands from accidents, disease or conflict. 

The Comprehensive Resource Model is the main modality I use. CRM helps to clear traumatic material from the neurophysiology and extinguishes the fear response. It helps to process the memories and images in a safe and gentle way. 

I am honored to be joining this mission and feel blessed to help these children find their joy again. 

Any donations will go towards travel expenses and to the needed supplies for the children. 

Thank you from the bottom of my heart!!


Kirsten Kraus ❤️

Kirsten Kraus ❤️

story:
Help me open a centre dedicated to helping people with neurological disorders (such as Autism Spectrum Disorders, Traumatic Brain Injuries, and learning/developmental delays) live up to their full potential.  The focus will be on social skills, life skills, and managing behaviours.  

The Way I Learn will begin by offering two essential services with plans to provide more in the future. Two services that will be available immediately are; Full day services for adolescents and adults, Intensive Behavioural Intervention services for all ages.

  • Full Day Services: All day programs designed to keep the mind and body engaged throughout the day.  Although these programs will take place in a group setting, an individualized method of teaching is necessary.  This is to ensure that each person is learning at their own pace and based on their specific level of functioning.  The goal is to help them maintain skills learned over the years and to acquire new ones which would promote independence, initiation and self regulation.  
  • Intensive Behavioural Intervention:  IBI is an evidence-based intervention for children with autism.  IBI is based on principles and techniques of Applied Behavioural Analysis.  It can be a mixture of instructional strategies.  Intervention should be implemented twenty to forty hours a week for at least two years.  The purpose of IBI is to learn skills equivalent to the level of neuro-typical children around the same age.  Some of these skills include academic, communicative, social and life skills.  Because every child is different, an individualized assessment is required to determine the child’s 

    strengths and weaknesses.  Based on this assessment, an individualized curriculum is created and covers a wide range of domains and is then implemented by well trained and supervised staff. 

    Data is collected to monitor and measure changes in behavior as well as progress in acquiring new skills.  Acquisitions need to be generalized.  This is important in order to ensure the child’s acquired skills are used in different environments with different people and that they are retained over time.  In order to achieve generalization of skills, the use of varied materials, instructions, settings and instructors are crucial.  A child’s program will change based on progress in order to continue acquiring skills. 


About Myself

I'm a Registered Social Service Worker, happy to say I have been working with people with Autism Spectrum Disorders as an Instructor Therapist for the last eight years.  I have been providing one on one in-home therapy to people of all ages ranging in severity on the spectrum. I work with a multidisciplinary team of experts and use evidence based interventions and strategies to work on social skills, life skills, academics, and manage behaviour.  I have seen so much progress with my clients over the years, this includes increasing language and communication skills, gaining independence, reducing behaviours,  and school success.  Last year I also began working with people who acquired Traumatic Brain Injuries.  My past experience also includes conducting psychological assessments to identify psychological outcomes for people involved in catastrophic motor vehicle accidents to identify need or urgency for psychological treatment.


Why More Services Are Needed

Over the years it has become more and more evident that there are not enough services for people with special needs.   There is a huge service gap in Mississauga, especially for adults.  Since being in this field, many people have expressed concerns in finding quality programs for their loved ones.  Many also expressed they are having difficulty financing them, services are too far, and individual needs are not being met.  There are not enough high quality and affordable services available and the few that offer full day programs are too far, long wait lists, basic services are costly, essential programs are not included in price and cost extra. 

How The Way I Learn is Different  

The purpose of this centre to help people live up to their full potential regardless of age or level of functioning. The two services available are designed to be individualized with an emphasis on Natural Environment Teaching to ensure skills and knowledge gained are generalized and maintained.

Full day services for adults: I want to keep the price of services fair and include all activities in the original cost at no extra charge.  I do not want any of the future clients to be excluded from activities that would be beneficial just because families can't afford to pay the extra cost.  It can become very expensive for families to pay extra for each activity.  Although this will be done in a group setting (5:1 ratio clients:instructors), goals are individualized and activities can be modified to ensure each person is engaged to the best of their ability and encouraged to maintain, acquire and generalize skills. The focus is teaching life skills, social skills, promote independence and manage/self regulate emotions and behaviors.  

IBI: It is with great honor to say the brilliant Psychologist Dr. James Porter will be available for diagnostic and psycho-educational assessment and is one of the potential Clinical Supervisors.  The multidisciplinary team so far really is a dream team! Properly trained and supervised instructors, individualized programs, generalization and accurate data collecting are all key ingredients to successful IBI. Natural Environment Teaching is one of those key ingredients to success and will be a major component in IBI programs. 

You can watch this video of my clients and I in order to get a better idea of some of the skills I work on.  Permission from the families was given for the purpose of this campaign.  My clients faces are not shown for privacy purposes. 

 

Testimonials 

"I can go on and on about how unbelievable Rasha has been for our son Andrew, but you may need to take off a week to sit back and listen to all I have to say.  So I will sum it up in a few short sentences.  Rasha is one in a million.  She is dedicated, intuitive, talented, relentless and supportive.  She helped our son go from being a shy, untalkative, timid delayed little boy....into a blossoming, talkative, highly  intelligent and happy young adult.  Does our son still have a road to travel?  Absolutely yes, but with Rasha in his life...he will not only walk the path...he will arrive.  We love and thank Rasha from the bottom of our hearts."
-Randi G

"As a parent with a special needs young adult knows, it is incredibly difficult to find places for them to go once they are out of the school system.  I have worked with countless specialists trained in dealing with children and young adults like my son and I can honestly say that Rasha has been wonderful.  The programs that were developed for him were of the highest quality and my son thrived under her guidance.  She consistently provided an overview on my son's progress and took the time to look up additional information that she thought I would find helpful.  She was a valuable member of my son's support team and there was nothing my son would not do to please her.
With her extensive training and years of experience, there is no doubt in my mind that Rasha has found her calling with this endeavour and I highly recommend her.  She continuously exhibits commitment, compassion, professionalism, knowledge and dedicated in her work and these qualities cannot be taught."
-Karen B

"Rasha has been working with my autistic son for over a year.  We have seen measurable progress in his abilities and control of his emotions.  She is very calm, direct, and determined to accomplish the goals we established for him.  My son doesn't think of her as a teacher and instead she is a friend that helps him.  It really helps to have someone outside the house to help with establishing boundaries for him and reinforcing the small improvements along the way in our journey.  I would recommend her services to any parent looking for help."
-David M

"Rasha, an IBI Therapist works with both of my daughters in our home and accompanies one to a centre.  She works with them individually, teaching them language, communication, social, life skills.  She has been working with them for about three years, during that time I have seen tremendous progress and differences in my girls."
-Camille R

"Rasha has helped my autistic son through some major stumbling blocks.  He is learning to control his emotions, improving his life skills and becoming more independent.  Rasha's warm, patient yet firm approach has helped guild him to this point."
-Pam M

The Impact

Your contribution will help me achieve my goal to get The Way I Learn up and running.  If I meet my goal, I will have it open for October 2015.

This centre will help so many people with special needs!  My ultimate goal is to see more people with special needs succeed in school, join the workforce and live an independent life.  With my years of experience, history of success, the extraordinary multidisciplinary team, I am confident everyone enrolled in this centre will benefit greatly in a variety of ways on different levels from the services it has to offer. 

The Way I Learn will help fill a service gap,  and will create jobs in my community and surrounding areas. My plan is to also employ people with disabilities, I believe in equal opportunities and unfortunately the unemployment rate for people with disabilities is way too high.  This needs to be changed. 



What The Way I Learn Needs & What You Get

I need this funding to help with the start up costs of this centre.  The first month I need to set up the centre, furnish it, and train staff in order for potential clients to be able to come in and take a look around.  Clients who sign up for services will have individualized programs which takes some time to put together because each person's individual needs and goals are very important to ensure they benefit from programs offered.  The centre will not generate money the first few months, yet I will still need to cover the overhead costs which includes but not limited to rent, hydro, payroll, insurance, etc. 

I really need this funding because I have applied for business loans, personal loans, lines of credit and I have been denied for all of them.  I have been self employed for 8 years, and even though my credit score is excellent, the fact that I’m self employed is an issue for the banks.  It doesn't help that the interest rates have gone down once again and expected to continue to drop along with the Canadian dollar.

If I cannot reach my goal, whatever funds gained could be used to show the bank that there is a big interest in the centre and will have a much better chance at getting a loan.  I have already looked into this and I feel confident I would get a loan or line of credit.  I have been and will continue to host events to raise money.  It may take me longer to open the centre, but it will open! Should I surpass the goal I can make huge improvements to the centre, hire more staff, offer ride programs for pick up and drop off and much more.  Should anything happen to me before the centre opens, money raised will go to ErinOak Kids family services and is included in my will.

Since every contribution regardless of the amount plays an important role in the opening of the centre, I will have a page on the website dedicated to all those who supported The Way I Learn.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, share, share, share!!  Help spread the word through social media and the Indiegogo share tools.  Follow The Way I Learn on Facebook,  you can also help by sending your feedback.  Thank you for your time and interest!

THANK YOU!!!!!

Your support plays a very important role in the opening of this centre!  Thank you from the bottom of my heart for all your support!!!!!

story:
WHAT WE DO

Making huge changes in just a day is what we do at Let’s Do It! World (www.letsdoitworld.org). In 2008, 50,000 people from Estonia (around 4% of the population) came together to clean 10,000 tons of trash from roadsides, forests and towns in 5 hours. Under normal circumstances it would have taken the government three years and €22,500,000 to clean up the same amount. Our initiative inspired our Latvian and Lithuanian neighbours to adopt the One-Day-One-Country  model, and by 2015 our community has grown into strong network that unites 112 countries and 13 000 000 volunteers around the world.


WHY WE DO IT

We do what we do because we truly believe that with as little as 5% of the world’s population, we can launch a global clean up campaign to shift public attitude and civic policy for each participating nation. We believe that social activities of such scale are crucial to prepare the residents of our planet for major changes on personal, social and governmental levels and catalyze sustainable solutions for governments, communities, private enterprise and society overall.  


HOW WILL WE DO IT

Our goal is to engage 5% of the population of Eastern Europe and Central Asia by 2018 within an unprecedented clean-up campaign and ignite a major social change. In order to make this happen, we rely on funding for a number of educational and development initiatives. Our current project is to organise a workshop filled conference for Eastern Co-op Countries (Ukraine, Russia, Azerbaijan, Uzbekistan, Moldova, Mongolia, Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan, Kazakhstan, Armenia, Georgia, Turkmenistan and Belarus) planned for this November in Kiev, Ukraine.

Clean streets and effective waste management system are taken for granted within much of the EU. However, this is not yet the case for most of the Former Soviet Union countries within our network. The waste management system in these places is still a remnant of the past; it's badly out of date and can’t fulfill the needs of modern world citizens. Therefore, the conference will be a cornerstone for development of strong partnerships in order to create and implement new technologies, raise awareness of waste management bottlenecks in former Soviet nations, and evaluate strategies to replicate citizen-led solutions that have proven themselves in Western European countries.

WHAT WE NEED

We need financial support to organise our conference where we plan to:

  • Exchange experience between existing volunteering teams and new partners to better and more efficiently enact successful campaigns in new host countries

  • Develop and strengthen the partnerships between Let’s Do It! teams, NGO’s and Public Institutions in Eastern Co-op Countries

  • Recruit, educate and motivate new teams to expand the reach of their project

  • Develop 3-year strategic plans for Let’s Do It! Eastern Co-op Countries to achieve success

Funds will be used to organise translation services, logistics and facility costs, educational materials, basic administrative costs, and production of follow up materials.

WHAT YOU GET

As a token of our gratitude, we’ll be happy to present you with a small special thank you from Let’s Do It community. Don’t forget to check the “perks” section to find out more about the different things you can get as a thank you for your support.

We offer:

E-ticket to conference - most of the workshops and seminars of the conference will be translated online and you will be provided with access

Your photo/logo of your organisation on Facebook page of the conference

Thank you video from participants of the conference

Furoshiki from an Estonian designer

A unique ceramic plate form an Estonian designer

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If our mission inspires you, spread the word!

  • Share our campaign link on Facebook, Twitter, Youtube, e-mail it to your friends or just mention about it to people you think may be interested [http://igg.me/at/letsdoitconferencekiev2015] 

  • Join our team as a volunteer. We have a wide range of positions available and are looking for active people. For more information visit http://www.letsdoitworld.org/node/64706or e-mail: darja@letsdoitworld.org

  • Stay connected and follow the latest news on Facebook to get updates on our achievements.

ДАВАЙТЕ ОЧИСТИМ СТРАНЫ ВОСТОЧНОЙ ЕВРОПЫ И ЦЕНТРАЛЬНОЙ АЗИИ ОТ МУСОРА ЗА ОДИН ДЕНЬ

ЧТО МЫ ДЕЛАЕМ

Создание глобальных изменений всего за один день - это то, чем мы заниаемся в Let’s do it! (www.letsdoitworld.org). В 2008 году 50000 человек из Эстонии (около 4% населения) собрались вместе, чтобы очистить окраины дорог, лесов и населенных пунктов от 10000 тонн мусора всего за 5 часов. При нормальных обстоятельствах правительству для достижения такого результата потребовалось бы три года и 22500000 €. Инициатива движения вдохновила соседние с Эстонией страны, Латвию и Литву, перенять сработавшую модель - одна страна - один день, а к 2015 году наше движение выросло в сильную сеть, объединяющую 112 стран и 13 000 000 волонтеров по всему миру.


ПОЧЕМУ МЫ ЭТО ДЕЛАЕМ

Мы делаем то, что делаем, потому что действительно верим, что с вовлечением всего 5% населения планеты во всемирную кампанию по уборке, мы сможем изменить отношение общественности к проблемам и нуждам окружающей среды, что повлечет за собой глобальные перемены. Мы убеждены, что социальная активность такого масштаба имеют решающее значение для подготовки жителей нашей планеты к крупным изменениям на личном, общественном и государственном уровнях и послужит стимулом к принятию взвещенных и осознанных решений для устойчивого развилия цивилизации.


КАК МЫ ХОТИМ ДОБИТЬСЯ РЕЗУЛЬТАТА

Наша цель заключается в привлечении 5% населения Восточной Европы и Центральной Азии к 2018 году в рамках беспрецедентной кампании по уборке для создания крупных социальных изменений. Для осуществления задуманного, мы расчитываем на финансовую поддержку ряда образовательных инициатив и проектов. Наш текущий проект - организация международной конференции для стран Восточного содружества Let’s Do It! (Украина, Россия, Азербайджан, Узбекистан, Молдова, Монголия, Таджикистан, Кыргызстана, Казахстан, Армения, Грузия, Туркменистан и Беларусь), запланированной на ноябрь этого года в Киеве, Украина.


Чистые улицы и эффективная система управления отходами являются само собой разумеющимися вещами в большей части ЕС. Однако, для большинства стран СНГ в рамках нашей сети, эти блага еще не являются реальностью: система управления отходами устарела и не может удовлетворить потребностям современного человека. В виду выщесказанного, конференция станет краеугольным камнем для развития прочных партнерских связей в целях создания и внедрения новых технологий, повышения уровня осведомленности среди населения о проблемах загрязнения окружающей среды и изменение поведения как отдельного человека, так и общества в целом, разработке стратегий внедрения практик, которые успешно зарекомандовали себя в странах Западной Европы  для устойчивого развития всего региона.


ЧТО НАМ НУЖНО

Мы нуждаемся в финансовой поддержке в организации конференции, где мы планируем:

  • Обмен опытом между существующими командами добровольцев и потенциальными членами движения Let’s do it!, для проведения более эффективных кампаний в странах Восточного содружества
  • Развитие и укрепление партнерских отношений между командами Let’s do it!, представителями различных некоммерческих организаций и правительственных учреждений в странах содружества
  • Набор новых участников движения, обучение и мотивирование новые команд для расширение границ проекта
  • Разработка единого 3-летнего стратегического плана развития стан Восточного содружества Let’s do it! для достижения поставленной цели к 2018 году

Средства будут использованы для организации услуг по переводу, логистики и покрытия проектных затрат на учебные материалы, основные административные расходы, а также производство необходимых материалов.


ТО, ЧТО ВЫ ПОЛУЧАЕТЕ

В знак нашей признательности, мы будем рады сделать Вам небольшой подарок от движения Let’s do it! Не забудьте заглянуть в раздел "perks", чтобы посмотреть что бы для Вас приготовили, в качестве благодарности за поддержку.

Мы предлагаем:

3 USD - Мы очень ценим Вашу поддержку и в знак нашей признательности с удовольствием отправим Вам благодарственное письмо! Пожалуйста, не забудьте указать свой адрес электронной почты, чтобы мы могли связаться с Вами.

30 USD - Спасибо за Вашу помощь! Мы рады подарить Вам электронный-билет на конференцию - большинство мастер классов и семинаров конференции будут транслироваться в прямом эфире и Вы получите к ним доступ. Не упустите хороший шанс расширить свои горизонты и познакомиться с нашей командой. Пожалуйста, не забудьте оставить свой адрес электронной почты, чтобы мы могли связаться с Вами.

50 USD - В качестве благодарности за Ваш вклад мы поместим Ваше фото/ логотип Вашей организации на страницу конференции в "Facebook". Мы также пришлем Вам электронный билет на конференцию. Пожалуйста, не забудьте оставить свой адрес электронной почты, чтобы мы могли связаться с Вами.

150 USD - Благодарим Вас за поддержку! Вместе с участниками конференции мы снимем для Вас видео. В дополнение к этому мы разместим Ваше фото / логотип на странице конференции в "Facebook" и подарим электронный билета на конференцию. Пожалуйста, не забудьте оставить свой адрес электронной почты, чтобы мы могли связаться с Вами. (Всего 30 видео)

300 USD - Фурошики от эстонского дизайнера ждет Вас! Это прекрасная альтернатива пластиковым пакетам. Фурошики, по сути, представляет собой многофункциональную сумку и экологичную упоковку для заворачивания и переноски предветов любой формы. Вещь очень удоба в применении: ткань полностью принимает форму предмета, а ручки позволяют легко перенести груз. На картинке представлены несколько способов использования фурошики. Больше информации тут: http://letsdoitworld.org/promote/furoshiki В дополнение к этому Вы получите электронный билет на конференцию, и мы разместим Ваше фото/логотип Вашей организации на странице конференции в “Facebook”. Также команда конференции сделает видео для Вас. Пожалуйста, не забудьте оставить свой физический адрес и э-мейл, чтобы мы могли связаться с Вами. (Всего 10 фурошики)

500 USD - В знак нашей признательности, мы вышлем Вам уникальную керамическую тарелочку ручной работы, сделанную художником по керамике из Эстонии. Кроме того, Вам будет предоставлен доступа к онлайн-трансляции нашей конференции, мы разместим Ваше фото/логотипа Вашей организации на странице конференции в “Facebook”, а команда конференции сделает благодарственное видео для вас. Пожалуйста, не забывайте указать свой физический адрес и э-мейл, чтобы мы могли связаться с Вами. (Всего 5 штук)


КАК ЕЩЕ ВЫ МОЖЕТЕ ПОМОЧЬ

Если наш проект вдохновил Вас, расскажите о нем!

Поделитесь ссылкой на эту кампанию в “Facebook”, “Твиттер”, “Youtube”, отправьте по электронной почте своим друзьям или просто расскажите о ней тем, кто может заинтересоваться (http://igg.me/at/letsdoitconferencekiev2015)

Присоединяйтесь к нашей команде в качестве волонтера. У нас есть вакантные места на разные интересные должности в рамках проекта, и мы ищем активных людей. Для получения более подробной информации зайдите на страничку http: //www.letsdoitworld.org/node/64706 или напишите нам на э-мейл: darja@letsdoitworld.org

Оставайтесь на связи и следите за последними новостями конференции на “Facebook” и “Vk.com” чтобы быть в курсе о наших достижениях.

story_txt:
WHAT WE DOMaking huge changes in just a day is what we do at Let’s Do It! World (www.letsdoitworld.org). In 2008, 50,000 people from Estonia (around 4% of the population) came together to clean 10,000 tons of trash from roadsides, forests and towns in 5 hours. Under normal circumstances it would have taken the government three years and €22,500,000 to clean up the same amount. Our initiative inspired our Latvian and Lithuanian neighbours to adopt the One-Day-One-Country  model, and by 2015 our community has grown into strong network that unites 112 countries and 13 000 000 volunteers around the world.WHY WE DO ITWe do what we do because we truly believe that with as little as 5% of the world’s population, we can launch a global clean up campaign to shift public attitude and civic policy for each participating nation. We believe that social activities of such scale are crucial to prepare the residents of our planet for major changes on personal, social and governmental levels and catalyze sustainable solutions for governments, communities, private enterprise and society overall.  HOW WILL WE DO IT Our goal is to engage 5% of the population of Eastern Europe and Central Asia by 2018 within an unprecedented clean-up campaign and ignite a major social change. In order to make this happen, we rely on funding for a number of educational and development initiatives. Our current project is to organise a workshop filled conference for Eastern Co-op Countries (Ukraine, Russia, Azerbaijan, Uzbekistan, Moldova, Mongolia, Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan, Kazakhstan, Armenia, Georgia, Turkmenistan and Belarus) planned for this November in Kiev, Ukraine.Clean streets and effective waste management system are taken for granted within much of the EU. However, this is not yet the case for most of the Former Soviet Union countries within our network. The waste management system in these places is still a remnant of the past; it's badly out of date and can’t fulfill the needs of modern world citizens. Therefore, the conference will be a cornerstone for development of strong partnerships in order to create and implement new technologies, raise awareness of waste management bottlenecks in former Soviet nations, and evaluate strategies to replicate citizen-led solutions that have proven themselves in Western European countries. WHAT WE NEEDWe need financial support to organise our conference where we plan to:
Exchange experience between existing volunteering teams and new partners to better and more efficiently enact successful campaigns in new host countries
Develop and strengthen the partnerships between Let’s Do It! teams, NGO’s and Public Institutions in Eastern Co-op Countries
Recruit, educate and motivate new teams to expand the reach of their project
Develop 3-year strategic plans for Let’s Do It! Eastern Co-op Countries to achieve success
Funds will be used to organise translation services, logistics and facility costs, educational materials, basic administrative costs, and production of follow up materials.WHAT YOU GETAs a token of our gratitude, we’ll be happy to present you with a small special thank you from Let’s Do It community. Don’t forget to check the “perks” section to find out more about the different things you can get as a thank you for your support. We offer:
E-ticket to conference - most of the workshops and seminars of the conference will be translated online and you will be provided with access
Your photo/logo of your organisation on Facebook page of the conference
Thank you video from participants of the conference
Furoshiki from an Estonian designerA unique ceramic plate form an Estonian designer
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPIf our mission inspires you, spread the word!
Share our campaign link on Facebook, Twitter, Youtube, e-mail it to your friends or just mention about it to people you think may be interested [http://igg.me/at/letsdoitconferencekiev2015] 
Join our team as a volunteer. We have a wide range of positions available and are looking for active people. For more information visit http://www.letsdoitworld.org/node/64706or e-mail: darja@letsdoitworld.org
Stay connected and follow the latest news on Facebook to get updates on our achievements.

(Украина, Россия, Азербайджан, Узбекистан, Молдова, Монголия, Таджикистан, Кыргызстана, Казахстан, Армения, Грузия, Туркменистан и Беларусь), запланированной на ноябрь этого года в Киеве, Украина.Чистые улицы и эффективная система управления отходами являются само собой разумеющимися вещами в большей части ЕС. Однако, для большинства стран СНГ в рамках нашей сети, эти блага еще не являются реальностью: система управления отходами устарела и не может удовлетворить потребностям современного человека. В виду выщесказанного, конференция станет краеугольным камнем для развития прочных партнерских связей в целях создания и внедрения новых технологий, повышения уровня осведомленности среди населения о проблемах загрязнения окружающей среды и изменение поведения как отдельного человека, так и общества в целом, разработке стратегий внедрения практик, которые успешно зарекомандовали себя в странах Западной Европы  для устойчивого развития всего региона.ЧТО НАМ НУЖНОМы нуждаемся в финансовой поддержке в организации конференции, где мы планируем:

Обмен опытом между существующими командами добровольцев и потенциальными членами движения Let’s do it!, для проведения более эффективных кампаний в странах Восточного содружества


Развитие и укрепление партнерских отношений между командами Let’s do it!, представителями различных некоммерческих организаций и правительственных учреждений в странах содружества


Набор новых участников движения, обучение и мотивирование новые команд для расширение границ проекта


Разработка единого 3-летнего стратегического плана развития стан Восточного содружества Let’s do it! для достижения поставленной цели к 2018 году

Средства будут использованы для организации услуг по переводу, логистики и покрытия проектных затрат на учебные материалы, основные административные расходы, а также производство необходимых материалов.ТО, ЧТО ВЫ ПОЛУЧАЕТЕВ знак нашей признательности, мы будем рады сделать Вам небольшой подарок от движения Let’s do it! Не забудьте заглянуть в раздел "perks", чтобы посмотреть что бы для Вас приготовили, в качестве благодарности за поддержку.Мы предлагаем:3 USD - Мы очень ценим Вашу поддержку и в знак нашей признательности с удовольствием отправим Вам благодарственное письмо! Пожалуйста, не забудьте указать свой адрес электронной почты, чтобы мы могли связаться с Вами.30 USD - Спасибо за Вашу помощь! Мы рады подарить Вам электронный-билет на конференцию - большинство мастер классов и семинаров конференции будут транслироваться в прямом эфире и Вы получите к ним доступ. Не упустите хороший шанс расширить свои горизонты и познакомиться с нашей командой. Пожалуйста, не забудьте оставить свой адрес электронной почты, чтобы мы могли связаться с Вами.50 USD - В качестве благодарности за Ваш вклад мы поместим Ваше фото/ логотип Вашей организации на страницу конференции в "Facebook". Мы также пришлем Вам электронный билет на конференцию. Пожалуйста, не забудьте оставить свой адрес электронной почты, чтобы мы могли связаться с Вами.150 USD - Благодарим Вас за поддержку! Вместе с участниками конференции мы снимем для Вас видео. В дополнение к этому мы разместим Ваше фото / логотип на странице конференции в "Facebook" и подарим электронный билета на конференцию. Пожалуйста, не забудьте оставить свой адрес электронной почты, чтобы мы могли связаться с Вами. (Всего 30 видео)300 USD - Фурошики от эстонского дизайнера ждет Вас! Это прекрасная альтернатива пластиковым пакетам. Фурошики, по сути, представляет собой многофункциональную сумку и экологичную упоковку для заворачивания и переноски предветов любой формы. Вещь очень удоба в применении: ткань полностью принимает форму предмета, а ручки позволяют легко перенести груз. На картинке представлены несколько способов использования фурошики. Больше информации тут: http://letsdoitworld.org/promote/furoshiki В дополнение к этому Вы получите электронный билет на конференцию, и мы разместим Ваше фото/логотип Вашей организации на странице конференции в “Facebook”. Также команда конференции сделает видео для Вас. Пожалуйста, не забудьте оставить свой физический адрес и э-мейл, чтобы мы могли связаться с Вами. (Всего 10 фурошики)500 USD - В знак нашей признательности, мы вышлем Вам уникальную керамическую тарелочку ручной работы, сделанную художником по керамике из Эстонии. Кроме того, Вам будет предоставлен доступа к онлайн-трансляции нашей конференции, мы разместим Ваше фото/логотипа Вашей организации на странице конференции в “Facebook”, а команда конференции сделает благодарственное видео для вас. Пожалуйста, не забывайте указать свой физический адрес и э-мейл, чтобы мы могли связаться с Вами. (Всего 5 штук)КАК ЕЩЕ ВЫ МОЖЕТЕ ПОМОЧЬЕсли наш проект вдохновил Вас, расскажите о нем!Поделитесь ссылкой на эту кампанию в “Facebook”, “Твиттер”, “Youtube”, отправьте по электронной почте своим друзьям или просто расскажите о ней тем, кто может заинтересоваться (http://igg.me/at/letsdoitconferencekiev2015)Присоединяйтесь к нашей команде в качестве волонтера. У нас есть вакантные места на разные интересные должности в рамках проекта, и мы ищем активных людей. Для получения более подробной информации зайдите на страничку http: //www.letsdoitworld.org/node/64706 или напишите нам на э-мейл: darja@letsdoitworld.orgОставайтесь на связи и следите за последними новостями конференции на “Facebook” и “Vk.com” чтобы быть в курсе о наших достижениях.НАШИ НОВОСТИ:http://www.letsdoitworld.org/news/what-happening-country-initiated-let-s-do-it-estonia-eight-years-laterhttp://www.letsdoitworld.org/news/afghanistan-held-big-waste-cleanup-action-despite-deadly-attackshttp://www.letsdoitworld.org/news/over-20400-romanians-were-involved-education-and-cleanup-actions-protect-danube-riverhttp://www.letsdoitworld.org/news/let-s-do-it-actions-engaged-over-22-million-people-clean-illegal-waste-last-few-monthshttp://www.letsdoitworld.org/news/ljubljana-first-zero-waste-capital-saving-money-and-creating-jobs-zero-waste-modelhttp://www.letsdoitworld.org/news/estonians-who-invented-cleaning-whole-country-just-one-day-now-enjoy-fruits-their-deedhttp://www.letsdoitworld.org/news/more-half-million-volunteers-are-expected-clean-their-countries-weekendhttp://issuu.com/kadikenk/docs/lt_report?e=9543141/9094173https://s14zsuof.sendsmaily.net/template/preview/id/35/НАШИ КОНТАКТЫСледите за последними событиями конференции на странице "Facebook" и "VК.com"Сайт:  www.letsdoitworld.org, www.letsdoitukriane.orgyoutube: https://www.youtube.com/user/LetsdoitworldTwitter: https://twitter.com/letsdoitworldflickr: https://www.flickr.com/groups/letsdoitworld

story:
Our Story

We love pie. To say that we are pie enthusiasts would be an understatement. In fact, we think that pie can change the world. AND WE NEED YOUR HELP!!!. The youth leaders of Pie Ranch need to get to Philadelphia on July 27th to attend the Rooted In Community National Network conference. These youth leaders are inspired to connect people to know the source of their food and to work together to bring greater health to the food system from seed to table. 

 

Every year hundreds of young people gather in a different city to share this common vision at the Rooted in Community conference. RIC is a national grassroots network that empowers young people to take leadership in their own communities. It is a movement of youth and adults working together, committed to fostering healthy communities and food justice through urban and rural agriculture, community gardening, food security, and related environmental justice work.

 

Pie Ranch's connection to Rooted In Community helps support the critical work we do with our youth here in the bay area. RIC offers technical training in community organizing, hard skills in organic agriculture, the opportunity to network with youth across the country, and is a tremendous inspiration to the young people at Pie Ranch. 

This year we are striving to bring a talented group of 4 to represent Pie Ranch's commitment to food justice, to enhance and inform our efforts, and to bring critical information and connections back to California.  

The Impact

It is our belief that if our team can make it to Philadelphia, we can create a healthier bay area. After attending the RIC conference two years ago, one youth leader from Pacifica returned as a high school sophmore to start a 1/8 acre school garden, organize fellow classmates, and rally teacher and administartive support! At 15 yrs. old.! Being able to send this group of youth provides the training and support they need to commit to social & food justice projects here in California that create a healthier world for us all.


"Having Attended RIC two years ago, I have seen the power of RIC to inspire individuals and give insight in to the work that hundreds of other people are doing throughout the country. It is an amazing opportunity to share what we are doing with other people and to see and be inspired by the projects of others. The opportunity presented by RIC to collaborate with others and learn from their work is one that is unparalleled and one that has allowed me to employ the skills and ideas I acquired at RIC two years ago in my community back at home. I intend to return from RIC with new skills and renewed inspiration to continue my work at Pie Ranch and at Oceana High School."  Naftali Moed, Oceana High School Student

What We Need & What You Get

We need $3500 to get to Philadelphia.

The plane tickets are $600 each, and the conference fees are $155 per youth and $205 per adult.

We also need $300 extra for food, travel and misc. expenses related to the trip.

If we do not reach our funding goal, the funds will roll over to support next year's efforts to attend Rooted In Community. Check out the perks section to learn more about how your contribution will be appreciated!

story:
My Story

Christâ€™s love is something that you can share with anyone, you donâ€™t have to go to a different country to do it but when God calls you to a certain people youâ€™ve just got to go! My name is Larisa Milne, I am 17 years old and have been called to serve the children of  to remind them of their greatness and to share in the happiness they experience every day. I will be leaving the 15th of May and will be serving for two months in  or  with Orphanage Support Services Organization (OSSO) for more information about the organization please visit http://www.orphanagesupport.org/volunteers.html. While there I will be playing and loving the children and helping the organization in many other ways. This is my part in sharing the most important part of my faith; charity.

The Impact
          In there are hundreds and hundreds of abandoned and disadvantaged children living in orphanages. Often these children are in the orphanages because of poverty, societal conditions and political unrest. The good-hearted staffs of these orphanages are struggling to meet the individual needs of these children because their limited resources are strained and they canâ€™t provide everything theyâ€™d like to. Because of having to deal with limited resources, when infants they are not held, talked to and touched, some become socially impaired and unable to form loving relationships. This lack of attention may also lead to poor physical, emotional and intellectual development. No organization can replace a love of a family but sometimes they must try. For more information on OSSO and â€™s needs please visit http://www.orphanagesupport.org/index.html

What I Need & What You Get

I need to earn $4,000 my March 1st! Most of the money goes towards the children down there but it will also go towards my plane ticket, room and board (that part I am myself by performing and working) what you will be giving will go towards the orphanage.

 

You can either pay through Indiegogo or for you can pay through OSSO by going to this website http://www.orphanagesupport.org/donors.html and they will send you a receipt. Once at the website click â€˜donate on lineâ€™ or â€˜donate by mailâ€™. If you want the donation towards my trip you must clarify that in your donation slip. Online you just go to the bottom of the page and click â€˜Other Donationâ€™ (same with mailing option) and in the box bellow tell them that the money will be going towards Larisa Milne (not Lacy) and then fill out the rest as it follows. As far as where,  or , it doesnâ€™t matter because I donâ€™t know where I will be sent yet so just click â€˜where it is most neededâ€™. 

If you choose to donate on indiegogo there are three different awards depending on how much you donate you could earn a jibjab , own my CD or get a letter from me showing how much impact your donation made.


 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please make in known to everyone you know! For more information be free to call me or email me. 801-882-1936, gotviola@gmail.com
