story:
Le attività internazionali dell'ITIS S. Cannizzaro di Colleferro

Una scuola che fa crescere è una scuola che da’ la possibilità di mettersi in gioco, confrontarsi e partecipare. 

Dal 2004 l’ITIS Stanislao Cannizzaro fa parte di ASEF ClassNet (http://aec.asef.org/index.html ), associazione di scuole e insegnanti di 51 paesi europei e asiatici, nata all’interno di ASEF (Asia Europe Foundation) e ASEM (Asia Europe Meeting). Lo scopo dell’associazione è quello di far incontrare insegnanti e studenti europei e asiatici per sviluppare progetti collaborativi online e scambi face-to-face. 

I nostri studenti, di Colleferro e dei paesi limitrofi, in questi anni hanno potuto collaborare con scuole e studenti di tanti paesi europei e asiatici, un’esperienza culturale e umana davvero grandiosa, che è possibile realizzare solo con progetti che prevedono uno scambio continuo, un lavoro comune e un obiettivo da realizzare con il contributo di tutti. Tutto questo fa decollare la motivazione degli studenti sia nell’approfondimento del tema che nell’apprendimento della lingua inglese che rende possibile il contatto e la collaborazione. I computer, internet, le piattaforme su cui lavoriamo, le classi virtuali che costruiamo sono gli strumenti che rendono possibile la nostra apertura al mondo, ma sempre a servizio di una valida e consapevole mediazione didattica. Siamo stati premiati a Pechino nel 2005 per un nostro progetto, The World in a Book, a Serres in Grecia nel 2006, Kota Kinabalu – Borneo/Malesia nel 2008, a Sønderborg, Danimarca nel 2009, a Delhi, India nel 2010, a Dundalk, Irlanda nel 2011, a Bali, Indonesia nel 2013 per altri progetti coordinati da altre scuole a cui abbiamo partecipato come partner.               Il nostro progetto online di quest'anno è World History in Family Photos:  http://www.whifp.com    https://www.facebook.com/groups/151918286830719...

A questo bisogna aggiungere che si è creata una rete di centinaia di insegnanti che regolarmente si incontrano nelle conferenze ASEF, in Europa e in Asia, per presentare nuove idee e lavorare insieme alla definizione di piani precisi per la loro realizzazione e continuano poi a comunicare e collaborare durante tutto l’anno negli spazi comuni che creano in Internet. Questa rete di insegnanti costituisce una realtà importante in sé. Il nostro lavoro comune è la prova della possibilità per ogni scuola di rompere l’isolamento e aprirsi al mondo.

Dal 2007 cerchiamo di rendere anche reali le nostre collaborazioni virtuali attraverso scambi di visite; lo abbiamo fatto nel 2007 con la Garden International School di Kuala Lumpur - Malesia, per tre anni consecutivi dal 2009 al 2011 con il Millennia Institute di Singapore, nel 2010 con 4 scuole malesi, nel 2012 con scuole indonesiane, nel 2012 e nel 2013 la St. Mark’s Secondary School e la St Mark's Senior Girls Secondary School di Delhi, India. 

Questi scambi ci arricchiscono sia dal punto di vista linguistico che culturale e vorremmo ripetere l’esperienza nei prossimi anni con questi ed altri paesi. 


Come potete contribuire e cosa vi possiamo offrire

Tutti gli scambi culturali sono basati sull'ospitalità delle famiglie proprio per determinare il maggior impatto culturale possibile. L'esperienza ci ha infatti dimostrato che vivere nelle famiglie e nelle scuole dei propri partner fornisce allo scambio un valore culturale ed educativo eccezionale, che elimina ogni preconcetto: nascono veri rapporti, amicizie che, più di ogni altro insegnamento formale a scuola, cambiano la mentalità dei ragazzi. Come già positivamente sperimentato negli anni precedenti i criteri per la scelta degli studenti italiani che visitano le scuole partner all’estero sono i seguenti: motivazione, impegno nell'International Club, competenza linguistica, interesse personale.

Nel 2015 continueranno gli scambi culturali con  il Millennia Institute di Singapore (http://www.millenniainstitute.moe.edu.sg/ ). Il preside di Singapore, visti i risultati estremamente positivi della collaborazione iniziata nel 2008 con progetti online e 3 anni di visite nelle rispettive scuole, ha proposto all’ITIS Cannizzaro di continuare per ulteriori tre anni le nostre attività comuni.

Spesa prevista per tutte le attività internazionali per l'anno scolastico 2014/2015 è di circa € 9000.

Contribuite per costruire un pezzettino di questa cifra, insieme alla scuola, le famiglie, il lavoro dell'International Club, gli sponsor privati e gli enti locali.

Se riusciremo a raccogliere di più, potremo invitare almeno un'altra scuola da un altro paese asiatico ed iniziare un altro scambio che si potrà concludere il prossimo anno scolastico!

In cambio vi possiamo offrire un magnifico video reportage della nostra visita a Singapore, non dimenticate che frequenteremo la scuola dei nostri amici e abiteremo nelle loro famiglie. La nostra prospettiva è del tutto particolare, non saremo turisti! Credeteci, sarà un video davvero interessante.

L'impatto della comunità tutta sulla scuola

Dal punto di vista economico, gli scambi vengono finanziati in parte dalle famiglie degli studenti, in parte da quanto ricavato dalle iniziative dell’International Club, in parte da contributi provenienti da sponsor privati, da Enti locali e dalla scuola.  

Ci piace molto l'idea che l'intera comunità che riconosce la validità delle nostre attività internazionali si impegna affinchè i ragazzi veramente motivati a partecipare agli scambi culturali possano prendervi parte, indipendentemente dalle loro possibilità economiche.

Le famiglie contribuiscono per circa la metà del costo del volo aereo, in modo tale che lo scambio culturale costi allo studente come un classico viaggio di istruzione.

Ovviamente le famiglie dei nostri studenti contribuiscono in modo totale quando ospitano gli studenti stranieri. L'esperienza di ospitare, in tutti gli scambi realizzati in questi anni, si è sempre dimostrata estremamente positiva dal punto di vista culturale e umano, non solo per gli studenti ma per l'intera famiglia ospitante.

Rendiconto finale

Alla fine dello scambio un rendiconto dettagliato dello scambio, inclusa la lista delle spese e delle entrate, sarà pubblicata sulla pagina Facebook dell'International Club dell'ITIS Stanislao Cannizzaro di Colleferro  https://www.facebook.com/groups/332328300144710/

    Altri modi in cui ci potete aiutare

    Diffondete il nostro appello tra i vostri amici in rete! 

    GRAZIE

story:
*THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! We have reached our initial goal BUT we still need all the help we can get to fill up the Center's MILK BANK! All further donations will be  directed to supplying the MILK BANK!!!

This Christmas most of us will be enjoying the happiest time of the year, with plenty of food, friends and gifts. Sadly without our help many people around the world aren't able to do so. Some time ago, we (a small group of kindred spirits) decided to pull our efforts and make a difference in our "backyard", the community of malnourished children and their families of the Centro de Nutricion Niño Jesus, in the outskirt of Santo Domingo. We need your help to share the gift of nutrition this season! 

Short Summary

We have been raising funds and supporting the center for more than 10 years. This center is a non-profit institution established in 1990 by the Sisterhood of Mary of Schoensttat. The center feeds and takes care of 100 children. Its main purpose is to offer health, hygiene, education and nutritional services to malnourished children (ages 0-5 years) of the impoverished community of La Victoria, north of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic.

A couple of years back the sisters shared with us the set backs the children would face on Christmas break (the center closes for 2 weeks during Christmas). Most of the children’s families do not have enough to eat. The children come back from break thinner and with their immune system weakened. So we decided to focus on two important objectives, providing a Christmas Nutritional Care Package for the children and their family, and filling up the center’s Milk Bank for the upcoming year.

With your donations we will be helping 100 families have a happy Christmas!

What We Need & What You Get

Lets break this down for you folks in more detail:

*Now that we have reached our initial target all further donations will go directly to filling the Center's Milk Bank* Keep those donations coming! 

The Milk Bank: We need to fill up the center’s Milk Bank for the upcoming year, this money will be used to buy supplies for the center such as:

  • Milk
  • Nutritional Supplements
  • Soap and Detergents
  • Diapers
  • Medication that is not subsidized by the state
  • Supplies and goodies for the Children's Holiday Party

Christmas Nutritional Care Packages: We ARE going to prepare  100 Christmas Nutritional Care packages that help feed the children and their families for the 2 weeks (Dec 22-Jan 7) while the center is closed. Any donation amount is appreciated and encouraged. Each package costs US$25.00 (EU 20.00) to prepare, if you would like to donate an entire package we would be incredibly grateful!

The Christmas Nutritional Care it includes 

  • 2 pounds of Fortified Oatmeal
  • 4 pounds of Rice
  • 4 pounds of kidney beans
  • 2 boxes of spaghettis
  • 4 cans of sardines
  • 4 cans of spam
  • 1 pound of Fortified Cocoa Powder
  • 2 packages of diapers  
  • A small goodie bag of sweats
  • One fun Christmas toy per child

The perks you will receive

 -HOLIDAY XMAS CARD: Donations from USD $10.00 and up will receive a beautiful digital Holiday greeting from all the children at the Center.

-FROM U WITH LUV: XMAS CARE PAC: Donations of USD $25.00 (EU 20.00) provide an entire Christmas Care Package!! We will send you a digital photograph of your personalized Christmas Nutritional Care Package and the child for whom you have been Santa Claus!

-Your PLACE at our Tree: Donations of USD $100.00 and up will grant you a place in our donor Xmas tree at the center! We will send you a digital picture of your Xmas ornament and its placement on our tree AND a Fun video of the Center’s Xmas Party!

The Impact

The truth is that for less than what we spend at dinner in a restaurant; we are able to make a huge difference in the lives of these children and their families.

Malnourished children experience developmental delays, weight-loss and illness as a result of inadequate intake of protein, calories and other nutrients. Malnourishment can greatly compromise a child’s immune system, making them more susceptible to infectious diseases. It not only impacts growth in the short term, but can also limit total bone growth. Malnutrition negatively effects brain development, causing delays in motor and cognitive development.

These Christmas Care Packages will help prevent that the children of the center loose the gains that they have achieved during their time there. It will ensure that they and their families have enough nutrients during break, and it will share the joy of this special time of the year.

We will be giving the gift of sustained nutrition and health this Christmas to these kids and their families. Lets reach our target and give them a happy and healthy Xmas!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just aren’t able to make financial contributions, but that doesn't mean they can’t help!

Please help us get the word out!  Share this campaign with as many people as you can. Talk about us on twitter, instagram, facebook, snail mail, phone, chat… you get the gist…

HELP US GIVE THESE KIDS A GREAT XMAS GIFT

If you happen to be in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic and want to become a part of our team of volunteer packers contact us and we will let you know what you can do to help!

happiest time of the year, with plenty of food, friends and gifts. Sadly
without our help many people around the world aren't able to do so. Some time
ago, we (a small group of kindred spirits) decided to pull our efforts and make
a difference in our "backyard", the community of malnourished children
and their families of the Centro de
Nutricion Niño Jesus, in the outskirt of Santo Domingo. We need your help to share the gift of nutrition this season! 
Short Summary
We have been raising funds and
supporting the center for more than 10 years. This center is a non-profit
institution established in 1990 by the Sisterhood of Mary of Schoensttat. The center feeds and takes care of 100 children. Its
main purpose is to offer health, hygiene, education and nutritional services to
malnourished children (ages 0-5 years) of the impoverished community of La
Victoria, north of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic.
A couple of years back the sisters
shared with us the set backs the children would face on Christmas break (the
center closes for 2 weeks during Christmas). Most of the children’s families do
not have enough to eat. The children come back from break thinner and with their
immune system weakened. So we decided to focus on two important objectives,
providing a Christmas Nutritional Care Package for the children and their
family, and filling up the center’s Milk Bank for the upcoming year.
With your donations we will be helping 100
families have a happy Christmas!

story:
Our Bus

 

 

Hello, My name is David Sha. I'm reaching out to you today to help me accomplish something near and dear to my heart. Make no mistake, this is not about me, but an issue concerning the children in the neighborhood that I grew up in.

I was born and raised in Carverdale. Although I have traveled to many places, I could never forget home. That's why what I am asking you to help me do is so important to me. Last year I saw a young boy that I used to coach at football fundamentals camp. I asked him was he playing football at his junior high and he said, “No. They don't have late buses anymore, and I don't have a way to get home from school.” That broke my heart. I couldn't believe it.

We all know what could happen to children that have too much free time on their hands. Staying active in after school activities kept boys like me out of trouble. It seems to me that people love to complain about how the young men and women from lower income areas are hoodlums and trouble makers, but they fail to provide solutions for the problem. They seem to be more content with complaining and calling the police. Fortunately my generation had plenty of things to do like after school sports and summer programs.

Instead of complaining or putting down the youth, I propose we provide them with the means to participate in these after school functions.  The late buses being shut down doesn't affect the other areas as much. Besides the fact that our area(Carverdale, Spring Branch Acres) is the only low income area where many parents don't own vehicles, the other areas that are assigned to a particular school are relatively close in proximity to that school.

This is a travesty. I'm personally tired of picketing, and begging for handouts . They know that this is wrong. They don't care how we feel about it or how it affects our children. I don't know why they shut down the late buses. I'm personally not concerned with the why. All I know is that if my son has tutoring, I have to leave work early to go pick him up from school. I propose that we pool our resources and buy a bus for our children. I say do for self. That's the only way to get some true respect. It's a large task, but an even larger need. I talked to a car dealer and he said he had a Metro sized bus for sale. It's $10,000.

I would like to have the money raised by the start of next school year. If you could please see it in your heart to take up random collections for this worthy cause, or give on your own, it would do these children a world of good.

story:
Short Summary

The Pacific Pinball Museum, founded ten years ago, is a 501c3 non profit dedicated to preserving the art, science and history of pinball. The museum currently has  90 games set to free play for one admission price. Our museum is educational, interactive and fun.

It is also free! If you don't want to play you can visit our museum for free and learn all about pinball.  We are serously passionate about our mission.

We intend to see pinball preserved for future generations to learn from and play! Your contribution can help us ensure everyone still gets to play these original American masterpieces. You can help us get more than 1500 historic games to see the light of day again in a new, larger location -- potentially the Palace of Fine Arts in San Francisco.

 

With your funding we will create exhibits about the history, science and art of pinball games from Pinball's birth as Bagatelle to the current day's Xmen and Tron.

Your help gets us to the next stage of this unparalleled effort.  America needs a pinball museum celebrating our uniquely American art form in a comprehensive and learned manner.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking for $1.5 million to help fund several aspects of our move. The nest egg we're building will help us negotiate terms with the city of San Francisco to  occupy a site there. We need to hire additional staff. There's moving costs and maintenance costs, plus we'll have to rent at least five big rigs to get everything over there. We plan to create new signage and exhibits for the big museum, apply for grants and continue our mural  and travelling exhibition programs.

In thanks, we'll hand you your very own PPE6 Poster, PPM logo T shirts and hats, a membership to the museum, passes to PPE6 (a $60 value) and lots more. Our angel donors will receive a lifetime membership to the museum allowing discounted access to themselves and a friend for the rest of their pinball-playing lives!

If we don't reach our entire goal, your funding could still provide all these aspects in a different location in the Bay Area.  The Exploratorium's soon-to-be vacated site at the Palace of Fine Arts in San Francisco is what we really want.

 

The Impact

We already have 500 pinball games restored and ready to display at our nascent museum but there's no room in our current location to display them. We also have established the largest pinball show in the world: the Pacific Pinball Expo, now in its sixth year. This grass-roots effort is well on its way, our museum is fully self-sustaining in its current location, and reflects a herculean effort by more than 200 volunteers.

We've already seen great success with our "History of Pinball" exhibition at the San Francisco Airport Museum, our "Pinball Oddity" exhibition at Rhythmix Cultural Works of Alameda, CA and the "Lil Juju" portable pinball museum which goes to schools, the Maker Faire, and many other locations.

We've also used our pinball curriculum in classes for grade school children we held for the first time this year.

Pinball is global. People of all ages, backgrounds and walks of life instinctively know how to play pinball. This truly American art form has no equal in modern culture. America needs something to be proud of again, and pinball captures the engineering and artisitic ingenuity of our nation. Pinball brings together people of all backgrounds in a social setting outside the home.

Not only can you help us display our warehoused collection of more than 2,000 historic games, but your funding will help us develop our curriculum and offerings to students of all ages.

The timing is critical as the Golden Gate Parks and Rec will be putting out a Request For Proposals as soon as the Exploratorium has vacated the building in spring of 2013. If we can get a war chest together with our ready to go collection, we have a good chance at creating the most incredible museum of fun, learning and gaming in the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to help financially, but fully believe in the cause of preserving pinball, spread the word with these handy links:

story:
At STAR Education, we believe that innovative enrichment should be available to all students, regardless of socioeconomic background. We've been pursuing this goal for over 27 years as an educational nonprofit operating primarily in Los Angeles, with offices San Diego, Sacramento, Nashville, and New York.

Last year, we partnered with West LA College, LAUSD’s Beyond the Bell and LA County Office of Education to inspire 2,000 underserved students from across Los Angeles with exhibits, speakers, and activities designed to ignite their passion to explore a future in Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Math. Hosted at West LA College, it was an exciting and transformative event. We're hoping that, with your help, we’re able to make the event even more dynamic this year!


S.T.E.A.M. Nation is a huge undertaking, as the event spans much of the West Los Angeles College campus for a day. Students from underserved communities from all over Los Angeles come to be inspired and excited by motivational shows, interactive exhibits, and hands-on activities. At the end of the day, students get to take home a bag filled with toys and games geared toward continuing the learning and exploring at home.

All of this is provided at no cost to the students who attend the event!

We're building on last year's successes, expanding the hours of the event, booking bigger presenters and sponsors, and providing lunch for students and volunteers. Needless to say, putting this together takes time, donated goods, volunteers, and a not-insignificant amount of money.

STAR Education is a nonprofit with over 27 years of experience and a reputation for excellence, so you can be confident that your support will go directly to improving this event for our deserving students. Last year, we were able to pull together the resources to make S.T.E.A.M. Nation happen with very little help, but this year we are hoping to strengthen our efforts with the support of our community! Every dollar you donate will help make the event more exciting and engaging for the students who need it most.


Everyone who pledges at least $5 will be included in a list of our supporters on the S.T.E.A.M. Nation website.

If unique swag is your thing, we're designing silicon bracelets, awesome NFC tags, and t-shirts so you can show your support offline as well. More details and images coming soon!

Those able to do more can be recognized as sponsors for sections of the event, with limited opportunities to get your organization's name on a booth or even on one of the four quadrants of the event.


Help spread opportunity and equal access to education by supporting S.T.E.A.M. Nation, and you'll be in the company of some big names who have already pledged their time and resources to making the event happen.

More info about our major sponsors coming soon!


    STAR Education has a long history of hosting large, successful events. Some examples include:

        

    One of the largest Earth Day celebrations in Los Angeles!


       

    Battle of the Bands is held twice a year as a way for our young rockers to show off the skills they've learned in professional venues



    S.T.E.A.M. Nation is happening regardless of funding from this campaign. However, we can't make it bigger and better without your support!


      Every dollar helps support access to S.T.E.A.M. education opportunities for vulnerable students, but you can help by sharing our campaign with your own network of friends and family.

      Use the share buttons found on this page to let your friends and family know that you support access to innovative education for all!

story:
Deepening kids' love of reading 

Banging your head against the wall trying to get your screens-obsessed child reading on their own?

Having trouble sifting through the endless stream of children’s literature to find the books that will help your super reader soar to new heights? 

Even after 15 years helping literacy educators use technology to support learning, I felt the same way as I struggled to help my older son learn to love books in spite of a reading-specific learning disability and tried to help my always-reading younger son branch out.

So, I teamed up with data scientist Kathleen Perez-Lopez to found Mia Learning in 2017. Since then, we've built software in collaboration with top educational researchers, teachers, librarians, and creative writers, winning the Most Promising Innovation Prize from Booz Allen Hamilton and federal R&D funding. 

 

Virtual conversations and real books 

Secret Agent Mia's Book Club brings Mia Learning's award winning conversational artificial intelligence software directly to homes for the first time, enabling kids to choose and own new books each month that are perfect for them while expanding their interests, increasing their motivation, and deepening their love of reading. 

 

Deeply grounded in research, developed with top experts, Mia Learning's software is already proving highly effective in schools. National Science Foundation-funded study shows Mia boosted students' motivation at a 32% annualized rate, benefiting both struggling and gifted readers.

 

How it works  

Kids talk with Secret Agent Mia, their loveable voice chatbot, to get personalized recommendations, receive copies of real print books each month, and reflect on their reading. 

 

Engaging voice conversations

On a laptop, tablet, or phone—your choice—kids talk to Mia, and she understands them and speaks back (like Alexa or Siri) through a totally private and secure website. They love accompanying Mia on secret missions to defeat Dr. Boredom.

"It’s the coolest when kids see Mia as this character that they identify with, who’s listening to them and interacting with them in a very concrete, realistic way. It’s something that hasn't really been done before." - Chris Hils, Director of Programs, Treehouse Books

 

Recommend, Read, Reflect Cycle 

Mia gets kids eyes off the screen and into a book in just two twenty minute conversations each month through the recommend, read, and reflect cycle. 

1. Recommend: AI linked to our experts' knowledge about reading, learning, and 10,000+ books helps Mia give deeply personalized recommendations that reflect each child's unique interests, challenges, abilities, and dreams. 

"I really appreciate a tool that helps parents to find books that are going to match their particular interests and proclivities, and that include some recently published books maybe we have never heard of but children are very eager and excited to read." - Nell Duke, Professor, Literacy, Language & Culture, University of Michigan

Eliza, 7, explains how Mia helps her discover unexpected new favorites
 
 

2. Read: Mia delivers new print copies of two books kids choose from Mia's recommendations to their home each month, and kids can't wait to read them. 

"I love that Mia guides my child in picking books and that she always regularly has new ones she will read and learn from about without me having to worry about whether I’ve paid enough attention. She’s loved all the books Mia helped her pick." - Rachel Houghton, Parent

 

3. Reflect: Mia talks with kids again after they've read, helping them reflect on their experiences and offering personalized video coaching to help them get more out of reading. 

"Mia's always there. Mia's never crabby. Mia always has time to listen. She can always give a reasoned response. In those ways, Mia is a great support for both the child and the adults who are working them." - Kathryn Pierce, Assistant Professor of Education, St. Louis University

Kids learn to make more powerful choices about reading, and Mia learns too. Machine learning makes Mia get better and better over time. 

 

Bringing Mia directly to families

What we need 

People frequently ask me, "When can I get Mia for my kids?" Although we developed Mia for use in schools, we don't want families to have to wait until their schools adopt Mia to benefit. To provide Secret Agent Mia's Book Club directly to individual homes, we need to raise $25,000 to adapt our software. We will use these funds to optimize our account management, notifications, and book fulfillment systems. The software works great for kids today, but we want to make parents' experience superb as well. 

In addition, due to the technical excellence and educational impact our Phase I project, Mia Learning is eligible for Phase II Small Business Innovation Research funding from the National Science Foundation. Your contribution will help provide the proof of consumer demand required to receive the $750,000 grant when we apply at the end of the summer. 

 

What you get

So, we need your help, and we're offering perks to recognize your contributions, including: 

  • Secret Agent Mia stickers and t-shirts, exclusively available through this campaign
  • Secret Agent Mia's Book Club subscriptions for the young readers in your life. Pre-order for three months up to a year. 
  • Subscription sponsorships for children and schools in low-income communities
  • An exclusive, one-time-only chance to teach Mia to answer your question. 
  • Personalized recording of Mia thanking you  for your support
  • An opportunity for your young reader to write a book review Mia shares with other kids around the world in her recommendations
  • Lunch with the founders of Mia Learning in Washington, D.C. 

Plus, cool prizes: Everyone who contributes receives a chance to win a $250 Amazon gift certificate, a custom drawing by acclaimed artist Jane Mount your ideal bookcase, and more to be announced. 

 

Social impact

Learning to read is essential to success in life, but now more than ever we need kids who not only can read but do read. In our complex, ever-changing world, reading the right books, and lots of them, leads to more than just academic success. Books can deepen kids’ understanding, broaden their interests, and expand their empathy and emotional intelligence.

It’s no exaggeration to say that reading for enjoyment among school-age children is in real danger: around age 9, voluntary reading plummets a staggering 39%. Yet if kids can make empowered, educated decisions about their own reading and build their personal libraries, their likelihood of reading on their own skyrockets. Secret Agent Mia's Book Club can help.  

Mia Learning believes reading’s benefits should not be limited to a privileged few. That’s why when you contribute to Mia, you also provide children from a low-income household with books. Children’s book ownership is highly inequitable in the United States. The ratio of children to developmentally appropriate books for sale in low income neighborhoods is over 300:1. Getting first in line for Mia will benefit your children and those who are in need. 

 

Risks 

The most significant risk we face in delivering on the promise of this campaign is delays due to unexpected technical obstacles. Although Mia Learning's engineers are world class, if there's one thing I've learned about software development over the last 20 years, it's that it's impossible to predict perfectly how long work will take. We've listed our best estimates for each perk, and we commit to sending backers frequent updates on our progress. (Reminder: If we don't make our campaign goal, you get a 100% refund.) 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute, please spread the word:

  • Like or follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. Share and comment on our posts. 
  • Share this page with your friends and colleagues using Indiegogo's share tools. 
  • Post to your own social media and email friends using our Supporters' Kit.
story_txt:
Deepening kids' love of reading 
Banging your head against the wall trying to get your screens-obsessed child reading on their own? 
Having trouble sifting through the endless stream of children’s literature to find the books that will help your super reader soar to new heights? 
Even after 15 years helping literacy educators use technology to support learning, I felt the same way as I struggled to help my older son learn to love books in spite of a reading-specific learning disability and tried to help my always-reading younger son branch out.
So, I teamed up with data scientist Kathleen Perez-Lopez to found Mia Learning in 2017. Since then, we've built software in collaboration with top educational researchers, teachers, librarians, and creative writers, winning the Most Promising Innovation Prize from Booz Allen Hamilton and federal R&D funding. 

 
Virtual conversations and real books 
Secret Agent Mia's Book Club brings Mia Learning's award winning conversational artificial intelligence software directly to homes for the first time, enabling kids to choose and own new books each month that are perfect for them while expanding their interests, increasing their motivation, and deepening their love of reading. 

 
Deeply grounded in research, developed with top experts, Mia Learning's software is already proving highly effective in schools. National Science Foundation-funded study shows Mia boosted students' motivation at a 32% annualized rate, benefiting both struggling and gifted readers.

 
How it works  
Kids talk with Secret Agent Mia, their loveable voice chatbot, to get personalized recommendations, receive copies of real print books each month, and reflect on their reading. 
 
Engaging voice conversations
On a laptop, tablet, or phone—your choice—kids talk to Mia, and she understands them and speaks back (like Alexa or Siri) through a totally private and secure website. They love accompanying Mia on secret missions to defeat Dr. Boredom.
"It’s the coolest when kids see Mia as this character that they identify with, who’s listening to them and interacting with them in a very concrete, realistic way. It’s something that hasn't really been done before." - Chris Hils, Director of Programs, Treehouse Books

 
Recommend, Read, Reflect Cycle 
Mia gets kids eyes off the screen and into a book in just two twenty minute conversations each month through the recommend, read, and reflect cycle. 

1. Recommend: AI linked to our experts' knowledge about reading, learning, and 10,000+ books helps Mia give deeply personalized recommendations that reflect each child's unique interests, challenges, abilities, and dreams. 
"I really appreciate a tool that helps parents to find books that are going to match their particular interests and proclivities, and that include some recently published books maybe we have never heard of but children are very eager and excited to read." - Nell Duke, Professor, Literacy, Language & Culture, University of Michigan


Eliza, 7, explains how Mia helps her discover unexpected new favorites
 
 

2. Read: Mia delivers new print copies of two books kids choose from Mia's recommendations to their home each month, and kids can't wait to read them. 
"I love that Mia guides my child in picking books and that she always regularly has new ones she will read and learn from about without me having to worry about whether I’ve paid enough attention. She’s loved all the books Mia helped her pick." - Rachel Houghton, Parent

 
3. Reflect: Mia talks with kids again after they've read, helping them reflect on their experiences and offering personalized video coaching to help them get more out of reading. 
"Mia's always there. Mia's never crabby. Mia always has time to listen. She can always give a reasoned response. In those ways, Mia is a great support for both the child and the adults who are working them." - Kathryn Pierce, Assistant Professor of Education, St. Louis University
Kids learn to make more powerful choices about reading, and Mia learns too. Machine learning makes Mia get better and better over time. 

 

Bringing Mia directly to families
What we need 
People frequently ask me, "When can I get Mia for my kids?" Although we developed Mia for use in schools, we don't want families to have to wait until their schools adopt Mia to benefit. To provide Secret Agent Mia's Book Club directly to individual homes, we need to raise $25,000 to adapt our software. We will use these funds to optimize our account management, notifications, and book fulfillment systems. The software works great for kids today, but we want to make parents' experience superb as well. 
In addition, due to the technical excellence and educational impact our Phase I project, Mia Learning is eligible for Phase II Small Business Innovation Research funding from the National Science Foundation. Your contribution will help provide the proof of consumer demand required to receive the $750,000 grant when we apply at the end of the summer. 

 
What you get
So, we need your help, and we're offering perks to recognize your contributions, including: 

Secret Agent Mia stickers and t-shirts, exclusively available through this campaign
Secret Agent Mia's Book Club subscriptions for the young readers in your life. Pre-order for three months up to a year. 
Subscription sponsorships for children and schools in low-income communities
An exclusive, one-time-only chance to teach Mia to answer your question. 
Personalized recording of Mia thanking you  for your support
An opportunity for your young reader to write a book review Mia shares with other kids around the world in her recommendations

Lunch with the founders of Mia Learning in Washington, D.C. 


Plus, cool prizes: Everyone who contributes receives a chance to win a $250 Amazon gift certificate, a custom drawing by acclaimed artist Jane Mount your ideal bookcase, and more to be announced. 
 

Social impact
Learning to read is essential to success in life, but now more than ever we need kids who not only can read but do read. In our complex, ever-changing world, reading the right books, and lots of them, leads to more than just academic success. Books can deepen kids’ understanding, broaden their interests, and expand their empathy and emotional intelligence.
It’s no exaggeration to say that reading for enjoyment among school-age children is in real danger: around age 9, voluntary reading plummets a staggering 39%. Yet if kids can make empowered, educated decisions about their own reading and build their personal libraries, their likelihood of reading on their own skyrockets. Secret Agent Mia's Book Club can help.  
Mia Learning believes reading’s benefits should not be limited to a privileged few. That’s why when you contribute to Mia, you also provide children from a low-income household with books. Children’s book ownership is highly inequitable in the United States. The ratio of children to developmentally appropriate books for sale in low income neighborhoods is over 300:1. Getting first in line for Mia will benefit your children and those who are in need.

The most significant risk we face in delivering on the promise of this campaign is delays due to unexpected technical obstacles. Although Mia Learning's engineers are world class, if there's one thing I've learned about software development over the last 20 years, it's that it's impossible to predict perfectly how long work will take. We've listed our best estimates for each perk, and we commit to sending backers frequent updates on our progress. (Reminder: If we don't make our campaign goal, you get a 100% refund.)

story:
'We didn't know SOAS was in occupation. We found the short so inspiring we screened it the following day'. Brighton university students in occupation. 

'Thanks the students loved watching it'. Lecturer in Glasgow. 

'There’s no one answer. At a general level, we all know the same and right answers, educate, organize, act as appropriate. As we become less abstract the answers vary greatly, depending on individual circumstances, goals, opportunities.  We have to find our own place in this broad spectrum of opportunities’. Professor Noam Chomsky's response to the Director's question what can we do about budget cuts?

What is it about? The 90 minute feature documentary follows a group of students as they take on the establishment in the battle for education.                   

The film begins with the court case against SOAS students, when students were served a High-Court injunction three hours before their trial at the Royal Courts of Justice in October. The film subsequently follows these students and their preparations for the protest on the day of the vote in December. The documentary gives insight into student political engagement and activism.

 

What do we need? Post-production costs. $10,000 = £6,122. There were no funds to make the documentary, just a lot of good will. The short vid has been seen across the country in student occupations and has inspired countless students. But there are 100s of hours of footage to edit and it now needs a full offline edit. It then needs an online edit and a website designed where schools, universities and community groups can access it as well as DVDs made to be sent free of charge to universities, schools and community organisations.

What needs editing? The court case, occupation, teach-ins at SOAS and teach-outs in public spaces where the chant, 'Tell me what democracy looks like. This is what democracy looks like' filled the London air. SOAS was a space where leading academics chose to speak about budget cuts, the impact on women, minority groups, education, the economic climate and the history of British politics. Think Ted Talks in occupation and you have  dynamic, forthright, and political discussions. 

Politicians popped into the occupation space to lend their support, students debated, voted alongside lecturers, prepared for peaceful protest, alongside the infamous SOAS samba band. Two student protests were filmed; one of which saw the Times newspaper state, 'The Government may consider using rubber bullets and water cannons'. Think the right to protest.

Interviews were taken with students directly after the December protest which ended with police brutality, where they speak openly about what happened to them. Extras: In addition there will be extras from other protests filmed at the same time.

 

Who am I? My name is Corine Dhondee, I'm a documentary filmmaker, writer and a student. In October 2010 I visited the SOAS student occupation. I was on my way to a student protest but what I saw worried me so much that I decided to stay. 

 

In court the Judge stated that, 'although the SOAS occupation has been peaceful, how the media reported Millbank means that it is possible for all students to be violent'. These words have stayed with me, it meant that all students were subsequently criminalised. In a court of law where everyone is innocent before proven guilty there was no justice.

 

I filmed with SOAS students from October to December 2010. The footage collected is a counter-narrative to the popular media's image of students as deviant. At the time of writing many students and under 18s believe it is illegal to protest. This documentary says yes, you have the right to protest and yes, protest can make a difference. Together let's make it happen.

story:
As Poland moves towards media restrictions, youth in Warsaw share the Twenty-First Century struggles against depression, low self-esteem, limited access to higher education, high youth unemployment, and heightened immigration tensions with their global brothers and sisters. Breaking Walls guides young men and women to serve as a model of the transformative power of the arts, cultural exchange and global citizenship, creating an alternative community that models peaceful cohabitation and positive social interaction.

To ensure that Breaking Walls creates a sustainable collaboration, we offer three levels of involvement for youth:

1. Artists who write and perform their original work for a live audience
2. Ambassadors who are former artists mentoring the writing/performing process
3. Associates who are participants from past Breaking Walls initiatives who become prominent leaders in their home communities.

Each young man and woman returns to their home community after our ten-day, intensive writing, performing, ensemble building experience, having explored their imagination and embraced their creativity. And ready—in the areas of compassion, collaboration, accountability, and commitment—to nurture a world in which we can all trust one another.

story:
Help bring Mosquito KA114 to Airventure 2015


If you are attending Airventure this year and would like the opportunity to see the only currently flying deHavilland Mosquito display at the airshow then here is where you can make that happen.

This year EAA is commemorating the 75th anniversary of the Battle of Britain and the 70th anniversary of the victory in Europe. Numerous icons from the battles of WWII will be in attendance and the inclusion of the Mosquito to the aerial line up will be the icing on the cake!

You will also have an opportunity to get up close and personal with this hero of WWII.

We have secured corporate support for up to 50% of the appearance fee and need your help to raise the balance.

  • With your generous support we will be able to secure the attendance of this fabulous aircraft at this years show. Plans are for the Mosquito to attend the show from Monday the 20th through to Sunday the 26.
  • A range of unique perks are available to cater for all budgets, starting with our limited edition Mosquito Supporters Tee Shirt, through to the once in a lifetime opportunity to be on board the aircraft during a daily engine ground run.                       
  • Supporters T Shirt. 100% cotton (Only available through this campaign) 
  • Miracle of KA114 Short Film DVD

  • Your seat for the engine runs!

    Please Note:  An average level of fitness and physical ability is required to climb the ladder and enter the cockpit.

  • Your Money is Safe!     Should we not reach our funding goal and the Mosquito does not attend Airventure 2015 you will have the opportunity to remain a supporter and receive the Tee shirt, or the Tee shirt + DVD. If you do not wish to receive these items, or if you have chosen the cockpit tour or engine run, then you will be refunded your contribution less the admin fee charged by Indiegogo of 9%.
  • How to redeem your Perk!   After paying for your Perk you will receive a confirmation email from Indiegogo confirming your contribution. Please print off that email and bring it with you to our tent situated next to the Mosquito. This email contains your unique Pledge ID  which will enable you to redeem your Perk.  

Risks 

  • The Mosquito is a complex aircraft and like all things mechanical, can occasionally become unserviceable.  In the unlikely event that some mechanical problem prevents the aircraft from attending the show then a refund will be offered just like if we fail to reach the funding goal as detailed above.   

  • If the aircraft is late arriving then we will endeavor to fit everyone in for their tour or engine run, but if that is not possible then you too will be refunded.
  • Weather can also play a part in messing up our arrangements and if this happens, then the remedies offered for mechanical problems will similarly apply. 

Lets make it happen!

story:
Who Are we?

The last few months have been extremely exhilarating with introduction of robotics in our high school, St Mary's. This wonderful experience has truly widened our horizons in all aspects. Robotics has helped us take learning beyond the realm of our classroom and mundane textbooks. None of us ever imagined how exciting Science and mathematics could actually be!

Until we joined robotics, “united we stand, divided we fall” was just a trite saying that was inscribed within our minds. However, this experience taught us its true meaning. As a team we had several highs and lows; but we rose above these challenges and developed friendships that will last a lifetime. One Important lesson that we have learnt is that there is no problem that we can’t solve if we are determined; Be it a missing screw or a huge ego battle! We’ve learnt to understand matters in depth even if it may entail long debates, like the one we had on the difference between speed and velocity! Meeting deadlines, efficient division of tasks, working under pressure and team management are some of the many skills that will take us a long way.

Working along with three other teams, we have realised the impact that “gracious professionalism” has in general. Treating everyone with respect and promoting healthy competition has created a positive environment that favours our ultimate goal of learning.

We have realised that building a robot was just a minor part of our journey; The real experience has been the prodigious learning that will be a part of our lives forever.

And finally we have learnt that life like our programs has immense possibilities with each stage full of syntax errors; We just have to push ourselves and conquer them all!


What we have achieved and why we need funds.

After a wonderful experience at the regionals we went to Delhi for the FTC Nationals. At the nationals we  won the Third place Inspire Award for our overall excellence, the PTC Design Award for our robust robot design and the Motivate Award for our undying enthusiasm. And now we are all pumped up to go to Sydney for the Asia Pacific Invitational 2015. We are all set to win it. However, such an endeavour will definitely require a considerable amount of monetary input; To be exact, it is around ten lakh forty thousand rupees. We would love if you could help us realise our dream and fund us 8 innovators in our journey. Even a small amount would help!

How will you help us?

This competition, organised by the multinational non profit organisation FIRST, is a road that we have never traveled. It all seems so surreal. We truly are representing our country on a worldwide scale event. The different people we will meet, the virtues that we will imbibe, the knowledge that we will gain, will all help  us develop as better individuals. It is a once in a lifetime opportunity, and we really do not want to lose it. It's an open door that we cannot afford to miss!

Risks & Challenges

Yes, there are many obstacles in our way. We are working with available resources, out of soda cans, duct tape and rubber bands. But nonetheless, it is an enhancing enriching journey. You as sponsors of our goal, will not only help us perform better in the competition that is going to be held on the 10th of July but also enrich us as people. You will be nurturing a new generation of scientists and innovators. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please do share this with all of your friends. The more support we get for our purpose, the closer we get to the journey of a lifetime!

story:
Hello!

We, from Chaild, are four motivated students of the Nyenrode New Business School. In November we went to India and saw a lot of beautiful, but sadly also a lot of heart breaking things. We saw both children who were very happy and enjoyed education, but we also saw children who stood on the side of the highway begging for money.

This project is to get the kids away from the dangerous highway and get them in the schoolbanks.

I guess that at this moment you are thinking: How are those four students in the Netherlands help the poorest children in India? Well, when we were in India we also met The Round Table of India. They have a program called Freedom Trough Education, where they build schools and improve existing schools so every child has the opportunity to get educated.

We will give the money that we raise to The Round Table and they will make sure it goes to the places where they need it the most.

To raise money we thought it was a good idea to sell something that comes from India; tea, or as they call it in India, Chai. The tea is of course fairtrade and no children labor is used in the production of this tea.

We sell packages of tea, which are nice as a gift or just for your own use, but also do we sell an one year subscribtion for the real tea-lovers. With the subscription you will receive 12 months long every month some tea.

Awareness is really important in order to help as much children as possible. To draw as much attention as possible we would like to ask if you could share our story and our product as much as possible.

For contact, please send an email to chaildnnbs@gmail.com

Thank you!

Chaild.
story_txt:
Hello! 
We, from
Chaild, are four motivated students of the Nyenrode New Business School. In
November we went to India and saw a lot of beautiful, but sadly also a lot of
heart breaking things. We saw both children who were very happy and enjoyed
education, but we also saw children who stood on the side of the highway
begging for money.
This
project is to get the kids away from the dangerous highway and get them in the
schoolbanks. 
I guess
that at this moment you are thinking: How are those four students in the
Netherlands help the poorest children in India? Well, when we were in India we
also met The Round Table of India. They have a program called Freedom Trough
Education, where they build schools and improve existing schools so every child
has the opportunity to get educated. 
We will
give the money that we raise to The Round Table and they will make sure it goes
to the places where they need it the most.

story:
January 14th-15th | Gainesville, FL | Free Admission | SwampCon.org

Get into the Halloween spirit cause these are some spooky scary deals!!

  • Rocket Man (Variants 1 and 2): lowered from $35 to now $30!!
  • Stardust Crusader: lowered from $50 to now $40!!
  • Bounty Hunter: lowered from $90 to now $70!!
  • King of All Cosmos: lowered from $200 to now $100!!

SwampCon is an annual, multi-media convention held in Gainesville, Florida on the University of Florida campus. Our convention celebrates many genres, including anime, sci-fi, tabletop, video games, and more. It is absolutely free to attend!

For this year's event, we've reached for the sky. Our theme, SwampCon: Frontier, is the space western, the blend of science fiction and western tropes, a theme that pays homage to our roots while settling in new territory. With a fully revamped venue, we're pioneers in a new world, and it's a world we're ready to share with all of you.

SwampCon: Frontier will be held January 14th-15th, 2017 and run all day for both days. It will be hosted at the J. Wayne Reitz Union on the University of Florida campus.

Some of our main attractions for this year include:

  • Whosical the Musical
  • Fanmade Vocaloid Hologram Concert
  • SwampCon Drag Show, featuring local performers
  • Gator Anime’s Maid Cafe
  • Panels presented on a myriad of topics
  • Special media guest appearances including voice actors, internet personalities, and industry guests
  • Vendors and artists offering merchandise and art for sale

For six years now, SwampCon has been a convention with zero cost for admission. Each year we grow in size and take on more roles, and as a result, we rely on more funding from sponsorships and donors like you!

All income donated to our event will be used to help run SwampCon: Frontier and allow us to continue making improvements on our programming and overall features.

Contributions will go toward funding:

  • Our lovely convention guides, prints, and merchandise that you see the day of the convention!
  • Special guests! With more support, we can invite more lovely guests!
  • Prizes and support for our wonderful contests and events!
  • Food and supplies for our fantastic and hard-working volunteer staff!

As a show of our thanks for your donations, we offer several rewards listed as perks:

  • Credits in Programming: Your name will be mentioned on our website, social media, our convention guide, and in the credits to the Vocaloid Hologram Concert.
  • Out of this World Buttons: You will receive our beautiful 2.25" buttons with original artwork from the SwampCon Design Team!

  • The Most Prized Print in the Galaxy: You will receive a 4x6 print of original artwork from the SwampCon Design Team!

  • Spacetastic Stickers: You will receive three stickers of original artwork from the SwampCon Design Team, with capabilities to stick them anywhere you want.

  • Official SwampCon: Frontier T-Shirt: One of our dandy t-shirts will be reserved for you to pick up at the con! Although we will be selling them at the con, supplies are limited, so act now! T-Shirts come in sizes S, M, L, XL, XXL, and XXXL. Please email swampconfundraising@gmail.com with your size preference after you donate.

  • VIP Seating at Main Events: You will be granted access to limited VIP seating at some of our Main Events including the Doctor Who play, Drag Show, Maid Cafe, and Special Guest Panels.
  • Access to Convention Break Room: You will be able to visit our special break room during the convention. Inside there will be free food and drink and a place to relax after spending hours exploring SwampCon's events and panels.
  • Commissioned Digital Art: Commissions are offered by the SwampCon Design Team and are done on one level. After donating, please indicate your top two preferred artists. If one of our artists has filled up with commissions already, we will default to your second choice. Please email swampconfundraising@gmail.com with your choices after you donate. (Please note that this is for a digital commission only and you will not receive a physical version.)

Our artists this year along with samples of their work:

Gabriella Fagundez (0 of 2 available)

Martha Felts (2 of 2 available)

Jasmin Davis (1 of 2 available)

Lucas McConnell (1 of 2 available)

Serena Christy (0 of 2 available)

Pye Naing (2 of 2 available)

Ariel Terrazas (2 of 2 available)

SwampCon is organized by college students who devote their time and effort to making a free, enjoyable, and exhilarating convention. Each year we learn more about planning, how we can improve, and what you, the donors and attendees, love about SwampCon the most!

We make SwampCon for you, and it is your support that drives us forward and keeps us dedicated.

For any questions, comments, or concerns, please email swampconfundraising@gmail.com

story:
Thank you to those of you who have supported the efforts of Hope of Guinea, former Peace Corps Volunteers,  and MindLeaps by donating to our previous fundraising page. We were able to raise $2, 755 because of you!

In thinking about our mission of giving hope to all children, we decided to have a round 2 for our fundraising campaign. More and more people are learning about this initiative and find it a worthwhile investment. If you go to Hope of Guinea's Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/hope.ofguinea/), you can get more information about the Camp, our partners and volunteers. With your support we can give students in Guinea the opportunity to discover hands on experiments, and the tools and confidence to see themselves as leaders and innovators within the STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Math) fields and within their communities. 

Background- Guinea

Guinea is one of the least developed countries in the world, rated 182nd in the Human Development Index and recently ravaged by an Ebola epidemic. From these facts alone, it is no surprise that the educational system in Guinea is not able to provide all students the necessary tools to be critical learners, innovators and leaders. 

Guinea desperately needs health care providers, infrastructure engineers, well-trained teachers, and many more well educated professionals. However, relatively few development organizations are on the ground in Guinea, compared to nearby Sierra Leone, Liberia, and Senegal. Cultural barriers are high, especially for English-speaking and Christian charities in this Francophone, primarily Muslim country. And yet, curious, determined young Guineans are just begging for the chance to learn more and expand their horizons. 

This is where you, Hope of Guinea and its partners come in. 

Initiative

The Hope of Guinea STEAM ( Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Science) Camp 2016 that will take place from July 11th to July 29th. It is a joint partnership between Hope of Guinea, MindLeaps, and Returned Peace Corps Volunteers from Guinea. The STEAM Camp is based on a successful project designed and implemented by Peace Corps Volunteers in the summer of 2014. 

Well into implementation, the concept of the camp is to provide resources and ways of learning to kids in Guinea whether in  school or on the street. Hope of Guinea aims to provide hope to all children with its first STEAM Camp. For three weeks, from Monday through Thursday, selected kids of junior high age will perform experiments, participate in engaging field trips, and develop techniques in traditional and non traditional dance forms. 

Planned experimental activities include: chicken dissection, microscope skill lessons, a bridge building competition, DNA extraction, a game modeling disease spread, and the creation of electromagnets. Several field trips are planned, such as a visit to a hydroelectric dam and a sustainable farm. 

One of our partners, MindLeaps, will bring lessons on traditional Guinean dance, hip-hop, and classical ballet. Instructors will praise effort and use growth mindset tools like summarizing to help students access long-term memory.  A "growth mindset" is a way of learning that is supported by research in neuroplasticity and psychology. It encourages critical thinking and failure, two aspects of learning that are never emphasized in the memorization-bound Guinean education system. We believe that by opening our students eyes to a "growth mindset" and engaging them fully through art and dance in addition to science, engineering, math and critical thinking skills, we can make a lasting impact on the leaders of today and tomorrow.

We Need Your Support... How You Can Help

We need to raise $27,541 to successfully run, evaluate and begin expanding this program so that it has a long term impact that not only works to give the students the tools to empower themselves but also tools for teachers in country to help sustain and incorporate growth mindset within Guinea's educational system. Small changes can have a big impact and your support makes the difference in how big that impact is.

The funds raised will cover the following expenses:

  • Materials required to teach the curriculum and for participants to design and build projects and experiments
  • Materials  and curriculum for local instructors to take back to their schools after the camp to create after-school science clubs;
  • Create 5 year around after-school STEAM clubs at 5 different schools;
  • Food and snacks for the participants
  • Round trip flights to/from Guinea for our instructors;
  • Internet usage during the camp- Technology aspect of Camp
  • Pre- and post-camp assessment and evaluations for all camp participants.
  • Modest stipends for our volunteer staff
  • Lodging and transportation for international instructors;
  • Advertising and branding

'Contribute to Sustainable Hope'

One very successful event that members of our team led was a National Science Camp. We’re using the framework from that, combined with current learning methods and artistic outlets to make a significant change in the lives of the 50 students and 5 teachers at our camps. We know from previous camps that students introduced to new, exciting experiences will go home with confidence and a new found curiosity in exploring STEAM and its correlation to the challenges that their communities face. Additionally, we will be training 5 Guinean teachers from across the country on how to run camps like this one in their own schools. Not only will they participate in our camp, but they’ll go home with a written guide and materials that they would never have been able to procure otherwise, like microscopes, calculators, and test tubes. Once our camp is finished at the end of July, we will encourage the teachers to organize their own camps, ideally right before school starts in October and create after-school science clubs. If each of our five teachers holds a camp with 30 students per semester, our project will have been responsible for bringing scientific discovery to 300 students in one year. 

We are currently in the process of creating a tool to assess the camp and the impact that our 5 teachers will have. We are committed to giving hope to Guinea's future STEAM leaders and hope you join us in our initiative.

Marnie’s Idea Mill is a creative way to fund my efforts at helping people become more creative.

 

The money raised will buy me time away from teaching in order to design and implement creativity workshops for individuals, organizations, and businesses.

 

I am an award-winning teacher who wants to take what I’ve learned about creativity and apply it beyond the classroom.

  •  I’ve taught at UW-Richland since 1992, typically four full courses a semester.
  •  I’m a writer who has published poetry (in journals like Prairie Schooner and the Antioch Review) as well as fiction, creative nonfiction, and craft articles (in the Writer’s Chronicle).
  •  But I’ve also been studying creativity as a scholar, particularly in the respected Wisconsin Teaching Fellow and Teaching Scholar programs. I’ve presented my findings at state and international conferences.

You can read more about me and my creativity research on my blog, at http://marniere.wordpress.com/ (You can also contact me through the blog.)

 

Creativity can impact us in so many ways. Everything from “what’s for dinner?” to “how can politicians work together” can benefit from a creative approach.

 

It’s not about being artistic—it’s about using what research shows us about the stages of creativity, how successful creativity comes about, how to measure it, and how to increase it.

 

I almost called this "the Wisconsin Idea Mill" because what I'm trying to do really does embody the Wisconsin Idea--the notion that the borders of the university are the borders of the state (and beyond). I want to take what works in the classroom and share it beyond the classroom--and then bring it back into the classroom, to show students what works in the "real world." 

You can choose from several perks, including a shout-out on my blog, a collection of my poems about teaching, feedback on your own creative writing, a customized sonnet, or a personal creativity coaching session. (Because I am working with the Richland County Campus Foundation, the part of your contribution above the value of the perk is tax-deductible—you’ll get an email receipt from First Giving.)

 

My total fundraising goal is $24,000. (It costs $6,000 per course to replace me in the classroom.) As of Monday, 6/3/13, I have a total of $10,000 in contributions and pledges.

  •  Thus, I need $14,000 to reach my overall total.
  •  The goal for Marnie’s Idea Mill on Indiegogo is $4,000, but I’m hoping to exceed that goal.
  •  I will be seeking the remainder of the funds from individuals and businesses.
  •  I am working with the Richland County Campus Foundation—they are collecting the funds, and if I reach the $24,000 goal by July 1, my time away from teaching will be an official UW System Sabbatical.  If  I don’t reach the full $24,000, I will negotiate time away from teaching a course at a time for Fall 2013.  Any funds raised in excess of $24,000 will be donated to the Richland County Campus Foundation, to be used for student scholarships or faculty/staff professional development.
  • NOTE: Funds can be sent directly to the Richland County Campus Foundation between June 17 and July 1, at UW-Richland.

You can help me make this creative vision a reality by contributing, obviously, but it will also help if you share the site with others you think could contribute, give me feedback on what  I may need to say differently or in addition to what I’ve said here, and most of all, sending me your good wishes!

story:
My name is Denny Morelock Sr. I am a veteran race driver with over 25 years in racing, but more imporntly i am a Grandfather of a little boy who was violently shaken at 3 months old.He had a brain bleed, retnal hemorrhges, and 5 broken ribs, he was a victim of Shaken Baby Syndrome! I started a support/ educational group Shaken Baby Syndrome of Ohio. I vowed to do everything in my power to bring education and awareness about SBS, so families will not have to go thru, what we did 6 years ago. I want to take my Dirt Modified race team to race tracks, area events, and public appearances To reachout to thousands of people, who may have never heard of SBS and how to help us save babies lives.

You can help us make a diffrence with your dollars, which go to pay for the travel, entrance,  and everything needed to make this campaign successful.  Racing unfortunately is not cheap but gives us the best opportunity to reach as many poeple a s possible. For a contribution to this campaign you will be apart of our team and we will put your name on the race car. We will take a picture of your name and post it on the Shaken Baby Syndrome of Ohio facebook page! We also will be doing up team tee shirts and any contribution of $100 or more will get one of these! The bigger the contribution the bigger the perks! 
If we fall short of our goal All money raised will go to the national Shaken Baby syndrome center in Utah. Visit them at www.don'tshake.org. please get involved and help save babies lives. Let us be the voice, for those who can't. 
The team will race in the Ohio, Indiana, Kentucky area and if you contribute and are in this area, and would like us to come to a event, we will try and work with you to make that happen. We had a chance to drive in the NASCAR truck series with a team, but it fell through. So now we need your help to make this happen!
