story:
Scrapbooking isn’t about scraps of paper and photos. Scrapbooking is about scraps of life. –Rebecca Sower

Healing Hearts and Educating Through Scrapbooking

Experiencing the death of a child through miscarriage, stillbirth, or newborn death can be the most devastating event of a parent’s life. Those going through the death of a baby have described it as a silent loss saying, “Not everyone can hear your pain" and “You need to be recognized as a parent, but where do you go to get that recognition when no one knew your baby?” [1] Scrapbooking is an avenue toward helping parents heal and helping communities, including family members, friends, and healthcare providers, understand child loss.

The Scraps of the Heart Project is a partnership between  Erin Willer along with her students in the Department of Communication Studies at the University of Denver and Colorado Pregnancy and Newborn Loss Services (CPNL). CPNL is a 501(c)(3) non-profit community-based organization whose mission is “healing parents to promote healthy families” following the loss of a child. Together we are building a program to begin in Fall 2014 that will provide scrapbooking workshops to bereaved parents. Creating scrapbooks is a way for parents to memorialize, celebrate, and share their babies. Parents in our program also will be invited to display their scrapbooks publically if they choose at venues such as CPNL's annual wine and chocolate benefit. This community expression of grief has the potential to offer education to those who lack understanding of the pain of child loss and healing to those who know such sorrow all too well.

Where Did This Idea Come From?

Erin Willer is the mother to Matilda Plum and her twin angel brother Milo Juniper, who died on February 8, 2013 when he was three hours old. Erin also experienced two miscarriages before giving birth to Matilda and Milo; these angels are Our Baby (O.B.) and Baby Willer (B.W.). Although Erin had never scrapbooked before, after she and her husband Mark lost O.B., she had a strong desire to capture her memories. The scrapbook not only became what she and Mark had instead of their baby, but it also became a way to help others understand their grief and the significance of O.B.’s life. As a professor of interpersonal and family communication at the University of Denver who studies infant loss, Erin joined with Dorotha Cicchinelli, the Executive Director of CPNL, in order to support bereaved parents through scrapbooking. Erin and her students will bring their research skills to the project in order to study the scrapbooking process and further educate community and academic audiences about infant loss. In short, the Scraps of the Heart Project is a gift from O.B., B.W., and Milo Willer. Erin and Mark thank you in advance for helping their babies give it.   

What Your Contributions Will Help Us Do

Our goal is to provide scrapbooking materials to at least 50 families. The cost of the materials for one scrapbook is approximately $100. Part of a Public Good Fund research grant from the University of Denver's Center for Community Engagement and Service Learning is helping us purchase supplies for 20 families.  Therefore, our campaign goal is to raise enough money to provide materials for at least 30 more families. All funds we raise up to our funding goal will help us provide parents with scrapbook supplies (e.g., scrapbook, stickers, paper) for the workshops. If we go over our funding goal, we will purchase scrapbook supplies for additional families and other items for the project, including supplies for exhibiting the scrapbooks (e.g. bookstands) and promotion materials for the exhibits (e.g., flyers, invitations).

How You Can Help

  • Donate your dollars here
  • Donate new or gently used scrapbooking supplies. Please call us at 303-871-4308 or email scrapsoftheheartproject@gmail.com if you would like to donate supplies.
  • Share this IndieGoGo campaign page with your social networks.
  • Like our Scraps of the Heart Facebook page and encourage others to do the same.
  • Share the videos below on social media to spread the word about The Scraps of the Heart Project campaign. After studying the topic of infant loss and interviewing parents who have lost children, undergraduate students at the University of Denver in Erin Willer’s course “Visual Narratives of Women’s Health” made these videos (and the one at the top of this page) for the campaign.


Thank you for your support!


[1] de Montigny, F., Beaudet, L., & Dumas, L. (1999). A baby has died: The impact of perinatal loss on family social networks. Journal of Obstetric, Gynecologic, and Neonatal Nursing, 28, 151-156.
story_txt:
Scrapbooking
isn’t about scraps of paper and photos. Scrapbooking
is about scraps of life. –Rebecca
Sower
Healing Hearts
and Educating Through Scrapbooking
Experiencing the death of a child through miscarriage, stillbirth, or
newborn death can be the most devastating event of a parent’s life. Those going
through the death of a baby have described it as a silent loss saying, “Not
everyone can hear your pain" and “You
need to be recognized as a parent, but where do you go to get that recognition
when no one knew your baby?”
[1] Scrapbooking is an avenue toward helping parents heal and helping communities, including family
members, friends, and healthcare providers, understand child loss.
The Scraps of the Heart Project is a partnership between  Erin Willer along with her students in the Department of Communication Studies at the University of Denver and Colorado Pregnancy and Newborn Loss Services (CPNL). CPNL is a 501(c)(3) non-profit
community-based organization whose mission is “healing parents to promote
healthy families” following the loss of a child. Together we are building a
program to begin in Fall 2014 that will provide scrapbooking workshops to bereaved parents. Creating
scrapbooks is a way for parents to memorialize, celebrate, and share their
babies. Parents in our program also will be invited to display their
scrapbooks publically if they choose at venues such as CPNL's annual wine and chocolate benefit. This community expression of grief has
the potential to offer education to those who lack understanding of the pain of child loss and healing to those who know such sorrow all too well.
Where Did This Idea Come From?Erin Willer is the mother to Matilda Plum and her twin angel brother Milo Juniper, who died on February 8, 2013 when he was three hours old. Erin also experienced two miscarriages before giving birth to Matilda and Milo; these angels are Our Baby (O.B.) and Baby Willer (B.W.). Although Erin had never scrapbooked before, after she and her husband Mark lost O.B., she had a strong desire to capture her memories. The scrapbook not only became what she and Mark had instead of their baby, but it also became a way to help others understand their grief and the significance of O.B.’s life. As a professor of interpersonal and family communication at the University of Denver who studies infant loss, Erin joined with Dorotha Cicchinelli, the Executive Director of CPNL, in order to support bereaved parents through scrapbooking. Erin and her students will bring their research skills to the project in order to study the scrapbooking process and further educate community and academic audiences about infant loss. In short, the Scraps of the Heart Project is a gift from O.B., B.W., and Milo Willer. Erin and Mark thank you in advance for helping their babies give it.   What Your
Contributions Will Help Us Do
Our goal is to provide scrapbooking materials to at least 50 families. The cost of the materials for one scrapbook is approximately $100. Part of a Public Good Fund research grant from the University of Denver's Center for Community Engagement and Service Learning is helping us purchase supplies for 20 families.  Therefore, our
campaign goal is to raise enough money to provide materials for at least 30 more families. All funds we
raise up to our funding goal will help us provide parents with scrapbook supplies
(e.g., scrapbook, stickers, paper) for the workshops. If we go over our funding
goal, we will purchase scrapbook supplies for additional families and other items for the project, including supplies for
exhibiting the scrapbooks (e.g. bookstands) and promotion materials for the
exhibits (e.g., flyers, invitations).
How You Can
Help
Donate your dollars here

Donate new or gently used scrapbooking supplies.
Please call us at 303-871-4308 or email scrapsoftheheartproject@gmail.com if you
would like to donate supplies.

Share this IndieGoGo campaign page with your
social networks.
Like our Scraps of the Heart Facebook page and encourage others to do the same.
Share the videos below on social media to spread
the word about The Scraps of the Heart Project campaign. After studying the topic of
infant loss and interviewing parents who have lost children, undergraduate
students at the University of Denver in Erin Willer’s course “Visual
Narratives of Women’s Health” made these videos (and the one at the top of this page) for the campaign.

Thank you for your support!

[1] de Montigny, F., Beaudet, L.,
& Dumas, L. (1999). A baby has died: The impact of perinatal loss on
family social networks. Journal of
Obstetric, Gynecologic, and Neonatal Nursing, 28, 151-156.

story:
Para cambiar tu vida necesitas tener las herramientas apropiadas. En la escuela de Relatoras las hemos creado y queremos abrir un Fondo de Becas para que puedan acceder a ellas todas las mujeres que las necesiten. ¿Nos ayudas?

When you`re up to change your life, you need to have the right tools. In Relatoras school we´ve created them and we want to fund scholarships and make theese tools available to all the women in the world. ¿Will you help us to achieve it?

(Whole text in english here)

(Fond de bourses de Relatoras en français ici)

¿Qué es Relatoras?

Relatoras es un proyecto destinado a las mujeres. Aunque nuestra sede está en Sevilla, España, la parte más importante de nuestra labor es virtual e involucra a personas de todo el planeta. Nuestro trabajo se desarrolla en dos proyectos independientes. Por una parte, una librería física en Sevilla y una librería de mujeres online. 


Por la otra, nuestra plataforma de aprendizaje, formada por Helvéticas Escuela de Escritoras en la que impartimos talleres presenciales y ONLINE de escritura autobiográfica, creativa y terapéutica; 


y el Campus Relatoras, donde ofrecemos cursos de diversas temáticas (fotografía, psicología, et.), también presenciales y ONLINE, que acompañan a las mujeres hacia el empoderamiento. En los siete años que llevamos con el proyecto, han pasado por Relatoras más de 700 alumnas de todo el mundo, de entre 20 y 70 años. Casi la mitad de nuestras alumnas proceden de América del Sur.


Sin embargo, cada día nos llegan cartas y llamadas de mujeres en situaciones económicas complicadas que no pueden pagar el precio, ya ajustado, de los talleres. Al ser un proyecto autogestionado e independiente, podemos hacer pocas excepciones. Por eso necesitamos tu ayuda para crear un Fondo de Becas y hacer que muchas más mujeres puedan acceder a nuestros cursos.

Ahora te estarás preguntando: ¿Por qué Relatoras? ¿Por qué nuestra escuela?

Porque es diferente. Todos nuestros talleres y cursos están enfocados al trabajo autobiográfico e interior de cada alumna, a la vez que propician la reflexión colectiva en torno a los estereotipos y las vivencias de las mujeres de nuestro tiempo. En todos los talleres, las alumnas exploran sus emociones, revalorizan su propia vida y sus experiencias como fuente de sabiduría e inspiración y reciben herramientas concretas con las que dinamizar el cambio que quieren ver en sus vidas. 

Nuestro taller ONLINE más exitoso, sin duda, es el “Señoras que… dejan de sufrir por amor”, coordinado por la antropóloga Coral Herrera Gómez, que ya va por su tercera edición. 

En la comunidad de nuestra escuela hemos podido observar cómo se transformaban algunas alumnas después de realizar un taller: hemos visto a mujeres que se atrevían a publicar sus obras después de haberlas escondido toda su vida; mujeres mayores que ingresaban por primera vez en la universidad; incluso mujeres que llegaban a denunciar situaciones de maltrato o abusos o un caso muy especial de una alumna se logró quedarse embarazada después de hacer un taller sobre la maternidad… pero, sobre todo, mujeres que dicen haber encontrado un lugar de pertenencia en el que son libres de ser ellas mismas.

¿Qué necesitamos?

Relatoras es un proyecto joven y autogestionado y tenemos que hacer malabares para poder pagar dignamente a las coordinadoras de los talleres, las facturas, los impuestos… Desde que comenzara la crisis económica en 2008, hemos reducido nuestras tarifas casi un 15% y hemos creado descuentos especiales para personas desempleadas. Pero aun así, hay muchas mujeres que no pueden pagarlos.

Con el Fondo de Becas podremos ofrecer descuentos de 80 % a las mujeres desempleadas. Cada beca estará destinada a pagarle a la profesora del taller (50 % del precio): Relatoras renunciará a su porcentaje (30 %) y la alumna pagará los gastos técnicos del taller (20 %). También crearemos descuentos especiales (de hasta 50%) para trabajadoras precarias.

(Las becas se otorgarán por orden de solicitud, siendo necesario demostrar la situación de desempleo. Las plazas becadas no superarán el 30% del total de las plazas ofertadas en cada taller)

También necesitamos difundir esta campaña y llegar a oídos de personas con posibilidad de ayudarnos. Comparte esta iniciativa en las redes sociales o reenvíala a todas tus amistades vía email. Si tienes una web o blog, puedes poner allí el logo de nuestra campaña y darle así más visibilidad.

¿Qué ofrecemos a cambio?

A cambio, te ofrecemos lo mejor que tenemos: nuestros talleres y nuestros libros. Hemos creado diferentes descuentos según la cuantía de dinero donado (las puedes ver en la columna de la derecha). Si no hablas español, no es un problema: en otoño de 2014 haremos una edición especial de un taller en inglés (¡no te olvides de indicarlo¡). 

Si no te apetece realizar ningún taller, también tenemos pegatinas, cuadernos y fantásticas bolsas con el dibujo de nuestra campaña. 

Si donas más de 500 € ¡te regalamos un taller, el que quieras y en la edición que prefieras! 
Y para aquellas organizaciones o personas que donen 1000 o 2000 euros, les obsequiaremos con un TALLER EXCLUSIVO, para 5 y 10 personas respectivamente, a elegir entre “Señoras que… dejan de sufrir por amor” y “Revelaciones de un mundo”. 

¡Imagínate poder hacer un taller con tus amigas, o regalarlo a las socias de tu fundación! Los talleres tendrán una duración de 4 semanas y están valorados en 90 €/persona. Además, tu organización aparecerá como patrocinadora de nuestra escuela el tiempo que duren los talleres becados. 


Nuestro proyecto de cerca.

La librería

Relatoras nació como librería virtual y hoy en día se ha convertido en la librería de mujeres online de referencia en el mundo de habla hispana. En su catálogo alberga más de 10000 obras entre literatura, poesía o cómic escritos casi en su totalidad por mujeres; ensayos sobre feminismo, sexualidad, salud o maternidad; y libros infantiles no sexistas, realizando una importante labor de visibilizar a mujeres escritoras, filósofas, poetas.En el año 2009 Relatoras inauguró su sede física en Sevilla, donde, además de libros, ofrecemos distintas actividades: presentaciones de libros, charlas, conferencias, talleres, exposiciones.

La escuela

La escuela de Relatoras se divide en dos partes. Por un lado está la Escuela de Escritoras Helvéticas, en la que se imparten los talleres de escritura creativa, autobiográfica y terapéutica. Por el otro, el Campus Relatoras, cuyos talleres son de temática más variada: fotografía, deconstrucción del amor romántico, maternidades, coaching, etc.

• Helvéticas

Helvéticas es una escuela para mujeres entre siglos, entre estereotipos, entre roles, entre lo público y lo privado, entre lo íntimo y lo político, entre lo individual y lo grupal. Mujeres por inventarse a través de la invención. Mujeres que a través del disfrute del conocimiento, alteran la visión de su realidad y la recrean, aportando así nuevas formas de vivir, de mirar, de contar y de escribir el mundo. La nueva apuesta de Helvéticas es “Viaje al centro del Deseo”, un taller de escritura terapéutica, coordinado por la escritora Raquel Campuzano y la terapeuta Nuria Guerra. Más información aquí: http://www.escuelahelveticas.com/page/somos-1

• Campus Relatoras 

Es la iniciativa más joven de Relatoras. Queríamos abrir nuestra escuela a mujeres que no estaban interesadas en la escritura. En el Campus ofrecemos talleres tanto presenciales (en Sevilla y en Madrid) como online, con una amplia variedad temática: fotografía, dinámicas psicológicas de las mujeres, coaching etc. El taller más exitoso, sin duda, es el “Señoras que… dejan de sufrir por amor”, coordinado por la antropóloga Coral Herrera Gómez. El curso va por su tercera edición online y se ha creado un laboratorio permanente con las más de 100 alumnas que ya lo han realizado o están haciéndolo ahora mismo. Nuestro objetivo es crear una amplia red de mujeres que reflexionen, dialoguen, se autocritiquen acerca del amor romántico patriarcal e inventen entre todas nuevas formas de querer(se) más sanas, igualitarias y placenteras.Entre los proyectos futuros podemos destacar un taller sobre maternidades, uno sobre violencia machista (coordinado por una autora feminista de renombre en España) y la puesta en marcha de un proyecto de coaching con perspectiva de género.

Nuestros talleres actuales

• Señoras que... dejan de sufrir por amor ONLINE

• Revelaciones de un mundo. La expresión de las mujeres a través de la fotografía. ONLINE

• Cartografía personal. La autoconstrucción a través de la fotografía. PRESENCIAL

• El viaje al centro del deseo. Taller de escritura terapéutica PRESENCIAL

• Escribo, luego soy. Taller de escritura autobiográfica. ONLINE

• A través del espejo de Alicia. De la autoficción a la ficción. ONLINE

• Caja de herramientas. Taller de escritura creativa. ONLINE

• Coaching para atrevidas. PRESENCIAL

story:
2. PENNSYLVANIA SEFERI!

30 AGUSTOS ZAFER BAYRAMINDA ERGENEKONDAN CIKIYORUZ!

TURK MILLETI SON SOZUNU FETULLAHN KAPISINDA SOYLEYECEK! ERGENEKON TERTIBINDE ESIR ALINAN VATANSEVERLERIMIZ ICIN, MILLETIMIZ ICIN, OZGURLUKLERIMIZ ICIN 2. KUVVAYI MILLIYE MUCADELESINI FETULLAH SEYTANININ KAISINDA BASLATIYORUZ!

Haydi somuruye, zulme karsi gelenler.
Haydi ozgurluk ve demokrasi icin mucadele edenler…
Haydi baskiya ve fasizme dur diyenler…

Orta cag karanligina karsi birlesiyoruz…

Gulen cemaati ve AKP`nin gizli ajandasini yuzlerine carpiyoruz…

KORKU IMPARATORLUGUNU YIKIYORUZ…

Bu kez daha kalabalik, daha guclu, daha kararli geliyoruz…

Emperyalizme karsi kazanilmis en buyuk zaferin yil donumunde ihanet sebekesinin merkezine iniyoruz….

Siyasi kimliklerimizi bir kenara biraktik Gulen Cemaati ve AKP`ye karsi tek yumruk olduk…

EYLEM TARIHI:31 AGUSTOS CUMARTESI

TÜRKİYE’DEN GELEN KONUKLARIMIZI AĞIRLAMAK VE ABD TV LERİNDE YAYINLANACAK EYLEM REKLAM FİLMİ İÇİN $15.000 İHTİYACIMIZ VAR DOSTLAR. LÜTFEN ELİNİZDEN NE GELİYORSA YAPIN…

Siyasi kimliklerimizi bir kenara biraktik Gulen Cemaati ve AKP`ye karsi tek yumruk olduk…
EYLEM TARIHI:31 AGUSTOS CUMARTESI
TÜRKİYE’DEN GELEN KONUKLARIMIZI AĞIRLAMAK VE ABD TV LERİNDE YAYINLANACAK EYLEM REKLAM FİLMİ İÇİN $15.000 İHTİYACIMIZ VAR DOSTLAR. LÜTFEN ELİNİZDEN NE GELİYORSA YAPIN…

story:
***** CAMPAIGN UPDATE *****

<3 This Indiegogo campaign has been canceled. <3 

Those that have contributed to the campaign will be contacted after 10/31/2013, and will receive the packages which they have so graciously purchased. 

The "Bee-Friendly: BeeSWeek 2013" educational DVD will be released and made available for sale online this fall 2013. 

<3 Bless Bees and Buy Educational DVDs. <3

Special Thanks

Written by Alisha "Bee" Forrester Scott
Founder, Pollinator Support Movement

If you've helped in any way with the expansion of Pollinator Support Movement, to me you are an Angel.  Thank You to everyone who has made it possible for me and us to "get this far" on such few financial resources.

Those that have previously financially contributed, joined PSM during the summer membership drive, or have offered their special talents and abilities to the process, will be mentioned in the DVD ending credits.

Thank You to Lainie "Sevante" Quirk and Ivan Weiner of Albuquerque Film & Media Experience (AFME) for inviting me to present BeeSWeek 2013 on behalf of PSM during their inaugural film festival event.

Thank You to Cecilia Sadler and Scharles Wilder for providing me with comfortable accommodations during my temporary residence in Albuquerque.

Thank You to Alan Cronick and the team at The Mattress Firm (NM) for providing the capital donation which allowed PSM to afford filming of the BeeSWeek 2013 events at University of New Mexico.

Thank You to the staff at University of New Mexico (UNM) for their support of the BeeSWeek 2013 project.

Thank You to the members of the New Mexico, Hawaii, and Bay Area California public media, for providing me with opportunities to talk about BeeSWeek 2013 in print, television, and radio.

<3 And especially, Thank You to the BeeSWeek 2013 panelists, who contributed their own financial energy to this process. <3

Learn More

More information may be found online at the Pollinator Support Movement blog website.  The URL is www.pollinatorsupportmovement.com.  

Contact

You are invited to reach me at (978) 254-7428 is (978) ALISHA-8, or, doyoulikefood@gmail.com.

story:
Campaign Summary

Victims of domestic violence often turn to religious leaders for help. Families in immigrant communities especially turn to their faith leaders, as they fear that an official report of domestic violence might jeopardize immigration status for the entire family. 

Unfortunately, few faith leaders are equipped to counsel their congregations about domestic violence, and even contribute to the culture of silence about the issue by not addressing it in worship services. 

For over 2 years, the Interfaith Center of New York and CONNECT NYC have been conducting professional trainings for religious leaders, to give them the skills they need to bring help to their communities, and provide victims with resources they can use to regain their safety, health and happiness.  We want to continue this important work, but can't manage to sustain the program without help.  

All donations to this campaign are fully tax deductible, and all money raised (even should we exceed our target amount) will be used to conduct training classes for religious leaders, and counsel them as they launch DV support projects in their respective communities.  Our goal of $5,000 would enable us to continue this valuable mission, and through the work of faith leaders around New York City, extend a hand of trust, safety and guidance to victims of domestic violence.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can contribute or not, please know there are other important and effective ways to support this program! 

Click the "Email" button above to SEND AN EMAIL to your friends letting them know about this campaign.

Click the "Like" button above to SHARE this campaign with your friends on Facebook.

Click the "Tweet" button above to Tweet about the campaign.  

Tracking Our Progress

Periodically during the program we will invite religious leaders to submit text, photos or video expressing what they are learning from the training, and how they plan to put their knowledge and resources to use in their respective communities.  These submissions will be made available to everyone who contributed to this campaign.

For more information, please contact Kevin Childress, The Interfaith Center of New York Social Media Manager, kevin@interfaithcenter.org.

story:
Hi there,

 

Thank you for visiting our page.

Our PayPal issues have now been resolved.

We are ready and waiting to process your contributions.

 

 

Thanks so much from all here on the FirstWorks Team!

 

 

The Situation...

Over 15% of persons under 25 years of age are on the live register. This lack of education, disparity of access and high levels of youth unemployment is one of the major social issues in Ireland today. Yet companies in Ireland source approximately 55% of their high level ICT skills from inward migration and there is an ongoing vacancy rate of 4-5% for ICT skills.

Our Solution...

Through intensive, targeted training programmes in IT, financial services and other critical skills that today’s employers are looking for. Along with extensive, meaningful internships in top companies, the First Works programme will provide a new outlook for students, exposing them to a culture of success that inspires them to maximise their full potential. Equally, companies will benefit from talented, diverse, determined young people that they wouldn’t otherwise find.

The Impact...

In Ireland we have built a team of three dedicated and passionate professionals - Mary, David and Siobhan. We have also partnered with Dublin City University to provide the unique First Works training programme. First Works is modelled on Genesys Works (http://www.genesysworks.org/), an American organisation that has already demonstrated the success of such an approach for both students and companies. Participation in the First Works programme will allow young people from disadvantaged backgrounds to reach their full potential.

The Roll-Out...

To launch the pilot of the First Works programme, we need to raise a seed fund of €18,000. This funding will be used to support the development of the programme content/materials and oversee the roll-out of the pilot. Once we meet our funding goal, the pilot will launch this September with 25 students from the Donahies Community School in Donaghmede, Co.Dublin.

The Result...

A student's future should not be defined or limit by their background. By supporting this campaign you have a unique opportunity to give others the chance to redefine their futures and change the trajectory of their lives. If you can not support First Works financially, please spread the word about our campaign and keep up to date with us on Facebook and Twitter!

Thank you!

The First Works team, 

Siobhav, David, Mary (Volunteers)

story:
Basics

"LifesEdge" is a colaborative, practical program designed to prevent fatalities by instructing teenagers to recognize, intervene, and provide remedial action to save lives.

High-School students are taught effective tactics to use in response to critical, life threatening situations, while indirectly creating a sense of unity and instilling the principals of ethics, compassion, and good judgement.

Our program is already being implemented in the curriculum of some Los Angeles High Schools. 

We are raising funds to:

  • Incorporate as a non-profit and apply for 501(c)3
  • Build and Launch Website
  • Begin scaling 

 

Details

High School and College students are taught effective tactics to use in response to critical life-threatening situations, while indirectly creating a sense of unity and instilling the principles of ethics, compassion and good judgement.

"Life's Edge" is an educational experience that reminds us all how quickly a life can end if not dealt with immediately and effectively. 

"Life's Edge" is designed to take place during the school day, in a school assembly or durring Physical Education periods, depending upon the comprehensiveness of the program desired. The program has been developed to provide different levels of preparedness, depending on the school's (district) level of commitment.

Our program provides students with the awareness to determine whether a friend's condition is life threatening. This knowledge and these skills once absorbed will resonate in the young mind. The student will be empowered and develop the ability to evaluate and analyze all types of situation in everyday life; an ability and set of crucial skills not directly taught in schools. Our program starts with the youth to foster a world of educated and aware members of society that have consideration for the need of others.

For more information Email: alecgh1@gmail.com,  agellis01@aol.com, or alyse.eden@gmail.com

story:
Celebrating the Anthem's 200th Birthday

with the gift of new tools for teachers

These will include first-ever recordings of early American patriotic songs connected to Key's anthem and a book of sheet music with all the songs featured on the recording. The award-winning 2 CD set and accompanying book will bring American history to life in our classrooms — through the magic of music!

<< click to listen to our world premiere recording of anthem as heard in 1814 >>

I am Mark Clague, a musicologist at the University of Michigan and a specialist in the history of American music (see my bio).  I've enlisted the talents of my amazing colleagues, choral director Jerry Blackstone (bio), tenor Scott Piper (bio) and organist James Kibbie (bio), as well as our incredible students to create all-new, historically informed recordings of Francis Scott Key's "Banner," plus its historic precursors and subsequent parodies. You'll be surprised to find out how much there is to learn about our national anthem!

<< click to see a list of songs we recorded and want to publish with your help >>

<< click here to see a list of everyone who is performing in the project >>

Why Study, Teach, Learn, and Sing Francis Scott Key's Anthem?

I believe that "The Star Spangled Banner" is so well known as to be surprisingly unknown. Very few know the song's real history. Yet, the story of Francis Scott Key's anthem and the ways that Americans have used it to express their feelings about our nation offer a unique educational opportunity not only to celebrate Key's lyric, but to consider the meaning of citizenship today. The story of "The Star-Spangled Banner" is the story of America — with all its stars, stripes, strife, and triumphs — and with your help, we can get students from kindergarten through high school across the nation to celebrate, sing, and think about the Banner and help celebrate the song's upcoming bicentennial.

What We Need

  • We need money to pay for the the design, printing, and publication of a two-CD set titled Poets & Patriots: A Tuneful History of "The Star Spangled Banner" and its informative historical booklet. It contains over 30 Banner variants, piano and organ arrangements, and other patriotic songs. (Click for track list.)
  • We need additional financial support to typeset, design, and print an anthology of the musical scores we created to perform the songs featured on the recording. The book will be titled The Star Spangled Songbook.

What You Get

  • You get both the good feeling of helping K-12 students and teachers as well as your own reward in the gifts described along the side ===> of our campaign description. ===> These are our way of saying "thanks" for your financial support.

<< Listen to "To Anacreon in Heaven" -- source tune for Key's anthem >>

How to Help Us

Click the "contribute" button at the top of the page and select your perk. You can pay with any major credit card, directly from this site.  When you get your statement, the charge will be listed as "First Giving," not Indiegogo, since we are raising funds for our federally recognized 501(c)(3) non-profit — the Star Spangled Music Foundation. This means that a portion of your contribution is tax deductible! JUST CLICK "CONTRIBUTE" TO GET STARTED...


Project Impact

Publishing the Poets & Patriots recordings and the Star Spangled Songbook will realize a dream I've been pursuing in my teaching and research for over a decade, yet my devotion to this project appeals to bigger goals:

  • To share the amazing story of "The Star Spangled Banner" with every K-12 student in the United States.
  • To build a coalition of informed teachers excited about teaching the anthem.
  • To correct misinformation about the Banner—for example, the tale that someone other than Francis Scott Key connected text and tune. In fact, Key knew "The Anacreontic Song" well and had used it for patriotic poetry before, notably a song titled "When the Warrior Returns," which we've recorded for the CD.
  • To show how the art of music and the creativity of Americans has helped us navigate crisis and imagine ourselves as a nation.

Our Success So Far

We are not seeking funds to make the recordings or to do the basic research to identify and edit the musical scores. This work has already been paid for by grants from the University of Michigan's Office for the Vice President for Research, Humanities Institute, and its School of Music, Theatre & Dance, as well as a Sight and Sound subvention from the Society for American Music. However, these grants cannot be used for publication or distribution expenses—which is why we need your help.

We are especially excited that the National Endowment for the Humanities has funded the U-M American Music Institute's summer teacher training program "Banner Moments." It will feature a performance — including our scores — by baritone and art song scholar Thomas Hampson at the U.S. Library of Congress! With your help, each of the thirty teachers participating in the institute will receive both the CDs and the Songbook.

Our Stretch Goals...

If we exceed our initial goal of $11,700 (and I'm keeping my fingers crossed for good luck), we will use any extra funds to develop further educational materials, videos, and curriculum guides to be distributed for free on our website. Additional funds will help spread the word to teachers nationwide through educational publications and advertising. In fact, we have so many more ideas and programs, some already underway and some awaiting fundraising, that our success here will inspire us to be even more ambitious. See, for example, our Star Spangled Stories Contest and the National Star-Spangled Music Day planned for September 12, 2014. We will put your donation to good use. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any donation helps our cause and helps build our coalition. Yet while we need money, there are many ways you can put your excitement about our anthem anniversary project into action:

  • Shout about our campaign on your Facebook page, Twitter or other social media.
  • Like our Facebook page, follow us on Twitter, and sign up for email updates.
  • Tell a teacher about our plans—share links to the educational materials we've already created for our website and YouTube channel. Tell them to join our national Star Spangled Teachers Network for more information. 
  • If you're interested in volunteering for the Star Spangled Music Foundation to share your skills and contacts to advance these projects, please email info@starspanglemusic.org.

The Star Spangled Music Foundation

SSMF is a federally recognized U.S. 501(c)(3) non-profit organization formed to spark a national celebration of "The Star-Spangled Banner" bicentennial in September 2014 with a continuing mission to provide materials on American song to teachers for the benefit of K-12 and college students across the nation. The foundation is led by two music historians—board chair Mark Clague and executive director Susan Key. For more information, see http://www.starspangledmusic.org

THANK FOR JOINING TEAM SSB 200!

story:
"OMFG, I'M IN! Can't stop smiling, heart is beating insanely fast, I can't hide my excitement. You know what i mean? I opened my email and there it was. The best response-acceptance-letter EVER. 'You're accepted to join Exosphere'. Don't know? Exosphere is THE ultimate entrepreneur-focused education project, where they learn how to program, generate and validate ideas, design thinking, do this, do that and ALL while creating and empowering the super-creative environment of COMMUNITY! Ok, maybe I'm a little bit freaked out, but you know what? I'm too excited to stop! Just the idea of incorporate and improve all these skills I need to become an awesome entrepreneur and a dream-builder, is driving me insane!"

WOW, did you feel that? Amazing, huh? Welcome to Mission Exosphere. Here you'll meet Alexandre, a 20 year old Brazilian software developer:


Behind this sexy mustache, lies a dream: To become an entrepreneur who'll change the world. After starting his BT in System Analysis, Alexandre developed an enormous passion for programming. However, he soon realized that college wouldn't be enough, so, he started to pursue knowledge, and discovered an enthusiastic learner inside himself. Alexandre started to go deeper into his interests and soon college became boring to him. However, one subject got his attention: Entrepreneurship. With an amazing instructor, Alexandre started to study about Entrepreneurship and couldn't avoid to became more excited as he entered the entrepreneurial world. All sounded beautiful theoretically, but in the real world, it's not that easy. Despite the fact he had an amazing instructor, Alexandre realized that the knowledge about entrepreneurship learned in college was at all, superficial. He knew that to become a good entrepreneur, he'd need more than that. He'd need to be immersed in an amazing environment, supported by an amazing community sharing the same passion and eager to help each other become better entrepreneurs. Based on that, he started his search and soon, Alexandre ran into Exosphere. At this moment, everything changed.

On March 29, 2012, American entrepreneur Skinner Layne posted his 27 Theses of Education Reform to the Internet, distilling his years of thinking about the problems with contemporary education, entrepreneurship, and the needed reforms. He envisioned remaking the University into a place of open inquiry, curiosity, customized learning, entrepreneurial exploration, and community-building. Unsatisfied with the purely technological solutions to the problems with education, Skinner argued that we must preserve the human elements of learning, interaction with other people, and the exchange of ideas in person as well as online--fusing technology and physical-world experience into a seamless and unified whole. This was the beginning of Exosphere. He was Antonio Manno, an experienced Italian entrepreneur and soon after by Carlos Miceli, an Argentinian wunderkind who had personally experienced the pains of the traditional educational system and had forged his own path in life. They were supported along the way by Skinner’s long-time close friend and business confidant, Andy Ellwood, one of the leading business development experts and practitioners in the start-up world. Together the four of them tried several approaches to turn this vision into reality. On September 23, 2013 a diverse group of 27 people from 11 countries, and spanning in age from 19 to 57 arrived in Santiago for Exosphere’s first entrepreneurship boot camp. From this small beginning, the Exosphere team is setting a new course for the way we learn, work and live and are spreading this vision to the world.

"I came to Chile the first time last May because I sensed there was something I was missing in the traditional education and I wanted to explore alternatives. I fall in love with the vision and mission of Exosphere. Since I’ve been involved in the Exosphere’s experience I have a much clearer understanding of the world, I’ve learned many new skills, I continually challenge myself and try to pursue my personal growth, I’ve discovered that a lot of my prior assumptions were wrong and that better and more effectve alternatives in education, learning processes, personal relationships and life’s principles and perception are here available and waiting new and more people to join them."Niccolò Viviani

In September 2013, Exosphere started their first 12-week Boot Camp for entrepreneurs. They gathered 27 people from different parts of the world and managed to, make them become not only better entrepreneurs, but better people, with an unique experience, as told me those participants:

"3 months ago, I decided to leave my job to participate from Exosphere boot camp. At the time, I was scared, afraid of how my future would be after that decision. Now I feel that my life will never be the same. Everything changed with Exosphere. After meet amazing people from different parts of the world and improving skills that made me able to raise money quickly, I can say that being part of this community completely changed my life and made me a better entrepreneur and person."Alberto Brandão
"Exosphere was lifechanging. When I look back at myself three months ago, I can't believe what a different person I am. I have a completely new set of values, a career I wouldn't have imagined, and the most supportive community I've ever been around. The world would be a better place if Exosphere was the norm instead of university."Zach Obront
"The biggest thing Exosphere has given me is a renewed hope for a better world. It's amazing how much my fellow boot campers have grown and it's impressive the challenges they are venturing to take on. As long as this group of people is out there innovating and changing the world, I know it will always be an exciting world to live in, and a better world for our future." Florencia Di Sarli

In November 2013, Exosphere announced their upcoming Boot Camp for entrepreneurs, that'll happen from March to June 2014, this time, for 45 people. To be an Exosphere Boot Camp participant, you must answer a form developed by Exosphere team and pass through a selection proccess, where you'll be evaluated based on their selection criteria. This is where young Alexandre comes in. After about 24 anxious hours, he received an email telling that he'd been approved and selected to participate Exosphere Boot Camp. However, despite all the hapiness for his approval, he caught himself with a problem: Raise money to get there. Unfortunately, our young mustachioed hero can't afford with the trip costs, that, summing everything needed(Tuition fee, housing, 3 month support), will cost about $10,000.

Alexandre could only follow two paths: Give up and move on with his life, or chase this golden opportunity that can change everything. Guess where his knowledge hunger guided him? After brainstorming with some buddies, he realized that it'd be a really tough task to do it alone. So, with their help, he started Mission Exosphere: A killer crowdfunding campaign that can make his Exosphere Boot Camp participation become true.

And that's where you, my fellow reader, can make the difference! This young man needs your support to make his way to Chile. There are few ways to help him, each one of them is unique and will make him react differently. Something like that:

OMFG, even I'm excited now with imagining his reaction with my contribution. And you? What are you waiting for?

I would never have made it without the help of some awesome people and I'll be ALWAYS grateful to you. That's one of the ways I found out to thank you all. At first, Alberto Brandão, the one that introduced me Exosphere, gave me all the support to apply and once I got accepted, helped me every day. Without him, I probably wouldn't be here now. Fabrício Tozzi, that was always solicitous to help me with text and video and was ALWAYS cheering me up and encouraging me to go on. Zach Obront, Florencia Di Sarli, Skinner Layne, Carlos Miceli, Niccolo Viviani and Rocío Hedman, that helped me out with tips for my texts, ideas and video for my pitch. Piotr Yordanov, that also helped me with tips and is such an inspiration to start crowdfunding. And last, but not least, my finacée, Karine Carvalho, that made this AWESOME cartoon and supported me all the time!
story_txt:
"OMFG, I'M IN! Can't stop smiling, heart is beating insanely fast, I can't hide my excitement. You know what i mean? I opened my email and there it was. The best response-acceptance-letter EVER. 'You're accepted to join Exosphere'. Don't know? Exosphere is THE ultimate entrepreneur-focused education project, where they learn how to program, generate and validate ideas, design thinking, do this, do that and ALL while creating and empowering the super-creative environment of COMMUNITY! Ok, maybe I'm a little bit freaked out, but you know what? I'm too excited to stop! Just the idea of incorporate and improve all these skills I need to become an awesome entrepreneur and a dream-builder, is driving me insane!"
					

						WOW, did you feel that? Amazing, huh? Welcome to Mission Exosphere. Here you'll meet Alexandre, a 20 year old Brazilian software developer:
					

						Behind this sexy mustache, lies a dream: To become an entrepreneur who'll change the world. After starting his BT in System Analysis, Alexandre developed an enormous passion for programming. However, he soon realized that college wouldn't be enough, so, he started to pursue knowledge, and discovered an enthusiastic learner inside himself. Alexandre started to go deeper into his interests and soon college became boring to him. However, one subject got his attention: Entrepreneurship. With an amazing instructor, Alexandre started to study about Entrepreneurship and couldn't avoid to became more excited as he entered the entrepreneurial world. All sounded beautiful theoretically, but in the real world, it's not that easy. Despite the fact he had an amazing instructor, Alexandre realized that the knowledge about entrepreneurship learned in college was at all, superficial. He knew that to become a good entrepreneur, he'd need more than that. He'd need to be immersed in an amazing environment, supported by an amazing community sharing the same passion and eager to help each other become better entrepreneurs. Based on that, he started his search and soon, Alexandre ran into Exosphere. At this moment, everything changed.
					

						On March 29, 2012, American entrepreneur Skinner Layne posted his 27 Theses of Education Reform to the Internet, distilling his years of thinking about the problems with contemporary education, entrepreneurship, and the needed reforms. He envisioned remaking the University into a place of open inquiry, curiosity, customized learning, entrepreneurial exploration, and community-building. Unsatisfied with the purely technological solutions to the problems with education, Skinner argued that we must preserve the human elements of learning, interaction with other people, and the exchange of ideas in person as well as online--fusing technology and physical-world experience into a seamless and unified whole. This was the beginning of Exosphere. He was Antonio Manno, an experienced Italian entrepreneur and soon after by Carlos Miceli, an Argentinian wunderkind who had personally experienced the pains of the traditional educational system and had forged his own path in life. They were supported along the way by Skinner’s long-time close friend and business confidant, Andy Ellwood, one of the leading business development experts and practitioners in the start-up world. Together the four of them tried several approaches to turn this vision into reality. On September 23, 2013 a diverse group of 27 people from 11 countries, and spanning in age from 19 to 57 arrived in Santiago for Exosphere’s first entrepreneurship boot camp. story:
Introduction.

Hello! Thank you for taking the time to check out my Campaign!

My name is Renzo Rebuffo, and let me introduce you to my new start-up called SpillOut.  SpillOut is an app specifically designed to help ease any student’s collegiate life, by bringing the classroom to the palm of their hands. It is a virtual study group, open 24 hours a day for the duration of a class or semester. What makes this App unique is having the option of subscribing to a chat room with all of your classmates that are taking the same course as you, without the need of giving out any personal information.

This idea dawned on me one day as I was sitting at home panicking about missing class due to a bad cold that kept me home for over a week.  I thought about emailing the professor to see what I missed, when I remembered that on the syllabus, the professor wrote in bold:

"MISSED CLASSES ARE ON YOU! I WILL NOT REPLY TO EMAILS THAT ASK, "WHAT DID I MISS?" SO TRY TO STAY HEALTHY". 

Great professor huh?? LOL... And being that I'm a little shy, I never got around to asking my classmates for their numbers, or email addresses.. So in the end I read some chapters, but was completely lost during the next few classes......... sound familiar?

This is one of the reasons I decided to create SpillOut.

Now, let's learn a little more about it!

What is SpillOut?

SpillOut is a social networking app designed for college students, by a college student. It will unite social networking and the classroom into one, allowing students to connect with each other and discuss class work anytime of the day anywhere in the world, through their Smartphone.  By allowing students to create individual chat rooms for each of their courses, students will have the ability to communicate with everyone in their class through their cell phone without having to share personal information.

Imagine that! Having a group chat for every class you are taking a semester! How convenient!

Students are no longer held to communicating with the few sitting around them, because normally that is what happens. Studies show that most of the time, students will only get to meet 4-5 students from each class. And generally, these are the students who sit nearest you. Now, with SpillOut you can communicate with every single person in that class room.

Think about it!

Study groups no longer have to take place in the same room, with SpillOut, you can message your classmates directly and discuss quizzes, homework, or readings from the comfort of your home. SpillOut also helps you organize your school life by providing you with dedicated features strictly made to alert you when homework, assignments and quizzes take place or are due.

The main features include:

  • Class-Course Chat Rooms- A class chat room can be created by any student from any College or University. The teacher has no control over this chat room, meaning comments or posts are not monitored. The chat rooms are created easily by selecting simple criteria to identify your class like: school name, teacher, time, and course number. Then, once a classroom is made, any student in your class can easily search for the chat room by typing the criteria in the 'search for chat room page’ and register for the chat. When registered, a student will be able to message the entire class and everyone will see what topics are being discussed.  The best part about it is that, at the end of the semester every course automatically closes.



  • Classmate Book- Basically an address book. This feature allows you to see classmates which you have added to your personal contact list. These contacts may be classmates who you talk to constantly, or you consider a friend.



  • Direct Messaging: With this feature you are able to message the classmates you have added to your contact list, privately. Here you can hold conversations, transfer files to each other, and hold private study sessions with a single classmate.



  • Class Schedule: This feature works as a dedicated calendar for your school work. Here you can note quiz dates, homework' deadlines, and any reminders for school related activity.

       


Many more features are to come once the App goes live. However, with these basic features, students will have the means to talk directly with each other about that one specific course they are taking that semester. 

About myself, and what is my Goal?

To tell you a little about myself, I am 25 years old and I am a student at Florida International University (FIU). As a current student, I know the feeling of being on campus having to go through the uncomfortable struggle of meeting new people every semester for not just one course, but sometimes up to 4-6 at a time. Which is great, we students want to meet new people and make new connections. But there has to be a simpler way of connecting with everyone. Asking each and every person for their contact info is awkward at times, and sometimes makes you feel a little embarrassed.

My goal is to make an application that allows you to connect with your classmates in a simpler way. And also, an application that makes communicating in school safer. An app that puts everyone together with just a few clicks.  

The Impact

To date, there is no App with these capabilities for students to interact with each other. This App will allow students to talk outside of class without constricting them to be someplace physically, like in a library or on campus. You will be able to discuss school work, while still being able to take care of your personal responsibilities. College students have been waiting for an application that facilitates academic communication and this will solve that problem. 

I have learned that students want to help each other, and learn better by working together, but some students have demanding schedules: Some have families and children of their own, or like most of us, a job, and cannot make time to meet on campus for study groups. This App makes it much easier for students to connect. 

Privacy

Don’t you wish you didn't have to give out your cell phone number and email address as often to people you do not know? I feel the same way; however, it is the only way to effectively stay in touch with classmates. And from my point of view, as well as other students with whom I've discussed this with, agree that we shouldn't have to share personal information in order to stay connected in school. 

There ought to be another way! And SpillOut is the solution.

Consider this:

Students, imagine yourselves having a question about a topic you didn't understand in class, and being able to ask the entire classroom for their perspective.

Forgot the pages to study for next week’s exam? Ask the classroom!

Picture you are absent from class, and as soon as you know the class is over, you message your classmates to see what you've missed.

Or think of this, you are stuck in traffic and need to communicate to the teacher that you are running late.  Now, you will have the option to message a classmate directly and have them tell the teacher for you, because honestly, if you email the teacher, they will not see the email until well after the class is over.

The scenarios are endless and an app like this can definitely help us out!


Current Progress and Fundraising

As of today, I have designed all of the Front-End wire framing for the app. I have mapped out the app completely and I now need a developer to implement the app.  But unfortunately, I do not have the sufficient funds to hire a professional developer. This is an idea and concept that I have been brainstorming and researching for many months and with your help will be launching by the end 2014.

I have not raised any money from an individual or company. As a student and full time employee, I have tried my best to put aside as much money as possible to start this project. My main focus has been to get this app started as far as I could without outside funds, but unfortunately, it will take me a couple of years to gather the money I would need to launch this by myself. Together with your generosity, I hope to get the app off the ground and developed.

·  To have the App developed in both iOS and Android platforms I have been quoted by the developing company $10,500, which is what I will need to get this started. 

·  Another $1,500 will go towards the designing and launching of the SpillOut official website.

With your help I will make this dream come true. And more importantly give our fellow classmates a way to communicate better. 

Live Preview:

You can click on the link below for a live preview of the first prototype I made for my app:

https://www.fluidui.com/editor/live/preview/p_1tplrXFKrexdvcsOWfEEsVvJribf7mxZ.1397748922421


Other Ways You Can Help!

If today you cannot contribute monetarily, I’d hugely appreciate you sharing my project with all of your friends!

I know it’s not going to be easy but I have wanted to do this for a long time. I am a strong believer that our ideas and words mean nothing until we put them into action. I believe in this and I know that it can be something great now and for future generations to come.

Thanks again for taking the time to check out my campaign!

-Renzo Rebuffo

Credits: Luis Ogando, Graphic Designer.

story:
Creator Space

First, Southern California. Next... The World!


Enabling Technical Learning

Providing Access To Creative Tools


Check out the perks... In addition to the created items, EVERY contributor will have access to the creative space and instructional assistance. If you cannot redeem your personal creative perk, you CAN give it to someone who can: friend, family member or a local student!


The Pitch...

Ever dream of using a tool you just can't afford to buy? Maybe just for that one special project? To make a prototype or a gift, but no one you know has it. Now there is somewhere to go... The Creator Space! Pay just for the time you need to use a Plasma Cutter or CNC/CAM Router. By the hour. Or buy a membership for unlimited hobby use. Creator Space - Time Share Workshops!

Tinkering. Designing. Building... However you look at it, we all long to be creative. Some paint. Some dance. You are a Maker. A Creator. Or you call yourself an Experimenter, or Tinkerer, or Inventor. Regardless, we have a bit of oil and electricity flowing in our veins. We think in mechanisms and circuits. Unfortunately few experimenters and hobbyists have the financial resources and tools to fully engage our "Inner Engineer."

The Creator Space will make tools and space available to community members, allowing them to use costly and complex equipment normally beyond the reach of the average tinkerer, inventor, or experimenter. These include: Plasma CAM System, Laser Cutter and Engraver System, Oxy/Acetylene + MIG and TIG Welding Center, Electronics Bench, Woodworking Tools and more...


Here Is The Plan...

You need a welder... Drop in to Creator Space for a couple of hours and get it welded. Quick repairs or ornamental works of art. MIG, TIG and Gas.

A design calls for a programmable plasma cutter ... Program your cutting plans at home and head over to Creator Space to whip them out on the Plasma CNC in just a few minutes. Build your dream project quickly. Or... Create your prototype and head to Shark Tank!

A wedding present needs laser engraving... Pop the wine bottle in the engraver at Creator Space and voila! Or make wooden, plastic or metal ornaments and children's toys.

Set up your electronic project and build it. Fully-equipped electronics workbench at Creator Space with soldering iron, multiple-output bench supply and all the hand tools you need. Testing and troubleshooting equipment ready if needed, including oscilloscope and logic analyzer. Even a selection of parts, if missing that last piece!

Here is a wild idea... Have a Creator Class party! Invite a group of friends to the Creator Space to learn the Plasma CNC and MIG Welder and each build a project to kick off a new hobby of creating and building. Know anyone in Scout Troops, Ham Radio Clubs, School Clubs, Knitting Groups, Sewing Bees, Book Clubs, Church or Singles Groups?


How The Creator Space Works:

The use of Creator Space facilities and equipment will be based on a recurring monthly membership or pay-as-you-go (hourly menu) basis. Similar to the traditional gym membership, but without the problems of over-enrollment and waiting for a turn.

Members will be allowed access to equipment following training in safety and tool use. Equipment lock-out exists until an access code is given after training. After-hours access through RFID and video security control once training is completed.

The Creator Space will provide the tools and space for men and women, teens and families, to explore their engineering creativity. For the Creator in us all!


I need YOU to assist the community!

To turn my dream into reality I need funds to purchase:

  • Concrete Pad and Steel Building - 30' x 40'
  • Electrical Wiring, Plumbing and Restroom
  • Electronics Work Benches with Hand Tools and Test Equipment
  • Plasma CAM, Laser Cutter/Engraver Systems
  • Wood Lathe, Table Saw, Drill Press, etc...
  • Gas and Arc Welding Equipment
  • Computer Design Center with Laser Printer and 3D Printer
  • Computer Security, Access and Monitoring System
  • Public Awareness and Outreach


Once we build one Creator Space, We'll start another. And another. And another. We will put workshops in every town across the nation!


Your Perks - Member Practice & Teaching

Your perks will be designed and created by the people you are assisting. While members learn how to use the systems and equipment

  • 3D Hanging Window, Mirror or Tree Decoration
  • Double Coaster Set
  • Customized 6" Tall Steel Name Plate
  • Customized12" Tall Steel Family Name or Ranch Sign


Thank You for your support!

If you choose to assist me, BRAVO and Thanks!!!

If you instead choose to assist other causes, "Thank You!" for your generosity and assistance to others achieving their goals and dreams.

But most of all, Thank You for giving up a little of your time. Please tell others you know about the opportunities on Indiegogo to get dreams achieved and passions funded...

Enabling Technical Learning
Providing Access To Creative Tools
Check out the perks... In addition to the created items, EVERY contributor will have access to the creative space and instructional assistance. If you cannot redeem your personal creative perk, you CAN give it to someone who can: friend, family member or a local student! The Pitch...Ever dream of using a tool you just can't afford to buy? Maybe just for that one special project? To make a prototype or a gift, but no one you know has it. Now there is somewhere to go... The Creator Space! Pay just for the time you need to use a Plasma Cutter or CNC/CAM Router. By the hour. Or buy a membership for unlimited hobby use. Creator Space - Time Share Workshops!Tinkering. Designing. Building... However you look at it, we all long to be creative. Some paint. Some dance. You are a Maker. A Creator. Or you call yourself an Experimenter, or Tinkerer, or Inventor. Regardless, we have a bit of oil and electricity flowing in our veins. We think in mechanisms and circuits. Unfortunately few experimenters and hobbyists have the financial resources and tools to fully engage our "Inner Engineer."The Creator Space will make tools and space available to community

beyond the reach of the average tinkerer, inventor, or experimenter.

Woodworking Tools and more...Here Is The Plan...You need a welder... Drop in to Creator Space for a couple of hours and get it welded. Quick repairs or ornamental works of art. MIG, TIG and Gas.A design calls for a programmable plasma cutter ... Program your cutting plans at home and head over to Creator Space to whip them out on the Plasma CNC in just a few minutes. story:
Hi folks…I don’t do this often, but today I’m calling out for your HELP with something I’ve been working on. As you might know, I’ve been living in a very special place as of late…Bali. And for me, what makes Bali so special is the Balinese people themselves. They are the most reverent, honorable, gentle, gracious, and humble people that I’ve ever met. I love being there and being their humble guest.

 

In my short time there, I’ve wanted to give back in some way. One day I decided to speak to the head of the village I live in and I posed the question, “How can I help?” The first words out of his mouth were, “The school. They need the most help.”

 

The school is the only one in our small village and serves 100, K-5 students. I then set up a meeting with the head of the school and met with several teachers to find out what their biggest needs were. To my surprise, the most needed item was chalk! If this was their situation, I wondered what other vital needs the school would have. I proceeded to inventory all the items that were in need. They consisted of general supplies like writing instruments, notebooks, chalk, chalkboards, musical instruments (they have one old keyboard that no longer works), PE supplies (they have only one soccer ball for all 100 students), biology models, teachers’ rulers, art supplies, classroom maps, etc. etc. etc.

 

After making the list, the village head and myself went to the nearest big town and priced out all the items necessary to supply each child and classroom with what they needed for the rest of the year and hopefully some of next school year.  The cost came out to be $5000 for all necessary and immediate supplies. This amount will provide what’s necessary now, but won’t get them through the next school year. This will essential buy supplies for 150 students, which gives them a 50% buffer on supplies. But ideally, I would raise $10,000 which would get them through the entire next school year!

 

I return to Bali on 12/17 and will be purchasing these items myself and delivering them to the school. All funds go 100% directly to buy school supplies and I will stay in control of said funds until all items have been purchased and delivered. My ask is that you become part of this project and find it in your heart to donate any funds that you can. If 100 people donate $100, we are there!

 

I would have loved to get super creative, and make a video and flashy website for this cause, but life lately has left me with little time. But none of that matters in the end. What matters is that these children get the necessary supplies so that they have the same chances that we all want in life. Thank you humbly for helping the children in the village of Nyuh Kuning, Ubud, Bali.

 

SUMMARY:

Project Name: The Bali Elementary School Fundraising Project

Project Summary: This project aims to supply the Nyuh Kuning Elementary School and its 100 students (k-5) with much needed supplies.

Project Description: Fund raising for small Balinese elementary school.

Funding: Seeking donations totaling $5000-$10,000USD

Fund Usage: classroom supplies (chalk boards, maps, scientific models, musical instruments, PE equipment, etc.), student supplies (writing instruments, notebooks, art supplies, musical instruments (they have one old keyboard that no longer works), teachers’ rulers, art supplies, classroom maps, etc. etc. etc. (100% goes directly to school needs, minus donation site charges (indiegogo.com)).

Designee: Myself. I will personally purchase and deliver all materials.

How You Can Help: Donate any amount you can!

story:
UPDATE:
By popular demand, YOU can now get the T-Shirt too!

WE MADE IT!

 

And that in LESS THAN 12 HOURS! WOW! THANK YOU!!!

 

 

 

Here's the Big Idea:

I'm a self-financed (bootstrapped) Norwegian startup entrepreneur in Cologne, Germany and I've recently been invited to receive the official Lean Launchpad Instructor training and certification at Stanford, California from professor Steve Blank, one of the godfathers of Silicon Valley, the father of Customer Development and the grandfather of the Lean Startup movement.

Blank teaches the Lean Launchpad curriculum at Stanford, Berkeley, Colombia and more on Customer Development, Business Model Generation and the Lean Startup Methodology. It's a big deal in entrepreneurial education. Harvard Business Review recently published an article about why.

And in between founding my own startups, I also teach at our universities because I am incredibly passionate about creating more capable entrepreneurs in our region and great entrepreneurial education is one of the pillars of a great startup ecosystem.

Now I want to take it to the next level and officially bring the most amazing educational program for startup entrepreneurs to Cologne and build a bridge from Silicon Valley, Stanford and Steve Blank to us in Cologne.

And that's not all! I've also been asked to hold a talk at Stanford about our Cologne ecosystem, what makes us unique and what we are doing over here and I think it would be a damned shame if we'd lose out on this incredible opportunity to get our voice heard in Silicon Valley, at Stanford, in front of Steve Blank himself!

And YOUR help is needed to build this bridge over the Atlantic because I believe this should be a team effort. This is not about me. It's about us in Cologne, about our future as a leading startup city, and we should all be able to own a part of this effort to lay these first fundamental building blocks.

Because for a nominal one-time effort, together we can bring the world's leading startup entrepreneurial education from Stanford to Cologne and gain an awesome advantage for our ecosystem for years and years to come - AND to get our voice heard and be noticed in the birth-place of the startup.

What's Needed & What You Get

I need around 1.999,- EUR in total for the flight, accommodation, sustenance and some pocket change. I have the great fortune to have been offered the educational program and certification at Stanford for free, which means we don't have to pay the 3.300,- USD fee on top of that.

Economy Flight:               800,-
Late booking due to short notice unfortunately made it pricier

Discounted Accommodation:625,-
blackbox.vc will graciously host me at a discount for 10 nights

Sustenance:                     308,-
22 a day for 14 days; yes it's a more expensive place than Cologne

Pocket Money:                   266,-
Taxi, bus, rails, unexpected stuff, etc. 19 a day for 14 days

IndieGoGo Fee:      minus ca. 42,-

Which leaves us at a aproximate total of 2.000,- and I'm putting my money where my mouth is and paying half of that - So now we only need 1042,- to make this happen.

If we are unable to reach the goal of 1042,- within June 16th - I will not be able to go. I will not be able to share our story about the Cologne startup scene at in Silicon Valley, at Stanford, to Steve Blank and the other international students. There will be no bridge to the Valley, no amazing startup entrepreneurial education to take home to Cologne, no  incredible advantage for our ecosystem for years to come.

If we however manage to beat the goal, I promise to donate every cent above the goal towards the next Startup Weekend Cologne 2014 and name each and every one of you as official private sponsors of that amazing event!

And what do I have for you in addition to the satisfying feeling of supporting entrepreneurial initiative and great entrepreneurial education in our region and getting our scene represented in Silicon Valley and helping to make great things happen for a lot of people for years to come?

Well, I thought it would be only fair to give you something more material on top of that, so I created some unique gifts and rewards to each and every one of you supporting this venture in entrepreneurial education for Cologne.

I'll share the insights shared with me at Stanfrod exclusively with you and I'll also help your startup or company create content and publicity from and in the Bay Area.

On the right hand side of this page, you'll see the assortment of unique rewards for you as a sponsor.

Who Am I and Why Should You Trust Me With This?

My work with startups have been featured and recognized around the world and I lecture at select European universities on startup entrepreneurship.

In addition to founding my own startups, I volunteer for several well known and international entrepreneurial organizations and communities, I am a certified instructor with NEXT Cologne and I've met Steve Blank on previous occations.

In the past, I co-founded the Plone content managemen system used by The FBI, The CIA, NASA JPL, Yale University and many more.

Currently, F100 enterprises like Deutsche Telekom trust me to consult them on Corporate Entrepreneurship.

And you can learn more about me and keep track of me on twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, my blog and some references from other people.

Only Together Can We Make This Happen

I know there's a lot of you out there who are just as a scruffy bootstrapping startup founder as me and some of you are students so I'll totally understand if you are not able to contribute. I can relate to that and we're obviously still cool. No worries.

However, everybody is able to contribute by sharing the link to this campaign and share the message on twitter, on facebook on email and carrier pidgeons and smoke signals and so on. The more we reach, the more likely we can make this happen. The more we REPEAT sharing, the more likely. So don't be shy to click those share buttons over and over again. That's the only way to reach above the noise of the social media stream and make people notice.

So it is INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT to USE THOSE SHARE BUTTONS here on this page AGAIN AND AGAIN so we will be able to reach as many as possible and make this amazing thing for Cologne happen!

 

NEWEST: The Awesome Value Pack

Can't make up your mind? Get all three of the following rewards and super-save!

 

NEW! Wear the heart of Cologne

I'm adding a brand new perk to celebrate that we made it! YOU are the heart of the Cologne startiup scene - And now you can wear it and share it everywhere you go! (And of course there's also a t-shirt cut for WOMEN - just make sure to mention which you want, w/m, EU size, A or B color!) Order now on the right hand side->

SHOW Don't Tell: Love That Sticks!

We know Cologne LOVES startups. Now here's the obligatory laptop startup sticker to show the world! Get yours before they run out. Order now on the right hand side->

 

Let's Spend an Evening Together and Share about the Trip to Silicon Valley

When I come back, I'll throw a unique one-time seminar sharing what I learned from the training at Stanford from Steve Blank, the latest in Lean Startup, Customer Development and what I picked up from visiting a lot of companies in the Valley - over free beer and snacks. You know it's just going to be awesome meeting up, so don't miss out! Reserve one of the few limited tickets before they run out! Order now on the right hand side ->

YOU can Bring the Lean Launchpad to YOUR City or Corporation NOW

I already do this for NEXT and F100 corporations. And now for you too: I'll come to your city or corporation - any where in the world - and run a cohort of the Lean Launchpad curriculum - the premium entrepreneurial education program known from Stanford and Berkeley - for a max of 10 teams, 1-5 persons per team over a 5 week program. All inclusive - for a limited time only! Pre-book now as price and availability may very likely change after I come back. Order now on the right hand side ->

story:
Short Summary

The Hummingbird Education Fund was created with the vision of helping underprivileged women pursue post-secondary education in engineering, health sciencies, natural sciences, medicide or law. This Fund was created because education is one of the most important means of empowering women with the knowledge, skills and self-confidence necessary to effect social change.

The Impact

Did you know that in Canada, 30% of women have only had the opportunity to obtain a high school diploma and another 25% have not even had the chance to finish high school?. In fact, only 19% of women in the country actually have a post-secondary education.  This can pose a great challenge in terms of employment income and quality of life. 

Your donation can change the quality of life of many women by  empowering them through post-secondary education. It is widely-known that an empowered woman can effect possitive change in a community.  The more we educate our women, the higher the reward for the community in which they live. 

The Hummingbird Education Fund was created to award scholarships to women who do not have the financial means but who have the will and determination to pursue a university education.  These awards are meant to help recipients to pay for their tuition and other university expenses throughout their university program.  Of course, there are mechanisms in place to ensure that recipients can only access the next scholarship instalment once we have proof of good academic performance. 

The award is intended to support women who fall in one or more of these categories:

  • Single mothers
  • New immigrants
  • Refugees
  • Family income below the poverty line

There are many women of all ages – be they teenage mothers, new immigrants or women who have unexpected life struggles – who have not had an opportunity or means to pursue their dream of a post-secondary education. Let's together make a difference in the life of these women!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this information with people in your community and get them involved in changing the life of underprivileged women through this Fund!

There are many women of all ages – be they teenage mothers, new immigrants or women who have unexpected life struggles – who have not had an opportunity or means to pursue their dream of a post-secondary education. Let's together make a difference in the life of these women!
Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this information with people in your community and get them involved in changing the life of underprivileged women through this Fund!

story:
Hello all!

 

Is time for Education, Empowerment and Change in our Latino Community. For more than 4 years LYHEP has been the voice of the Newcomer (Less than 4 years in the US) students and families in the NYC area. 

 

Now we need your help, we are raising funds for our summer/Fall program and all the money we raise will be used to take parents and students in college trips and to purchase chrome books for them to do research and help towards their education.

 

We will pay for college trips (Parents and Students) - Approx $5k

We will buy food for our students in every session and trip - Approx $4k

We will purchase a Chrome book for every participant (20-30 students) - Approx $9k (if 30 students)

We will give stipends to our volunteers - Aprrox $2k

 

Check our application:

 

http://www.scribd.com/doc/139876550/Camino-al-Futuro-College-Readiness-Program

 

Your support will benefit more than 20 students in NYC, that have been in the city for less than 4 years, they will get inspired by our volunteers and will visit colleges and universities with your help. 

 

JOIN OUR MOVEMENT AND SHARE THIS WITH YOUR NETWORKS!

 

Contact us at:

 

info@lyheprogram.org or via social media at: www.facebook.com/LYHEP or www.twitter.com/lyhep.

 

We need your financial support! Get involve.

 

Gracias!
