story:
Hi!

My name is Stacy. I have been teaching this particular martial arts for about 10 years now and I have finally decided to open my own school. Over the past 10 years we have helped children and adults with their set goals, whether it be gaining self esteem, learning to defend themselves, or just plain physical fitness.


In starting this we have put our heart and soul into making a great school where our students and their family members feel safe and at home.

But...

Martial arts studios are one of these community resources that has to run as a for-profit, but, in practice, runs similarly as a non-profit, due to we are more in the field of education than a sport.


For us, we would rather focus on the education of our students than on profiting from them. We prefer to enrich our students and their families' lives, at the same time making the community around us a stronger one.

We are here to help people learn to defend themselves, whether it be a six year old learning to defend against a bully or a 70 year old gaining the confidence to fend off an attacker.And this is why we need your help.

By helping us over that first year hump you help us continue helping the local community and being a community resource for years to come.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will mainly go to one of a few things:

1) We need a lighted outdoor sign for our new school. These aren't cheap!

2) To be good neighbors, we are installing some sound-damping treatments. We have not gotten any complaints yet, being respectful of others is in our student creed.

3) Supplies, things like crash-mats, kicking targets and foam swords.

4) Continuing operational expenses.

What you get:

1) Perks starting at : Everybody who contributes  at least $1 or more gets their name on plaque near the front door of the school!  Other perks at different levels of support include t-shirts or 

2) The good feeling of knowing you are contributing to a community resource that helps children teens and adults.

 

The Impact

The impact of starting martial arts at any age is that you not only gain self confidence and self discipline, but you become all around healthier in your daily activities.
The advantage of learning goal setting, self confidence, self discipline, self defense and a good exercise routine at any age are numerous, (and can even help at the office).


By helping to keep us as a community resource, you are literally contributing to the health of the community.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

> We also have an Amazon wish-list, contact us for the link!

> Tell your friends! share us on Facebook, Twitter, G+, or offline over coffee!

Thank you!

story:
Overview / Resumen

We are a group of friends who, worried about the low quality education that children in poor communities of the Dominican Republic receive, decided to act. We implemented our first project this past summer, when we hosted a summer camp for children in Los Higos, Jarabacoa, a rural and unprivileged community in the Dominican Republic.

This three-weekend-long summer camp was designed to contain fun, educational activities for children ranging in ages 9-11. The content was based on the idea of meaningful play, which would allow the children to have fun while at the same time learn the values that we wished to encourage in them.  In order to make a stronger impact, we engaged the children’s families by visiting their homes to talk about their kid’s progress, as well as inviting them to a final presentation in which the children performed the play “The Little Prince.”

Throughout the summer camp, we realized how much these children needed our support and the great impact that it was having on them. Thus, after an incredibly successful summer, we decided to find ways to continue to work with them. We have designed a 4-month workshop program, which we want to implement during the second semester of their school year with the purpose of helping them continue to grow at an intrapersonal, interpersonal, and academic level. 

[ Somos un grupo de amigos que, preocupados por la baja calidad de educación que reciben los niños de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, decidimos actuar. Nuestro primer proyecto fue implementado en el verano del 2013, cuando realizamos un campamento sin fines de lucro para los niños de Los Higos, Jarabacoa, una comunidad rural y poco privilegiada de nuestro país.

Este campamente tuvo una duración de tres fines de semana y su programa contenía actividades divertidas y educativas diseñadas para niños entre 9 y 11 años de edad. El contenido se basaba en la idea del juego con sentido, el cual permitiría a los niños recrearse y al mismo tiempo aprender los valores que deseábamos inculcarles. En miras a tener un mayor impacto, involucramos a las familias de los niños a través de visitas a sus casas para hablar del progreso de sus hijos, así como también invitándolos a una presentación final en la cual los chicos recrearon la obra “El Principito”.

Durante este campamento nos dimos cuenta de cuán necesario era nuestro apoyo para esos niños y el gran impacto que estaba teniendo en ellos. Es por eso que, luego de un verano increíblemente exitoso, decidimos seguir buscando maneras de continuar nuestro trabajo con ellos. Hemos diseñado un taller de 4 meses llamado “Espejos y Sueños”, el cual será implementado en el segundo semestre de su año escolar con el propósito de ayudarles a seguir creciendo a nivel interno, interpersonal y académico.]


What We Need / Lo Que Necesitamos

We have a $1,500 target (of $3,000 needed in order to complete the full program) to cover our needs during these 4-month workshop. These funds will allow us to reach 20 children in the community of Los Higos, Jarabacoa during a 4-month period. The costs include:

- Weekly travel to the workshop location

-  Supplies and books for 20 children

-  Paid guests who are experts in different fields (sex education, environment, art, etc.)

 - T-shirts for 20 children and instructors

- Food and drinks

[Tenemos una meta de US$1,500 (de US$3,000 necesarios para poder llevar a cabo todas las actividades del programa) para cubrir nuestras necesidades durante el taller de 4 meses. Estos fondos nos permitirían llegar a 20 niños en la comunidad de Los Higos, Jarabacoa durante ese periodo. Los costos incluyen:

-  Transporte semanal a la localidad del taller

-  Material gastable y libros para 20 niños

-  Invitados expertos en diferentes áreas (educación sexual, medio ambiente, etc.)

-  Camisetas para 20 niños y 4 instructores

-  Comidas y bebidas]


The Impact / El Impacto

Your contribution will help provide a unique opportunity for children who receive a very low quality education, with little to no personalized attention. Throughout the second semester of their school year, they will receive individualized, quality attention two days per week. One day will be entirely focused on academic tutoring, with the purpose to improve their learning experience and motivate them to excel. The second day will be focused on meaningful play, designed to help them develop a strong self-esteem and a values-based leadership. 

[Tu contribución ayudará a ofrecer una oportunidad única a niños que reciben una educación de muy pobre calidad, sin la atención individualizada necesaria para su aprendizaje y desarrollo. 

Durante el segundo semestre de su año escolar, recibirán una atención personalizada y de calidad dos días a la semana. Un día estará enfocado completamente a tutoría académica, con el propósito de mejorar su experiencia de aprendizaje en la escuela y motivarlos a ser excelentes. El segundo día estará enfocado en el juego con sentido, diseñado para ayudarles a desarrollar una fuerte autoestima y un liderazgo basado en valores.]

What You Get / Lo que Obtienes

In return for your contribution, you will receive any of the perks that you choose!

A cambio de tu contribución, podrás recibir cualquiera de los regalos a mano derecha que elijas!

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word!

-  Share the link to our fundraising page on your Facebook of Twitter page

-  Use Indiegogo’s share tools

Thank You!

story:
Introduction

If you would like to see more women in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) fields, here is a chance to directly support that goal.

Dana Whitmore is a young woman seeking a degree in a STEM field -- bioengineering, to be precise. She has a plan for her academic career and a goal for how she wants to apply her learning after she completes her education. She selected a university not for convenience, or ease of studies, or to stay connected with friends and family, but instead with laser-sharp focus on a specific academic program.

Montana State University offers more research opportunities for undergraduate students than is typical for a research-focused institution, allowing Dana to explore and pursue her interests while streamlining her career path after school. Engineering graduates from Montana State enjoy high levels of placement as well as strong starting salaries. Completion of her coursework at MSU will offer a solid launch for her STEM-focused career.

Academic Performance

Smart, dedicated, and competitive, Dana sets a high standard as a student. An AP class teacher wrote about her, "[A] rare combination of intellectual rigor with a degree of humility makes Dana an ideal scholar." She has great grades and was well within the top 10% of her high school graduating class. She participated in track and lettered in lacrosse, played bass clarinet in band and wind ensemble, and pitched in to help on school theater productions. During high school, Dana spent countless hours volunteering for a variety of organizations, handling tasks ranging from transcribing videos and audio recordings, to restoring trails, to guiding new students at school. She's an AP Scholar with Distinction (see what that means). She's an Honor Society member. She has academic awards adorning her walls. She is delighted that she has a room assignment in a quiet, all-female dorm, on a floor that is set aside for female engineering students.

When Dana found out, during Orientation on campus, that Montana State has an Honors program that she could try for, she sat down and wrote an essay with zero preparation. She promptly qualified for entry into the program, despite having had little sleep and a long road trip from the Seattle area.

And then... Finances

What does Dana not have? She lacks a wealthy family to support her through college. While financial aid covers a large part of her estimated cost of attendance (primarily through loans), and although she received a scholarship to bring the cost of her attendance from the out-of-state rate almost down to the in-state rate, there's still a significant gap that was expected to be covered by a parental loan -- a loan that is simply not possible for her financially-struggling family.

Dana started at MSU as a Freshman in Fall 2013. Classes began in late August, and by early August she needed to have paid her bill for tuition, housing, dining (the least expensive meal plan, which does not even include weekends), and various fees. To the extent that work study is a part of her financial aid package, any funds from that would not be available until well after the bill was due. Still lacking sufficient funds when it came time to pay the bill, Dana used a deferred payment plan to split the payment into parts. The remaining payments will be due soon.

This Crowdfunding Project

All funds raised through this Indiegogo project will go into an education-only account. We don't expect to be able to raise the tens of thousands of dollars that are actually needed, but every dollar will help. Even a $1 donation helps the visibility of this project on Indiegogo.

If you would rather not donate but prefer to buy something directly, please see the variety of items available in the Dana's Dragons shop on CafePress. (The bulk of the price of those items goes to CafePress, but the small markup will go toward that same education-only account.) If you can't, or don't want to, spend anything at all but would still like to support this effort, please share this project on Twitter, Google+, Facebook, or any other social network. The sharing buttons on this page will simplify spreading the word about this project. Your support is deeply appreciated!

story:
From a very young age I, Ryan Long, have seen the value of sports and the unique way it opens people up to learning important life lessons and working together.  As a player learning teamwork, or as a coach working to instill leadership qualities in youth, I saw how sports can be much more than just a fun activity – it can change people’s lives for the better.

While coaching American football in Hungary I began to recognize how sports can be used to build relationships that foster understanding between people from different backgrounds.  This understanding is foundational in a peaceful society.  Because of my passion to see people live to their potential I am working towards an MA in Human Security and Peacebuilding at Royal Roads University in Victoria, Canada.

My wife, Erin, our two children, and I are relocating from Oregon, USA to Skopje, Macedonia to work with the Boris Trajkovski International Foundation (BTIF) to fulfill my degree’s requirement of a six-month internship.  (To learn about the good work that BTIF does please visit http://www.boristrajkovski.org/en/.)

Macedonia is a very diverse country with a long history of various people groups residing in the region. In 2001 the conflict between Kosovo and Serbia drove tens of thousands of refugees into Macedonia, a country of around 2 million people. This large influx of people placed great stress on Macedonia society, leading to conflicts between the ethnic Albanians and ethnic Macedonians. These tensions have remained a point of stress, causing the eruption of ethnic violence as recently as 2012.


While in Macedonia I will develop a sports program that will bring the diverse ethnicities in Skopje together to play sports and enable people from the different groups to build trust and friendships that strengthen society. This will be accomplished through weekly gatherings where participants will play sports together and learn life skills, from healthy living to conflict resolution to leadership skills. Most importantly it will give them a safe, fun environment to get to know one another and build friendships. These relationships have the potential to positively impact many aspects of Macedonian society as these youth learn the value of ethnic diversity at a young age and bring about unity that has yet to take root.

BTIF is unable to provide a salary so we are raising our own funds for the internship. We need to raise a total of $12,500 to cover flights, health insurance and living expenses, including rent. We hope to raise AT LEAST $6,000 through this campaign. 

We appreciate any support you can give as we begin to work towards building strong cross-ethnic relationships in Macedonia.

To get updates before and after our move, please follow Erin's blog, Home & Grace.

Macedonian society as these youth learn the value of ethnic diversity at a
young age and bring about unity that has yet to take root. 
BTIF is unable to provide a salary so we are raising our own
funds for the internship. We need to raise a total of $12,500 to cover flights, health
insurance and living expenses, including rent. We hope to raise AT LEAST $6,000 through this campaign. 
We appreciate any support you can give as we begin to work
towards building strong cross-ethnic relationships in Macedonia.To get updates before and after our move, please follow Erin's blog, Home & Grace.

story:
Short Summary

Hello Everyone,

For the past couple months we have been seeking Jesus's face and asking him what's next for us and our nation. We really felt that the Lord was speaking to our hearts about change not only for us in our personal lives, but our nation as well!

We believe that Jesus wants to do something big in our hearts and our city, so we are putting on a conference Friday, May 16th and Saturday, May 17th. The overall vision of the “Change” conference is that every attendee has a radical encounter with Jesus Christ that changes their life forever. 

We have a special keynote speaker named Isaiah Saldivar who is the leader of a group in California known as "The Awakening 209". Isaiah has spoken at many churches including Morningstar, Bethel, and among many other well known ministries. Below you will find a link to a 3 minute video clip for you to check out. We believe that every person will come out changed! We're expecting God to move like never before. We want to experience God together! 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Zi-pq1tPMc


This campaign is more than just funding our goal of $1,000. It's about coming together as one group of believers and supporting what God wants to do. We believe, at this conference,God wants us to encounter him like never before. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help in funding our goal of $1,000. This will help us cover expenses for the conference, and will help us promote the gospel of Jesus Christ.

Your Impact

Your impact, whether you give $5 or $100 will be much appreciated. We want to thank you in advance, and we pray that God would bless you as you give into the kingdom. We are not pocketing any donated finances, the purpose of this campaign is to fulfill the vision the Lord has given us.

Other Ways You Can Help

We want to ask that you would please keep us in your prayers, and please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! We understand that you may not be able to financially support the "Change" conference, but we would like to encourage you to come out Friday, May 16th and Saturday, May 17th to the special free evening service starting at 7:00 p.m.

For more information or questions please contact us at 847-717-4878 ext.11 or check out our website at:

http://www.familylifechurch1.com/change-confere...

God Bless,

Conference Coordinating Team

story:
(*Though the campaign goal was set for $5,000, the real need far exceeds that amount. Let's see if we can double the goal and raise $10,000 by the time the campaign ends on Thursday!*)

Troy Davis (an innocent man on Georgia's death row executed in Sept 2011) wanted more than anything for his nephew De'Jaun to achieve his educational dream. 

In the fall of 2013, De'Jaun took his first steps towards that dream by beginning his 1st year at Morehouse College, pursuing a dual degree in engineering and physics (and making Dean's List 1st semester while he was at it!)
De'Jaun's ability to attend Morehouse was enabled by the generosity and solidarity of scores of supporters who believe in this young man and want to ensure he's able to build the future he deserves.

Now it's time to raise tuition for De'Jaun's 2nd year at Morehouse!

For folks who have not yet contributed, this is your opportunity! Whether you watched De'Jaun grow up as you worked side by side with his beloved mother Martina, were inspired by his speaking about his Uncle Troy's case at an NAACP or Amnesty International youth conference, or learned about his growing into a powerful activist from I Am Troy Davis--it is clear to all who have encountered De'Jaun that this phenomenal young man deserves our support.
We're trying to raise $5,000 for De'Jaun's college tuition from folks who have not yet contributed---we need your help to meet that goal!

The Impact is not just on De'Jaun alone!

De'Jaun intends to use his engineering degree in ways that will have far-reaching impacts (for example--he spoke to me about his involvement in an organization called Green For All Engineering, through which he educates young students about "going green" and the importance of environmental safety through engineering.) He also intends to continue to serve as a mentor and role model for other youth with dreams who may not see a clear path on how to achieve them.

    If you can't make a donation at this time, here are some things you can do!

    • Make some noise about this campaign--use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram!
    • Email Jen Marlowe at donkeysaddle@gmail.com to ask her to let you know in the future when De'Jaun's tuition is due once again.
    • Purchase an I Am Troy Davis T-shirt--proceeds go directly to De'Jaun's college fund! (Email Kimberly Davis at aug1970@bellsouth.net for more info)
    • Purchase a copy of the book I Am Troy Davis  and learn more about De'Jaun, his incredible family, and their ongoing fight to end the death penalty!

story:
Save Our Sanctuary 

Raising Up Nations World Ministries (RUN) is a non-denominational church focused on ministering equally to the spiritual, emotional and physical needs of the community.

RUN was founded 7 years ago by our senior pastor Kim R. Jacobs.  RUN preaches the good news of Jesus Christ, with a special emphasis on the youth who are not the church of tomorrow, but the church of today.  Pastor Jacobs is a professional educator who specializes in teaching teens who have been deemed too “troubled” to be taught in a mainstream environment. Prior to going into education, Pastor Jacobs worked with the Florida Department of Children and Families, and the Florida State Prison System. Her experiences with these often discarded members of society taught her several major lessons: Everyone is worth saving, Everyone is worthy of love and Everyone is important to God. With these ideas in mind RUN embraced the idea that only way to preach the gospel is to BE the gospel.

RUN has been renting our current location for the past 3 years while saving to buy the campus. The agency that leases the building to us has shut its doors, thus considerably speeding up our timeline. We must come up with a sizable down payment to ensure that we can stay in what has become our home. Our current location is centrally located in our city, making it easier for those who attend our services and utilizes out programs to find us. We already serve a sizable population and would like to increase our impact on the local community. Our current and future initiatives include:

  Food Pantry

  Clothes Closet

  Tutoring Program

  Mentoring Program

  Daycare Program

  After-School Enrichment Programs

  School for Challenging Students

Dance and Mine Classes

  Computer Lab

  Technology Training Programs

  Adult Daycare Program

  Senior Center

  Fitness Center

  Health Education

  Prison Outreach

  Counseling Programs

  Support Groups


In order to go into negotiations with the bank, we must raise no less than 15% of the final purchase price.  We need your help!

In the event that we do not meet our minimum goal, the funds will still be used to secure a permanent home. Any surplus funds will be used to finance new and continuing outreach programs to benefit youth in our community.

The Daytona community has a distinctive lack of educational, and enrichment, programs for youth. Crime rates with this age group continue to rise, and one of the easiest ways to prevent this is to invest our future by investing in the youth. Many of our programs can provide students with viable alternatives to hanging out in negative environments.  We know that we are asking for a lot, but we are a church that still believes in miracles and the power of human kindness.

If you are reading this, and would like to help but are not in the position to do so at this time, please share this link with everyone one that you know.  Every prayer, good thought, and dollar will help us reach our goal.

Thank you, and God Bless You!

story:
Short Summary

Gillian was selected to play for the Southern California Strikers/Slammers FC USA girls soccer team, after only 3-years of experience and 2 at the club level, at the Lennart Johansson Academy Trophy soccer tournament in Sweden!!! The team will be playing at one of the premier international youth soccer club tournaments in the world. Currently, Gillian is the youngest player of the 18 girls on the team roster.

The tournament takes place between May 30th and June 1st just outside of Stockholm, the Swedish capital. The team will be departing for the event on May 26th and returning, hopefully tournament champions, on June 2, 2014. 

The tournament is named after Lennart Johansson, who was the 5th and longest serving president of the Union of  European Football Association (UEFA) from 1990 to 2007. The tournament attractsthe top youth and academy programs from clubs across Europe including: Liverpool FC, Tottenham Hotspur, Atletico Madrid, RCD Espanyol, and Vfl Wolfsburg, FC Barcelona and many others.   For more information about the tournament check out their website http://lennartjohanssontrophy.se/.


What We Need & What You Get

We need help getting Gillian to the tournament. Please consider donating to help make her dream come true.

What she needs to get there:

  • The team organizers have put this soccer tour together: $5,000 (+/- depending on the exchange rate) includes her and her chaperone's airfare (round trip from US to London to Sweden) hotel accommodations, transfers, tour bus and guide. 
  • Meals are not included
  • For every $100's donated, you will receive an autographed picture of Gillian which will be worth some value someday :-)
  • Updates on Gillian and team's progress
  • You will be instrumental in making her dream of playing soccer internationally a reality!

The Impact

Gillian eats, sleeps, and breaths soccer. She currently plays competitive club soccer for the Strikers/Slammers organization on the girls under 13 team for Tustin. She displays tremendous skill on the field, being nicknamed “Fancy Feet" and "The Flash", and is quite driven, she wants to attend Stanford University on a full scholarship for soccer. The impact of international travel on her would be priceless, here are a few things that will leave a lasting impression on her:

  • Playing at the highest level for age group and going up against some of the best clubs Europe has to offer
  • Gaining additional soccer skills to add to her ever expanding talent arsenal
  • Experience playing in an international setting in front of a large crowd in an actual soccer stadium
  • Getting to experience the culture of a different country and getting outside of the OC "bubble"
  • Developing everlasting friendships with her new team, as well as fostering new friendship with the girls she will be competing against
  • She will be seen by coaches from around the world which could lead to more training, as well as a possibility of college scholarship or going PRO (She has big dreams!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Please note that there's a charge if you use your credit card or Paypal. There's always an option of sending me a check directly to my address to avoid the fees. I will add your name on the list of contributors.

If you wish to send a check, please make checks payable to April Marco and send it to the address below:

2480 Sunningdale Drive
Tustin, CA 92782

story:
Thus far I have been able to cover $2,000.00 of the $3,600.00 trip and need assistance raising this money because my family is not capable of securing these funds. With many factors being taken into account, I cannot leave campus to study abroad and since I have come on to campus it has been a dream of mine. With this Bucknell in Barbados trip, I will not only be allowed to take a class and receive a credit that allows me to be track to graduate next year, but I will also get that chance to get somewhat of my study abroad experience. 

I have been trying to get the school to give me funding since November of last year and the only type of funding they have given me, has been to approve me for two $1,000.00 loans to my endeavor, which are sadly not enough.

I'm not asking for a lot from each person, but all I am asking is that if you have a little bit to give I would appreciate it.

I would need this money within the next 7 days, by April 25th, 2014. 

If you cannot help please feel free to pass this along to someone who can, thank you for your time.

-Shaquille Anderson
